To do that she has applied for a loan to buy more ingredients to make the spices as a start until she has enough money to buy a small piece of land.

Since Khawla is a conservative person, she asked that her husband Waleed appear in the picture instead of her.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients to make spices

loans.name: Zaverio

texts.en: Zaverio is a 58-year-old, married man with 8 children living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a dream of educating his children up to higher levels. Zaverio owns a tailoring shop and he specifically deals in school uniforms. He has been in business for 15 years and the major challenge faced now is price fluctuations that result in high operational costs. His dream is to acquire a contract of supplying school uniforms in about 50 schools. Zaverio needs the loan to buy school uniforms for resale.

loans.use: to buy school uniforms for resale

loans.name: Paskali

texts.en: Paskali is a forty two year old married man with eight children. He owns a house in Kasese,Uganda. He has been dealing in clothes for four years.  Initially Paskali sold secondhand clothes but he now sells new clothes. His challenge is high commodity prices and his vision is a big boutique plus educating children. Paskali needs the loan  to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Cindy

texts.es: Cindy de 19 años de edad  y estudiante universitaria,estudiante de Contaduria Pùblica, es una joven que tiene grandes sueños, y diariamente trabaja para lograr alcanzarlos; entusiasta y emprendedora, desde muy niña ha mostrado sus dotes de gran comerciante, primero vendiendo dulces a sus compañera de clases y hoy genera sus propios ingresos, mediante una actividad independiente, porque ella vende productos por catálogos y tiene una miscelánea donde comercializa cosméticos, accesorios, artículos para el hogar, bolsos y calzados fabricados por su propia madre. Ella es muy conocida en su sector en la universidad y en muchos lugares donde llega pues siempre busca las mejores negociaciones para sus clientes, a quienes vende de contado y principalmente a crédito. Su meta es terminar su carrera universitaria y adquirir su propia vivienda y lograr el fortalecimiento y la estabilidad de su negocio. , en la actualidad su negocio genera una rentabilidad del 23,38( y una rotación de sus cuentas por cobrar de 25 días, indicadores financieros desde los cuales proyectamos su potencial crecimiento y auguramos el éxito de la inversión de su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a  la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará cosméticos y accesorios en oferta de sus revista, pues su experiencia le indica que debe estar lista para una de las épocas del año en la cual hay mayor repunte en sus ventas y no le quiere fallar a sus rentables clientes.
texts.en:
Cindy, 19, is a university student majoring in public accounting.  She’s a young woman with big dreams and she works daily to make them reality.  She’s enthusiastic and enterprising and has shown her great commercial gifts since she was a little girl first selling candy to her classmates and now earning her own income through an independent activity because she sells catalogue products and she also has a general store where she sells cosmetics, accessories, items for the home, purses and footwear manufactured by her own mother.  She is very well known in her sector in the university and in many other places where she goes because she’s always looking for the best deals for her customers that she sells to for cash and mainly on credit.  Her goal is to finish her university career and get a house of her own and to strengthen her business’ stability.

At present, her business has a 23.38% profit margin and a 25-day accounts receivable turnover.  With these financial indicators we are able to predict potential growth and augur success for the investment of her Kiva loan, the first financing she gets from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she’ll use to buy cosmetics and accessories that are on special offer in her catalogues because her experience has taught her that she must be ready for one of the seasons of the year when sales spike and she does not want to disappoint her profitable customers.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and accessories from her catalogues that are on special promotion

loans.name: Aisalkyn's Group

texts.en:
Aisalkyn is the leader of this group. She is 62, and together with her husband, who is a retiree, she has raised a son and two daughters. All the children are married. The daughters trade in the bazaar and the son is a farmer. In 1998, the family sold some part of the harvest and, with the profits gained, they purchased cattle. Since that time Aisalkyn has been breeding cattle and reselling it after fattening. Her husband and son help her in running the business. The monthly profit from this activity is about 3000 soms. With the money received from the loan, Aisalkyn wants to purchase more cattle for breeding, fattening, and reselling. In the future, Aisalkyn plans to repair her house with the profits gained from reselling cattle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Dorah

texts.en: Dorah is divorced with one child and that child goes to school. She has a beauty salon and she has been in this business for four years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT–SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of cream relaxers and braids. She works seven days a week.  Her business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She aspires to own a bridal salon. She resides in a home that she rents and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes rent, medication and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers and braids

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. 

Evangeline has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 15,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. 

Evangeline has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Evangeline hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Marcia Hellen

texts.es: Marcia de 43 años de edad, originaria de la ciudad de León, casada madre de 4 hijos, todos ello están en la secundaria, ella es comerciante, tiene 11 años de vender ambulante ropa, zapatos, carteras, cosméticos, artículos para el hogar. Inicio con ayuda de su esposo ya ella quería ganar su propio dinero y aportar en el hogar en un negocio que le permitiera estar cerca de sus hijos y al mismo tiempo trabajar pues ya no quería solo ser ama de casa necesitaba ser mas útil según doña Marcia nos cuenta, hoy en día ya tiene su propia clientela fija y ha salido con su negocio  poco a poco. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería de ropa, zapatos, calzado, cosmético pues se acerca las fiestas navideñas y ella quiere tener mercadería nueva para vender. Por lo pronto quiere comprar maniquíes y vitrinas, pues en lo futuro quiere poner su propia tienda de ropa y zapatos.
texts.en: Marcia, 43, is from the city of Leon.  She is married and has 4 children, all in high school.  She has worked as a street vendor for 11 years, selling clothing, shoes, wallets, cosmetics and other products.  Her husband helped her start the business.  She wanted an income of her own and a way to contribute to the family's earnings.  Dona Marcia tells us that the business allows her to both take care of her children and work at something other than household chores.  She has built her business little by little and now has a regular set of customers.  She will use this loan to buy merchandise for the business that she will resell.  Next she wants to buy mannequins and display cabinets for the store she wants to open one day.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her retail business.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: Maria Del Carmen es una mujer que siempre ha luchado por generar ingresos para el hogar, como madre de 6 hijos siempre se ha preocupado por brindarles un mejor futuro, actualmente tiene su negocio que es la venta de mercadería en general donde vende calzado, trajes para niños, sabanas, cosméticos, tratamientos y reloj, pues para ella lo más importante es satisfacer las necesidades de compra de sus clientes, por lo que procura siempre tener surtida su inventario. Ella tiene la necesidad de surtir el negocio, pues se acerca una temporada alta donde las ventas aumentan y proporcionalmente las ganancias también, pero no cuenta con el capital para hacer las compras de un buen surtido, por lo que solicita un crédito que le permita mejorar las utilidades del negocio.
texts.en: María Del Carmen is a woman who has always striven to generate income for her home.  As the mother of six children she’s always been concerned about providing them with a better future.  She currently has a business selling general merchandise.  She sells footwear, children’s outfits, sheets, cosmetics, treatments and watches because it’s important for her to be able to meet customer needs so she always tries to have a varied inventory on hand.  She needs to stock her business because a high sales season is approaching so profits increase proportionately but she does not have capital to buy a good assortment of goods so is asking for a loan that will make it possible for her to improve the business’ profits.

loans.use: to buy assorted merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Chikaze B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Chikaze B Group in Western Kenya! With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Jotham and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Jotham is the facilitator for this group. He is in the photograph with his group members. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Chikaze B group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Jotham takes care of six children at home with his wife. He joined One Acre Fund in order to boost his maize production and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Jotham had a very good maize yield harvesting 13 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Jotham was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on 1 acre of land. With income from maize sales, Jotham will pay for major expenses such as school fees.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Mujeres Solidarias Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son D. la Cuidad D. Caacupé, son personas muy trabajadoras, ellas están muy agradecidas con la fundación porque gracias a las facilidades D. los créditos ellas pueden acceder a él y D. ese modo invertir en sus negocios y D. esa forma ir creciendo D. a poco para poder ayudar a sus hijos y familiares. Ellas desean llegar al máximo ciclo del programa D. mujeres emprendedoras, es por ello que trabajan duro.
La presidenta es la Sra. Myrian, quien vive con su marido e hijos en su humilD. casa en la ciudad D. Caacupé. Ella se dedica a la venta D. lencería, trabajo que la ha ayudado a aportar con los gastos D. la casa y D. esa forma contribuir con su marido. Ella junto con sus compañeras realizan constantes actividades para que D. ese modo puedan fomentar la integración entre las compañeras y tratar D. adelantar sus cuotas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. lencerías, tanto masculinas como femeninas, pues estas son el producto principal D. su negocio.
texts.en: The women of this Committee are from the city of Caacupé and are very hard workers.  They are very grateful with the Foundation because, thanks to the ease of the loans they can access and invest in their business, they grow little by little to help their children and families. They want to reach the maximum cycle of the program of women entrepreneurs, which is why they work hard. The President is Mrs. Myrian, who lives with her husband and children in her humble home in the city of Caacupé. She sells lingerie, work which has helped proviD. for the expenses of the house and thus helping her husband. She and her partners maD. constant efforts together, so that in this way, can foster integration between the partners and try to advance their quotas.  She is requesting a loan for the purchase of lingerie, both male and female, because these are the main product of her business.

loans.use: to buy lingerie for resale.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  ”RICCHARY CUSCO; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Amelia;  La socia tiene 44 años de edad, la socia es soltera, La socia tiene 2 hijos de 23, 13 años de edad;  La socia se dedica  a la compra venta y alquiler de andamios metálicos para las construcciones; La socia desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de materiales para la fabricación de andamios metálicos para las construcciones para poder pintar las fachadas y colocar vidrios y otros. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para la fabricación de andamios.

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Amelia is a member of the” RICCHARY CUSCO” communal bank, located in the Huanchac district, within the Cusco department and province.

She’s 44 years old, single, and has two children, ages 23 and 13.  She buys and rents out metal scaffolds for construction.  She would like this loan so that she can buy materials to make metal scaffolds to paint facades and other things.  She will also use the money to invest in supplies to make decorations.

She appreciates the loan and is committed to making her payments as agreed.

loans.use: to buy materials to build scaffolds.

loans.name: Oyundelger

texts.en:
Oyundelger is 23 years old and lives with her husband and son in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her husband helps with her business and her son is a kindergarten student. 

Oyundelger operates a grocery product trading business. She started her business in 2010 by renting a grocery shop. Even though she's fairly new to the business, she's a very talented business woman. Her customers are increasing, therefore she needs to increase her range of products. She 's a sharp and hardworking woman who's requesting 630,000 MNT to buy more products.

loans.use: to buy more products for her store

loans.name: Kayigboneh Group

texts.en:
Kadiatu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Kadiatu was born in Magburaka town. She is married to a teacher and the couple has three children – one in primary school and two in secondary. Kadiatu sells jewelry, shoes, toothpastes, etc. She has been a businesswoman for 10 years now. 

With the help of this loan, Kadiatu and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Kadiatu will use her share of the loan (1,000,000 SLL) to buy jewelry, shoes, toothpaste, toothbrushes, etc in bulk to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy jewelry, shoes, toothpaste, toothbrushes, etc in bulk to add to her business

loans.name: Charo Mungwari

texts.en:
Charo Mungwari is a 50-year-old livestock keeper in Mariakani. He is a married father of four. He has been selling livestock and livestock products for the past two years and he is doing great.

This is Charo’s third loan from KADET. He plans to buy more goats, cattle and chickens. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children and repay his loan. He hopes to have a successful family.

loans.use: to buy more goats, cattle and chickens

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a married man with six children, five of whom are enrolled in school while one is still too young for school. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family.

Emmanuel has operated a motorbike transportation business for the past four years; his potential clients are his neighbours and the local area community members. He dreams of improving his living standard. 

With the Kshs 10,000 he wants to purchase stocks of dry fish and fuel for his new retail business. He decided to join Yehu because of their favorable terms and conditions.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of dry fish and fuel for his new retail business.

loans.name: Diana Yaneth

texts.es:
Diana es una persona que a pesar de las adversidades que se le han presentado en la vida, ha tenido la fortaleza para poder salir adelante y generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Diana es una madre soltera cabeza de familia de 1 hijo de 4 años de edad, a quien su padre abandonó desde hace un tiempo sin contribuir económicamente para su sostenimiento. Es por esto que Diana decidió montar su propio negocio el cual le permitiera estar al cuidado de su hijo y a la atención del negocio en el mismo tiempo. Así fue como montó su restaurante en el cual ofrece gran variedad de productos y el cual ha tenido muy buena acogida por parte de sus clientes gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos. Diana busca que un préstamo le permita acceder a la compra de insumos para la preparación de sus comidas, pues actualmente tiene más pedidos por parte de los clientes de los que está en la capacidad de atender. 
Diana espera que de esta manera pueda aumentar las ventas atendiendo los pedidos de clientes que antes no podía atender. Además, Diana espera que su negocio siga saliendo adelante y sueña con que su restaurante crezca y le permita generar más empleo para las personas más necesitadas.
texts.en:
Diana is a person who, in spite of the adversities that have been presented to her in life, has had the fortitude to be able to advance and generate the necessary income to sustain her household. Diana is a single mother and the head of a family with a four-year-old son, whose father abandoned him some time ago without contributing to his financial support. It is for this reason that Diana decided to set up her own business, which would permit her to take care of her son and tend to the business at the same time. So it was that she set up her restaurant, in which she offers a great variety of products and which has had a very good reception on the part of her customers, thanks to the good quality of her products. Diana is seeking a loan that will allow her to buy ingredients for the preparation of her meals, since now she has more orders from her customers than she has the capacity to fill.

Diana hopes that in this way she can increase her sales, by filling the orders of customers who in the past she was unable to serve. Furthermore, Diana hopes that her business will continue to advance and dreams that her restaurant will grow and permit her to generate more jobs for the people most in need.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare food in her restaurant, since now she has more orders from her customers than she is able to fill

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe lives in yambio. She sells food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is 25 year old, married, and has two children; all of them are still in school. 

Phoebe heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans, sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the children’s school fee.

loans.use: to purchase beans, sugar for sale.

loans.name: Turfosa

texts.en:
Turfosa lives in the Kisii area of Kenya, which is scarce of available land. She has five children. Her primary income sources are milk and crops, and has been doing this work for 40 years.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Feeding my cow!" Her biggest challenge is "Getting cow feeds, which are expensive." Animals on the farm have been given the names of Nya kericho.

Turfosa was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied, "Because I wanted another dairy cow."  This client was also asked what she learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "That if a dairy cow is well maintained it can service a loan."

Turfosa's highest monthly expense is family expenses. When asked how this loan will benefit her family, Turfosa replied, "They will get extra income from sell of milk."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Turfosa owns the following: cow and poultry but not pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household mosquito net but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV or DVD.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: At 64, Nancy believes that she has not yet reached a point in life to give up working. Her 6 children are all independent but she takes care of 2 of her grandsons who give her company. These two grandsons are in primary and she is responsible for all the necessities. She joined WEEC and Kenyanjeru Women’s group 5 years ago and this has helped her in various ways. She was able to get a diary cow which she got as a loan in 2005, it’s fully paid up and she drinks milk as she wants while the balance is sold. She sells 5 litres a day giving her $42 per month. She saves this money to take care of her grandsons. She has tea and coffee not on a large scale but still gives her some $ 50 per month. She also grows beans and maize but they are seasonal. She hopes to increase output when she plants hybrid seeds and the main objective is to accumulate enough money to buy another dairy cow. With milk she will not go wrong because there is ready market because of the revival of Kenya cooperative creameries. Her grandsons will be assured of good education and to herself; she will enjoy her old age.

loans.use: Nancy wants to buy hybrid maize seeds and a water tank

loans.name: Ismayil

texts.en:
Ismayil is a 57-year-old well known welder in Yenikand village, Salyan region . He is married and has 4 children. He has been in this business for 10 years.
He needs a loan of $1200 to buy welding apparatus to satisfy his clientele. Ismayil is an honest and respectful man.

loans.use: To buy welding apparatus

loans.name: Epefania

texts.en: Epifania is 34 years old and has three children.  Not too long ago, her life changed abruptly when her husband was killed in a car accident.  In addition to her emotional loss, Epifania also faced a severe economic crisis.  She had never had a job before, and now needed to find a means to support herself and her three children.  Epifania joined the SPBD program in order to gain access to the capital to start her own business.  She began running a fishing boat with the help of some extended family, and she began to have some financial security.  However, her boat is now in sore need of repair, as is some of the fishing equipment.  Having repaid her first loan, she is now seeking an additional loan to make the repairs and upgrades necessary to protect her only income source.

loans.use: Repairs to fishing boat and equipment

loans.name: Yim

texts.en: A 32-year-old woman, Yim S., is a widow and lives with her four children in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. To meet her family’s expenses, Yim S. is both a construction worker and a farmer. She works on her farm growing rice crops and a variety of vegetables when she is free from her construction job. She earns about $5 each day, while three of her children (two are pictured here because Yim S. was unavailable to be photographed) help to finance the household by working as construction workers; the fourth child is a student. Yim S. is currently asking for a loan of $500 to purchase a plot of land to grow her rice crop and vegetables. She hopes to grow enough rice to have a reserve for the coming year. Yim S. is very grateful for  your help to make her family better.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of land to grow rice crops and some kinds of vegetables.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Ms. Gregoria is 44 years old, she is a widow and has 5 children, two of whom are boys and three girls. She tells us that, because of economic problems and the lack of well-paying jobs, 2 of her daughters had to emigrate to Spain to improve their income and in that way help their family.

Due to economic problems and the illness of her husband, Gregoria had to sell her house and practically all the assets that the couple had, in order to travel with her entire family to Argentina so that her husband could follow a course of medical treatment in that country, a treatment which, sadly, did not give results and her husband passed away after some time, five years ago. With the blows life was giving her at that time, and in a foreign country, she saw the necessity of returning to Paraguay, to start all over again from zero.

She started out selling merchandise in the street. At that time she had just one big bag which she carried on her back, going from house to house offering her products. In this way she made working capital and, little by little, with much sacrifice, her business kept growing. She had the chance to buy a new house and in that way raise her 5 children and offer them a good education. Today, she already has a good quantity of customers, and thanks to her effort and the support of her children, she is able to open a small business inside her own home.

With the loan she is requesting, she plans to expand her stock of merchandise. She needs to buy more clothing, footwear, and gloves, and in that way augment her economic income.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

La señora Gregoria tiene 44 años , es viuda y tiene 5 hijos de los cuales dos son varones y tres mujeres, nos cuenta que por problemas económicos y por falta de trabajo con una buena remuneracion 2 de sus hijas tuvo la necesidad de emigrar a España para de esta forma mejorar sus ingresos y asi poder ayudar a su familia .

Por problemas económicos y enfermedad de su esposo, Gregoria, tuvo que vender su casa y prácticamente todos los bienes que la pareja tenia en ese momento para viajar con toda su familia a la Argentina para que su esposo siga en ese país un tratamiento médico, tratamiento que lastimosamente no dio resultado y su esposo falleció luego de un tiempo, de eso ya hace 5 años. Con los golpes que la vida en ese momento le estaba dando y en un país extranjero se vio con la necesidad de volver al Paraguay para de esta forma volver a empezar todo de cero.

Empezo vendiendo mercaderias por las calles, en ese entonces contaba con un solo bolson que llevaba sobre su espalda y llegaba casa por casa a ofrecer sus productos, asi de fue haciendo de capital operativo y poco a poco con mucho sacrificio fue acrecentando su negocio y se volvio a comprar una nueva casa y asi pudo criar a sus 5 hijos y ofrecerles una buena educaion. Actualmente ya cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientela y gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus hijos puedo abrir un pequeño negocio dentro de su propia casa.

Con el crédito que solicita piensa en ampliar su stock de mercaderias, necesita comprar mas ropas, calzados, medias, guantes, para de esta forma poder aumentar sus ingresos economicos.

loans.use: to buy more clothes, footwear, gloves, etc.

loans.name: Argena

texts.pt:
Argena designs and makes clothes, table cloths, bed sheets, pillow cases, etc which she sells for a living. She joined the credit program this year and is in her second cycle. She needs a loan to buy fabric to make more articles to sell. Selling these articles is her only source of income. With the money earned from her business she hopes to, one day, build a house and start a family.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer.

Argena e modista. Assim ela confecciona a roupa que vende.para alem de artigos de vestuario ela confecciona outro tipo de artigos tais como sacos de pao, toalhas de mesa, lencois com a respectivas fronhas,etc.Argena e solteira e ainda nao tem filhos. mas um dia pensa constituir familia.Ela entrou para o programa ainda este ano. Esta no segundo ciclo. Com os rendimentos ela pretende construir uma casa melhorada., pois que ela vive numa de pau a pique.Ela nao tem um outro emprego a nao ser a costura que ela faz para sobreviver.

loans.use: Argena will use her loan to buy more fabric to make the clothing and linens she designs and sells herself.

loans.name: Sera

texts.en:
Sera H. is 27 years old, and is single. Sera has three orphaned relatives aged 18, 12, and 6 years respectively, who she takes care of because there is no one else left in her family to take care of them. She has lived with them since they were toddlers. Sera lives in Kabete town, where she intends to operate her stall from. Sera was introduced to Action Now Kenya by her employer who saw her great potential in day care, after caring for her child as a nanny. 

Sera intends to open a stall in Kabete town on the outskirts of Nairobi where she will be selling children clothes and also she will have the opportunity of advertising her day care services, while selling the clothes.  She intends to open a day care business in the future, once she is well settled in business. Using her business, she will also use the opportunity to educate women on nutrition and the best way to feed their children.  Sera is therefore kindly requesting a loan for Ksh 20,000.  With this loan, Sera will be able to purchase a bale of second-hand clothes, hangers and stationeries, and she will also put up a notice board from which she will receive some income out of every advertisement put up by her clients. The repayment period for her loan will be 10 months.

loans.use: To purchase one bale of second hand clothes, hangers, and to put up a public notice board.

loans.name: Leoncia Maria's Group

texts.es:
Leoncia, Nieves and Sonia belong to Banco Comunal Qory Qaytu whose meaning is "Golden Thread" in the dialect of quechua. They have belonged to this bank for 1 year, 4 years and 1 year each respectively.

They tell us that through this bank they learned to be united, responsible, and punctual. They say: "here we feel happy, we forget about our problems for a while". They also mention that the loan the get from the bank is of great help.

Leonicia sells vegetables, meats and canned goods in the jungles of Ayacucho and at the local markets. She also brings fruits back with her from different zones to sell them at the Nery Garcia Market.

Nieves has been selling firewood for 4 years and she does this from her home. She commented that she became a member of the bank thanks to a friend.

Although Sonia and her husband have an iron shop, she has been selling firewood from her home since last year.

Leonicia, Nieves, and Sonia need a loan of 900 soles, 1000 soles and 1000 soles respectively which will be used to purchase fice, noodles, sugar, wheat, chicken, carrots, firewood, charcoal, paints, wrough iron supplies and big metal sheets.

Their savings will be used for their children's education, some emergencies they might have, and their own capital. These women's dreams are to make sure their kids move forward in life, give them a good education, improve their home and perhaps be able to open another business.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Leoncia, Nieves y Sonia pertenecen al Banco Comunal Qory Qaytu que significa “Hilo de Oro” en quechua, desde hace 1, 4, 1 años respectivamente. Ellas cuentan que en el Banco Comunal ellas aprendieron a ser unidas, responsables, puntuales; dice “aquí nos sentimos alegres, olvidamos por un momento nuestros problemas”. También mencionan que el préstamo que les da el Banco Comunal es de gran ayuda para sus negocios. Leoncia vende verduras, carne y abarrotes en la Selva de Ayacucho, es feriante y vende en el Mercado de Pichari y de las ferias trae frutas de la zona para luego venderlos en el mercado Nery García. Por otro lado Nieves vende leña desde hace 4 años y lo hace en su casa. Ella cuenta que llegó a ser socia del Banco Comunal por invitación de una amiga. Mientras que Sonia junto a su esposo tienen un taller de planchado y pintura, Sonia además vende leña desde hace 1 año en su casa. Leoncia, Nieves y Sonia necesitan préstamos de 900 soles, 1000 soles, 1000 soles respectivamente, que serán invertidos en la compra de arroz, fideo, azúcar, trigo, pollo, zanahoria, leña, carburo, pinturas, soldaduras, planchas metálicas. Sus ahorros los utilizarán para los estudios de sus hijos, alguna emergencia, tener un capital propio. Los sueños de Leoncia, Nieves y Sonia son sacar adelante a sus hijos, darles una buena educación, mejorar su casa y tener otro negocio.

loans.use: Leoncia, Nieves and  Sonia need a loan to purchase  rice, wheat, chickens, carrots, firewood, charcoal, paints, wrough iron sheets

loans.name: Parween's Group

texts.en: I am Parween A. from Borewala, a small town in Pakistan. I have lived all my life in this town. My husband operates an electronics store. Now, he requires a loan to buy some items for his electronics store.  I would like to borrow in a group of few women: Nasreen A. needs loan to buy goats for their livestock trading. Rubina B. wants to open up a grocery store. Nargis B. will use the loan for the repair of their rickshaw. Saleema B. also wants a loan for her son’s grocery store. Rahima B. is a widow and sells cloth.

loans.use: Expand electronics store

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: M. Esther prepares food for sale. She is married to a mason and has 1 child. Business is doing very well and she intends to increase production. She is asking for $525 as additional capital to buy more food stuffs to increase her production and her sales.

loans.use: For additional capital for food production business.

loans.name: Dina Laura

texts.es:
Dina is a member of Banco Comunal Juan Zaplana Belliza, and is located at Jr Copaiba Mz C2 Lt 16, in the Calleria district of Ucayali. She is 23 years old, has one child and her husband is a delivery man. Dina invested her first $100 loan from Manuela Ramos in a cosmetics shop.

These days, her shop sells food as well as cosmetics. She starts her day at 7am to prepare breakfast for her family, after which she works in her shop selling cosmetics. In parallel she prepares food, which she sells from midday until 2pm.

With this next loan of $550, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy perfume, talcum powder, creams, lipstick, rice, sugar, milk, oil, noodles etc.

Dina is very happy because after much hard work and effort she has managed to overcome the difficulties that were facing her and her family, and improve their quality of life.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Dina pertenece al Banco Comunal Juan Zaplana Belliza, ubicado en el Jr Copaiba Mz C2 Lt 16 del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 23 años y es madre de 1 hijo, su esposo es motocarrista. Dina con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de productos de belleza.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta de productos de belleza y de venta de comida, se levanta a las 7am, para preparar el desayuno de su hijo y de su esposo, luego se dedica a la venta de sus productos de belleza y paralelo a eso prepara su comida que lo vende a partir del medio día hasta las 2pm.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1500 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará : perfumes, talcos, cremas, labiales, colonias, arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, fideos, etc.

Dina esta muy feliz, porque con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo ha logrado salir adelante con su familia y ha superado los problemas que se le presentaban.

loans.use: To buy goods for her shop

loans.name: Otila

texts.es:
Otila has a convenience store where she sells a little of everything. She has three children: Juan Manuel, Daniel and Ricardo who help her attend to customers. She began the business when she was going through a divorce and needed to look for a way to increase her income and pay for her children’s education. This occurred five years ago. Currently, things are going well thanks to the support of her sons.

Otila is requesting a loan of US $450 which she will repay in 6 months. It will be used for the remodeling of the façade of her business. We are contributing to the development of Otila’s business.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Otila tiene una miscelánea donde vende un poco de todo, tienen 3 hijos Juan Manuel, Daniel y Ricardo que le ayudan a atender los clientes en el negocio. Este lo inicio cuando se estaba divorciando entonces ella necesitaba buscar la manera de incrementar los ingresos económicos y así poder pagar la educación de sus hijos, esto hace 5 años, actualmente le ha ido muy bien gracias a el apoyo que sus hijos le han dado.

Solicita un préstamo por US $450 que pagara en 6 meses para remodelar la fachada del negocio. Contribuyamos al desarrollo del negocio de Otila.

loans.use: Remodel the façade of her business.

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es:
Señora María del Socorro U. M. is a native of the city of Bluefields. She is 42-years-old and is married to señor Francisco Blanco. Both have 3 childrern. Señora U. has sold used clothing for 4 years. Her customers are both women and men of scarce resources who prefer her because she offers a variety of clothing. This is the second credit that she is requesting, and right now she needs to buy one package of blouses for $325 and one package of sheets for $325. This investment will help her gain more profits, and she will be able to offer more variety to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La Sra. María del Socorro U. M. es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 42 años de edad esta casada con el Sr. Francisco Blanco ambos tienen 3 hijos. La Sra. U. vende ropa usada hace 4 años, teniendo como clientes a mujeres y hombres de escasos recursos, que la prefieren por ofrecer una variedad de ropa. Este es el segundo crédito que esta solicitando la Sra. U. ya que en estos momentos necesita comprar 1 paca de blusas a $325.00 dólares la paca y 1 paca de sabanas a $325.00 dólares la paca, esta inversión le ayudara a obtener mas ganancias ya que podrá ofrecer mas variedad a sus clientes.

loans.use: To purchase one package of blouses and one package of sheets

loans.name: Paquita

texts.es:
Señora Paquita R. Upiachiua, is an associate of the "Sowing the Future" Communal Bank. She lives in the Region and Province of San Martin district of Tarapoto. Her business of selling general groceries, delicacies and other edible products of daily consumption is located in her own house located on Urb. Villa Maria of the same district.

The lady started the business of selling food away from her house, which brought her many problems with her children since they are in school. That was the main motive to change her activity, and she decided to sell groceries from her home since there is no other person that has this type of business where she lives. For this reason her clientele grows everyday.

With the loan of 1000 soles, which will be repaid in 6 months, he will buy noodles of different varieties and brand-name products in packages, preserves in boxes, rice and sugar in bags, oil in liter bottles, and eggs in cartons, due to the fact that these food are very much in demand. She will also re-supply their stock of carbonated beverages and delicacies.

Paquita, is a very friendly and persistent woman. She is 34 years old. She lives with her husband and her two children, who she prompts to work harder each day and to reach their objectives. She desires in the future to improve and expand the area where she runs her business and to have a minimarket.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Paquita R. Upiachiua, es socia del Banco Comunal “Sembrando Futuro” vive en la Región y Provincia de San Martín distrito de Tarapoto, su negocio de venta de abarrotes en general, golosinas y otros productos comestibles de consumo diario, está ubicado en su propia casa ubicada en la Urb. Villa Maria del mismo distrito.

La señora, se inicia en el negocio con la venta de comida, lo realizaba fuera de su casa lo cual le traía muchos problemas con sus hijos ya que ellos están en la etapa escolar, eso fue el principal motivo para cambiar de actividad, y decide por la venta de abarrotes ya que por donde ella vive no hay otra persona que tenga este tipo de negocio, lo que hace que su clientela aumente cada día.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1000.00, que será devuelto en 6 meses, comprará fideos de distintas variedades y marcas en paquetes, conservas en cajas, arroz y azúcar en sacos, aceite en botellas de litro, huevos en javas, debido a que estos alimentos son muy requeridos, además de surtir su stock de bebidas gasificadas y golosinas.

Paquita, es una mujer perseverante y muy amigable, tiene 34 años, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, quienes le impulsan a esforzarse cada día más y alcanzar sus objetivos, desea para el futuro mejorar y ampliar el ambiente donde desarrolla su negocio y tener su minimarket.

loans.use: To buy noodles, brand-name products, eggs, oil, rice, sugar, preserves and other products for resale in her grocery business.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys has been selling bottles of wine for the past six months. She brings them from the province every month. Additionally she has also been selling cheese for the past six months, after a friend encouraged her to try it out.

The loans she has received have helped her build her house and as capital for her business. She would like to eventually have a liquor store at her house.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer

Gladys vende botellas de vino desde hace 6 años. Ella misma se encarga de traerlos desde provincia todos los meses. Asimismo, ella también vende quesos por pedidos desde hace 6 meses. Una amiga le animó a incursionar en este negocio. Los préstamos que ha recibido le han servido para construir su casa y como capital para su negocio. A Gladys le gustaría tener una licorería en su casa.

loans.use: To invest in her business and build her house.

loans.name: Aura Leticia

texts.es:
Aura Leticia Vásquez García is 19 years old, single and lives in Paraje Xequiac of Cantón Xantún in the province of Totonicapán. She has been working for more than two years as a seamstress producing aprons and now she is requesting a loan in Asociación Asdir that she will used to buy a work machine and raw material with the aim of generating more production and income to benefit her and her family. She is requesting a loan to be able to develop herself and get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Aura Leticia Vásquez García de 19 años de edad, Soltera, con residente en el Paraje Xequiac, del Cantón Xantún, del departamento de Totonicapán quien hace más de 2 años atrás viene trabajando como costurera en la elaboración de delantales y ahora pretender solicitar en la Asociación Asdir un crédito que le servirá para comprar una máquina de trabajo y comprar materia prima con la idea de generar mas producción y ganancias para el beneficio de ella misma y de su familia por esa razón solicita a la Institución un credito que le permita desarrollarse o superarse la cual cancalifica al crédito por la supervisión efectuada.

loans.use: Purchase of machinery and raw materials

loans.name: Fadhila

texts.en:
Fadhila is 35 years old. She is married and has seven children between the ages of 1 and 14. She has been an oil and groundnuts seller since 2004. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

Fadhila now looking for a loan to improve her business.

loans.use: To improve her business

loans.name: Mirzoyor

texts.ru: Сохибназаров Мирзоер житель района Абдурахмони Джоми. Женат и имеет девятерых детей. Возраст 49 лет. Обеспечивает семью путем растениеводством. Арендует землю , которую засеивает различными злаковыми культурами. В данный момент планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы закупить семена пшеницы , а так же удобрений для ее обработки.Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mirzoyor S. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi region of Tajikistan. He is 49 years old, married and has nine children. Mirzoyor supports his family by farming - he rents land where he grows various grains. Currently he needs to purchase wheat seeds as well as fertilizer for winter planting season and would like to finance the purchase using this loan. Mirzoyor plans to pay back the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Raquiel

texts.es:
Raquiel pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Al Progreso del distrito y provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash.

Es casada, tiene 56 años de edad, a pesar de haber tenido cuatro hijos no vive con ninguno, pues ella y su esposo se hacen compañía. Menciona que en su vida personal ha podido crecer porque sus hijos son independientes y junto a su esposo ha podido emprender varios negocios, tan es así que ella tiene un restaurante, los puestos Nº 16 y 17 en el mercado de venta de pescados y ahora quiere abrir una cebichería (lugar donde se vende cebiche, comida típica del Perú). También menciona que ha crecido mucho, pero que ahora con el alza de los precios tiene mucha dificultad para vender el pescado, porque antes con el capital que tiene podía comprar toneladas de pescados y ahora compra sólo por kilos siendo esto su mayor dificultad. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará específicamente con todo el préstamo, pescado porque nos cuenta que cada caja cuesta S/.  95 y es necesario invertir mucho.

Raquiel menciona que desearía capacitarse para mejorar su negocio y también en su vida personal.
texts.en:
Raquiel belongs to the Communal Bank “Mujeres al Progreso” in the district and province of Yungay in Ancash state in Peru. She is married and 56 years old. In spite of having had four children she doesn’t live with any of them, as she and her husband live with each other. She mentions that in her personal life she has been able to grow because her children are independent and along with her husband she has been able to start various businesses, such as the restaurant she now has in stands numbers 16 and 17 in the fish market and now she would like to open a “cevichería” (a place where ceviche is sold, a typical cold seafood salad in Peru). She also says that she has grown a lot, but now with the rise in prices it is more difficult to sell fish, because before with the capital she had she was able to buy tons of fish and now she can only buy kilos so this is her greatest challenge. With this loan for S/.3,000, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy specifically with this entire loan, fish, because she tells us that each case costs S/.96 and it is necessary to invest a lot. Raquiel mentions that she would like to educates herself to improve her business and also her personal life.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fish

loans.name: Mustafokul

texts.en: S. Mustafokul is 51 years old. He is married with a 10-year-old son. Mustafokul rents a little store where he sells construction supplies. He buys his goods from different cities, wherever they are cheaper, and sells them in his store. He purchases goods every week. His family members also help him at the store. He has many constant clients. He wants to take a loan for purchasing more goods so he can earn more profit. With the bigger profit, he plans to purchase his own store someday.

loans.use: construction supplies

loans.name: Fanaka Group

texts.en:
Augustino K., 47, is a widower with one 16-year-old child.  He also takes care of his mother. He is an electrician and also sells electrical materials. He started this business two years ago and works daily from 8 a.m. until 8 p.m. He is able to earn a monthly profit of around $62. 

This will be Augustino’s fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase the stock of his electrical equipment and has repaid the loans successfully. He now hopes for a fifth loan to buy more stock to sell. 
\t
Augustino will share this loan with his loan group, Fanaka, which totals 15 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Augustino is standing in the back, first on the left.

loans.use: To buy stock for his electrical business

loans.name: Sugran Abdul Majeed Group

texts.en:
"My name is Sugran and I am a 52-year-old married lady. I have been a citizen of a city called Borewala, Pakistan for the past 25 years. I am an uneducated lady and I don’t hesitate to mention it. My parents were not in a position to bear my education expenses. My husband's name is A. M. and he is a delivery man and delivers goods, e.g. fruits & vegetables and construction supplies, on his donkey cart. He has been doing this work for the past 15 years. I am the mother of four kids: two sons and two daughters. My elder son runs a tea stall in the community. People come to him for taking tea. They admire his tea. My elder daughter has a carpet weaving business. I help my daughter sell her handmade carpets. The others don't have jobs and stay at home and do household work. I have successfully repaid my first loan from Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). Now I am applying again for a loan to buy materials (cloth, colored thread, and sketches) to expand my daughter’s carpet weaving business.

I am the group leader for some more women from my locality. Ameena baji wants a loan to buy wood for her furniture-making business. Parveen Akhtar baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business. Kalsoom baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for transport. Waziran baji wants a loan to buy beams for her shuttering business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material for weaving carpets

loans.name: Sara

texts.es: la Sra Sara S. tiene 39 años de edad, ella reside en la colonia Hato de Enmedio de esta ciudad capital, ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos de todo tipo, tambien vende ropa para dama, caballero y niños, gracias a sus ventas ha logrado salir adelante y ha podido dar una estabilidad a su familia, con las ganancias tambien paga alquiler de su negocio y cubre todos los gastos alimenticios, salud y educacion para su familia, ella es una mujer muy luchadora y gracias a su espiritu de trabajo y superacion ha logrado salir adelante, en estos momentos ella necesita un credito para poder inyectarle mas mercaderia al negocio y asi poder tener una tienda mas grande y tener mayores ganancias. su meta es poder tener varias tiendas en diferentes colonias.
texts.en:
Sara S. is 39 years old. She lives Hato de Enmedio in the capital city. She sells shoes of all types and also sells women’s, men’s and children’s clothing. Thanks to her sales she has succeeded in moving forward and bringing stability to her family. With her earnings, she pays the rent for her business and also covers all the food, medical and educational expenses for her family. She is a fighter, and thanks to her hard-working spirit and desire to overcome she has succeeded in moving forward. Right now she needs a loan to be able to bring in more merchandise for her store and also to be able to have a bigger store and better income. Her aim is to be able to have various stores in different neighborhoods.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy women's and men's shoes and clothing

loans.name: Wassim

texts.en:
Wassim is a 24-year-old man who lives in Tripoli, in northern Lebanon. He has owned a barber shop for four years. He requested a loan of $1,000 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase new tools for his work and to do some maintenance work on his car. This is the first time that Wassim has requested a loan.

Wassim is special in his work because he is known for his good work. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. He decided on starting this business because of his experience and his need for cash. In the future, Wassim plans to expand his business as well as start a new business in car trading.

loans.use: to purchase new tools for his work and do some maintenance work on his car.

loans.name: Brenda Janeth

texts.es: La señora Brenda Janeth V. es madre soltera y tiene bajo su responsabilidad a dos pequeños hijo y ambos viven en una casa rentada. El costo de la renta se ha incrementado y cada vez mas y es difícil para ella cubrir ese gasto. Por tal  motivo está tramitando un préstamo para obtener su propia casa mediante un crédito Gubernamental. Sin embargo el valor de la vivienda es mayor que el crédito que puede recibir ya que su sueldo es bajo. Por ello está solicitando un préstamo para completar el valor de la vivienda y obtener así la casa que necesitan ella y sus hijos para un patrimonio seguro.
texts.en:
Mrs. Brenda Janeth V. is a single mother, responsible for two small children, who rents her home. Rent continues to increase making it progressively more difficult to pay. She is negotiating a government loan to buy her own home but the value of the home is higher than the maximum loan she qualifies for due to her low salary. She is, therefore, asking for a loan to pay the difference so that she and her children can begin to build their own equity.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay the difference between a government loan and the price of her own house.

loans.name: Ni Luh Sarini

texts.en:
Ni Luh Sarini is a 40 year-old woman living in the town of Dsn. Pangkung Buluh, in Kaliakah.  She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Ni Luh Sarini owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector selling of home products. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling kitchen supplies & products to tourists and local community members.  Ni Luh Sarini has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 900,000 IDR a month from these activities.

In 2008, Ni Luh Sarini joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ni Luh Sarini has successfully repaid a previous loan of 450,000 IDR from DINARI.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.Ni Luh Sarini is now requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 IDR which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by this borrower from DINARI. Ni Luh Sarini plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About DINARI:
The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Hafiz

texts.en:
Hafiz H. Shah F. is married and the father of three children. He lives in Jalalabad, Nangrahar province. He is a farmer with lots of experience and he has been involved in this business for more then ten years. He is also a hard worker.

But now he wants to buy some animals for his farm. For that, he needs an individual loan of 50,000 Afghanis to buy animals and necessary things for his land.

Therefore he asked AFS (Ariana Financial Services Joint Stock Company) in Jalalabad, Afghanistan for an individual loan of 50,000 Afghanis to complete his stock and to buy animals for his land. Now he is really very happy about this process of small loans in Jalalabad, Afghanistan. He sends thanks to all lenders, Kiva and AFS in Jalalabad, Afghanistan for supporting him in this financial difficulty with his business.

loans.use: To buy animals for his farming land

loans.name: Bujwaha Asiina Safina Group

texts.en: Assina Safina is 27 years old and a single mother of two children, one of whom is schooling. She deals in shoes; she has been selling shoes for three years. She will use this loan to purchase gents’ shoes, ladies' shoes, and children's shoes. She is a hard-working lady who is hoping for a change in her business. Her dream is to purchase a plot of land and build a house.

loans.use: To purchase shoes to sell

loans.name: Luís Jeremias

texts.pt:
Luís de 38 anos nasceu no distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, estudou até quinta classe e teve de parar por problemas de guerra civil que Moçambique viveu durante 16 anos. Casado maritalmente e pai de quatro filhos com idades compreendidas entre os 7 e 14 anos e todos são estudantes. Vive na casa própria e Sustenta também os seus pais que vivem com ele.

Comerciante e mais de 6 anos e dono do próprio negócio, não tem empregados. Vende produtos de primeira necessidade e sua aquisição é no mercado grossista da cidade de Maputo, seu rendimento diário oscila entre 500.00MT a 700.00MT.

Seu parceiro financeiro foi sempre a Hluvuku, sendo seu terceiro empréstimo. Com o empréstimo de 14,000.00MT, pretende aumentar o stock de produtos para maior diversificação e consequentemente maiores vendas.

Seu sonho é crescer mais no negocio, sendo uma das prioridades a transformação da barraca em loja.
texts.en:
Luís, 38 years old, was born in the district of Boane, Maputo province. He studied at school until fifth grade, and then had to stop due to the civil war which Mozambique lived through for 16 years. He is married and the father of four children aged 7 to 14 years, all of whom are students. He lives in his own house and also supports his parents, who live with him. He has been a merchant for over six years and owns his own business. He has no employees. He sells basic necessities, buying in bulk in the city of Maputo. His daily income varies between 500 MT and 700 MT. His financial partner has always been Hluvuku, this is his third loan. With this loan of 14,000 MT, he plans to increase his stock of merchandise for greater diversification and, consequently, more sales. His dream is to expand his business more. One of his priorities is the transformation of his stall into a shop.

Translated from Portuguese by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stock in his shop

loans.name: Benita Gregoria

texts.es: La señora Benita Gregoria B. T. cuenta con 64 años de edad, casada Actualmente se dedica al comercio en ventas de productos para el hogar lleva 10 años dedicándose a esta actividad conjuntamente con sus cuatro hijos  reside en el paraje las Clavellinas del cantón Juchanep, municipio y departamento  de Totonicapán, Guatemala, pero en las condiciones a las que vive  son muy complicadas por lo que solicito  un préstamo  acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, y así poder mejorar los productos en ventas como también poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y así poder generar mejores ingresos para poder darles a sus hijos una mejor educación  a sus hijos como también mejorar las condiciones de vidas en las que viven. Mejorando sus ingresos y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Ms. Benita Gregoria B. T. is a 64-year-old married woman who has been selling housewares for 10 years with the help of her four children. She lives in Paraje Las Clavellinas in the Juchanep canton, municipality and department of Totonicapán, Guatemala. However, her living conditions are difficult, which is why she is turning to Asociación ASDIR for a loan so that she can improve her merchandise and cover customer demand. This way, she can generate more profits and give her children a better education, as well as improve their living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Benkadi 7 De Toura Nabitokan Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI 7 est un groupe de six  de femmes  toutes mariées du village de Toura Nabitokan de la ville de SAN région de SEGOU (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali) qui vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 23 ans, 3 enfants et cultivent  de l’arachide. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe BENKADI 7 de TOURA NABITOKAN ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 2 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  le  prêt précédent, elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture, exclusivement  au grand marché de Kimparana  ville. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Kimparana et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe BENKADI 7 comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 25.000 à 20 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses  courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The BENKADI 7 group is made of six married women of the Toura Nabitokan village, in the city of SAN (Ségou Region, fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali), who live in traditional families. They average 23 years of age and 3 children. They grow peanuts.

Eager to make their agricultural businesses profitable, the members of the BENKADI 7 group decided to join the loan program of Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, two years ago. After having repaid the previous loan without problems, they are now seeking their second farming loan.

This loan will be used to buy, exclusively at the grand market in Kimparana, a sufficient quantity of peanut seeds, small materials, and fertilizers for the fields. After the rainy season, the crops are stored for a while to gain market value, before being sold at the grand market in Kimparara and in the surrounding markets, retail (often wholesale) and for cash, to a clientele usually coming from the larger cities.

After selling their products, the members of the BENKADI 7 group count on turning a profit of XOF 25000 to 20000 (ca US$ 55 to 45) each, to be used to repay the loan and to pay for the daily expenses of their families.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy peanut seeds, small materials, and fertilizers for the fields

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel vive en la zona Belen, calle “P”  de la ciudad de El Alto.
Vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos  los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar.

El Sr. Se dedica a la confección de chamarras y chalecos adecuados para el clima frío de la región, dicha producción lo vende en la ciudad de Oruro y en centros mineros.

También se desempeña como pastor de una iglesia evangélica con sede en la zona

El crédito lo destinara  como capital de trabajo, en la adquisición de materia prima  y así aumentar su producción. 
 
Es el segundo  crédito con Impro y el segundo  via Kiva la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Daniel lives in the Belen zone, "P" street of the city of El Alto. He lives with his wife and their children, who are all school age. Daniel is dedicated to the making of jackets and vests appropriate for the cold climate of the region. He sells his products in the city of Oruro and in mining centers. He also serves as the pastor of an evangelical church with headquarters in the zone The loan will serve as working capital, in the acquisition of supplies in order to grow his production. This is the second loan with Impro and the second one via Kiva. The evaluation carried out qualifies Impro to offer him the credit.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies to make warm jackets and vests for sale.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora currently lives in her native place at Barangay Almaguer, South of Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Justo and they were gifted with three children. They belong to the poor families but with strong faith and determination to uplift their standard of living. Leonora and her husband work very hard and patiently coping with the difficulties of life they are experiencing. Two of their children have already graduated from high school and are now working abroad as domestic helpers while their youngest child is still studying.

Farm labor and cultivating their own farm is their major source of income. Leonora on the other hand is managing a vending business: rice, vegetables, and sometimes she also sells frozen foods. She wants to take out a loan from Kiva amounting to PHP 10,000 as additional capital to maintain her business so it will become profitable. She hopes that through her business, they can uplift their life out of poverty.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana trabaja junto con su esposo como comerciante, tiene un puesto de venta de periódicos en la zona 12 de octubre de la ciudad de El Alto, es su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de sus tres hijos que depende de la pareja; vive en anticretico ubicado en la Zona Villa Mercedario de la ciudad de El Alto.


El crédito lo destinará para incrementar su anticrético, de esa forma podrá generar un ahorro en vez de pagar alquiler de su vivienda.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada permite aprobarle el prestamo solicitado por la prestataria.
texts.en:
Ana works together with her husband in sales. She has a newspaper stand in the zone "12 de octubre" of the town of El Alto. It is her main income source with which she pays maintenance of their three children who depend on them. She lives in a rented house (*anticrético) located in the Zona Villa Mercedario of the town of El Alto.

The loan will be spend on increasing the "anticrético" in order to increase savings instead of paying rent.

This is her first loan with Impro, and the loan has been approved according to the evaluation of the borrower. (* "anticrético" = A deposit is given, a contract for a certain period of time is signed, and when leaving the property the deposit is returned to the tenant)

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase payment of "anticretico" on rented house.

loans.name: El Arrollo Group

texts.es:
Sonia María S. N., Patricia del Carmen L. P. y Aura Lina R. N. son los integrantes del grupo el arrollo, provenientes de la comarca laguna Verde ubicada en la carretera que lleva de Granada a Masaya.

Sonia S. de 52 años de edad y situada al centro de la fotografía, trabaja en un negocio que heredó de su familia. Que es la compra de cosechas de frutas  y verduras que vende a los mercaderes en la ciudad de Masaya.

Su credito lo quiere para invertir en cosechas frescas que sacaran ahorita los agricultores, esto le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y crecer en clientela.

Patricia L.  tiene un negocio de venta de ropa de segunda y Aura Lina R. elabora cereales y los distribuye en el mercado de Masaya.
texts.en:
Sonia María S. N., Patricia del Carmen L. P. and Aura Lina R. N. are members of the group "El Arrollo." They come from the community of Laguna Verde located off the road between Granada and Masaya. Sonia S. is 52 years old, and is the person in the center of the photograph. She works in a business that she inherited from her family that involves the purchase of fruits and vegetables that are sold in the markets of the City of Masaya. Her loan will be used to purchase the fresh produce that farm workers are currently harvesting. This will permit her to increase her income and her customer base. Patricia L. has a business selling second-hand clothes and Aura Lina R. processes cereals and distributes them in the Masaya market.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fresh produce

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat des condiments et de sel, gimgenbre etc.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is sixty years old. He is married and has five children, all out of school. He lives with his wife and some of the children in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Ali is a trader and trades in cereals such as maize, beans, groundnuts (peanuts), etc. He procures the goods from nearby communities and supplies to food vendors and retailers in his community. He has been in business for over thirty years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. He is hopeful to improve upon his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy cereals in bulk

loans.name: Lisbith

texts.es:
La señora Lisbith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Luchadoras”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 53 años y 02 hijos, todos ya independientes.

La necesidad de sacar adelante a sus hijos y gracias a su espíritu y energía emprendedora que posee, decidió iniciar su propio negocio de Venta de Comidas, ubicada en su misma casa, en un local muy bien acondicionado, también se dedica a brindar pensión. Lisbith, nos cuenta que se inicio con un capital de S/. 200.00, y poco a poco fue ahorrando y creciendo cada día. Se levanta muy temprano, para preparar sus alimentos.

En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio atendiendo a sus pensionistas con ese carisma y rica sazón que la caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, comprará una cocinita para facilitar sus comidas además utensilios para brindar una mejor atención y parte  del dinero invertirá en la compra de arroz, azúcar y otros productos de primera necesidad.

Lisbith, se siente muy segura y con ganas de seguir adelante, asegurarse una  vida tranquila y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por enseñarle como administrar su negocio y  contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Lisbith belongs to the "Mujeres Luchadoras" ("Fighting Women") Community Bank, district of Tarapoto, province of San Martin, department of San Martin, Peru. She is a 53-year-old married mother of two children, both grown up. Out of the need to make headway for her children and thanks to her enterprising spirit and energy, she decided to start her own business selling food in a well-conditioned space out of her home, where she also provides a boardinghouse. Lisbith tells us that she started with 200 soles of capital and little by little she saved and it grew each day. She wakes up very early to prepare her meals. She tends to her boarders with the charisma and tasty foods she is known for. With this loan of 1,000 soles, she plans to set up a small kitchen area where she can make her meals and also purchase cooking utensils to provide better service. She plans to use part of the money to purchase rice, sugar and other products of primary need. Lisbith feels very safe and has a strong desire to keep moving forward to assure herself of a peaceful life. She is grateful to Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for teaching her how to administer her business and helping her fulfill her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food ingredients

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 40 years old and is married with 3 children aged 12, 19, and 21. She lives in the Nyarugenge District of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda. Joyce has been a proven entrepreneur for over 9 years in the business of selling new and used spare parts. Joyce is good at what she does and works very hard; she employs two people as helpers in her business.

Joyce is requesting her first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase some additional new and used spare parts for her shop. With this loan, Joyce will be able to serve more customers as well as earn more profit, she believes. With any additional profits earned, Joyce will reinvest in her business and put aside some as savings since she hopes to be economically independent in the years ahead. In addition, she will also continue to take care of her family's daily needs.

loans.use: Purchase more used and new spare parts for sale

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
La señora Lourdes es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima - Juli” desde hace 1 años atrás (reingresante), del distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 32 años de edad, cuenta con estudios secundarios completos, es casada y tiene 3 hijos.
Lourdes se dedica a la venta de artesanìa y nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles compró los materiales necesarios para la elaboraciòn de las artesanías.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles con los que podrá comprar lana y bayeta.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su tienda de artesanías y que sus hijos sean profesionales. 
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro.
texts.en:
Señora Lourdes has been a member of the community bank "Santa Rosa de Lima - Juli" since she rejoined a year ago. The bank is located in the Juli district of the Chucuito province in the department of Puno. She is 32 years old and completed secondary school. She is married and has three children.

Lourdes sells handicrafts. She tells us that with her first loan from Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 500 PEN, she bought materials needed to make handicrafts. She is applying for a loan of 500 PEN with which she will buy wool and felt.

Her dream for the future is to have her handicrafts shop and for her children to have careers. Her favorite thing about the community bank is the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wool and felt

loans.name: Rosa Herminia

texts.es:
A la vivienda del la señora Rosa Herminia C. le está haciendo falta el vitropiso, pero en esté momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para comprar el material.
Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para poder realizar la mejora, ya que tiene nietos pequeños de edad y andan jugando en el piso y no quiere que se enfermen. 
Planea pagar el crédito con los ingresos que obtiene de su trabaja de limpieza de casa en la vecina ciudad de Nuevo Laredo.
texts.en:
The home of Mrs. Rosa Herminia C. is missing ceramic tiling for the floors, but at this time she does not have the money necessary to purchase the materials. It is for this this she is requesting a loan, in order to carry out the improvement to her home, as she has very young grandchildren who play around on the floor and she doesn't want them to get sick. She plans to pay back the loan with the income she gets from her housecleaning work in the neighbouring city of Nuevo Laredo.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Installation of ceramic tile flooring.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional goods for her shop

loans.name: Sulton

texts.en:
Sulton is 30 years old, married has one child. His wife makes a living as a teacher. Sulton is 6 years removed from having started his small convenience store when he was unemployed and needed a way to pay the bills. His biggest dream is to have a general store where he can sell household products as well as cosmetics. With the loan Sulton expects to keep growing little by little and with the earnings he'll keep improving his quality of life and economic situation along with his business until he achieves his goal. His wish in life is to see his child as professional with prosperous businesses.        

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing food products to increase the range of goods for sale
