Fue así como comenzó a pedirle a su papá quien trabaja en Estados Unidos que le mandara ropa usada para ella poder ofrecérselas a sus vecinas y amigas.

Poco a poco fue haciéndose de clientas y está teniendo la necesidad de comprar por más cantidades la ropa. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $550 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero podrá ir a Reynosa a comprar por mayoreo ropa usada de invierno para poder tener algo nuevo que ofrecerles a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Josefina y su familia podrán salir adelante.

loans.use: Buy winter clothes

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Ms. Marlene lives in La Libertad and is the single mother of two children, who depend on her income. She learned sewing and dressmaking in order to make a living for her family. She has 10 years of experience in the business, and this has greatly contributed to her good reputation as a dressmaker in the area. She offers tailoring services, along with the production of garments that she distributes to markets and bazaars of nearby regions. She started her business with very little, but has made a great effort to grow, in spite of the difficulties imposed by being the sole provider for her family. She needs the loan in order to stock on the fabrics that she sells to her clients, as well as on accessories for the production of the garments sold to the bazaars.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Marlene vive en La Libertad y es madre soltera de dos hijos, que dependen de sus ingresos. Aprendió costura ya que se vió en la necesidad de obtener ingresos y poder sacar adelante a su familia. Hasta la fecha tiene diez años de experiencia en este negocio, lo cual ha contribuido en gran manera para que las personas de la zona la reconozcan como una buen costurera. Los servicios que ella presta son la costura a medida y elaboración de prendas de vestir para distribuir en los mercados y bazares de la zonas aledañas. Ella inició su negocio con poco, pero ha tratado en gran manera de poder ir incrementándolo, aunque no le ha sido fácil, ya que tiene que correr con todos los gastos de su grupo familiar. El financiamiento lo necesita para surtir las telas que vende a sus clientes y accesorios para la elaboración de prendas para los bazares.

loans.use: She is in the dressmaking business and needs to purchase fabrics and accessories for the garments she will sell in the present season.

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Mirsaid

texts.en:
Mirsaid C. is 30 years old. He is married and has two children.

Mirsaid sells rice in the largest local market of the city. He has been in this business for six years already, during which time he has become an expert in rice. It should be mentioned that rice is very popular in Tajikistan. One of the most widely spread meals, called “plov,” is made with rice. Plov is cooked very often; you can hardly find any family occasion that can be conducted without that delicious meal. There are various types of plov, and each depends upon the meat and the rice that are used for cooking. So Mirsaid is not only a seller but also a rather important person for his customers, as he is ready to give good advice in choosing the type of rice.

Today Mirsaid requests 3,450 somoni ($1,000 in US dollars) for the term of nine months. He shall use the loan to purchase rice to sell. This is his second loan with IMON. The previous one was managed accurately without delinquencies or violations. Mirsaid thanks everyone for their support.

loans.use: To increase his stock of rice to sell

loans.name: Gladis' Group

texts.en:
Gladis and Herlinda belong to the community bank “Virgen del Carmen”. Gladis has been a member for five years and Herlinda for one year. In that time they have learned responsibility, punctuality and improved their business skills. They say that in the community bank not only have they learned valuable skills but have found support and companionship.

Gladis is 34 years old. She is married and has four children, aged fifteen and younger. Gladis has a store where she sells tara. Tara is a type of tree that is typical of the region; the fruit from the tree is used to make industrial products. She has been selling tara for several years, but was only able to open her store since joining the community bank.

Herlinda has been a member of the community bank for one year. She speaks some Spanish, but mainly Quechua; luckily with the help of Gladis we were able to understand each other. Herlinda sells Tara and cochinilla, which is a small insect used to make red dye. She collects the products in the countryside and then sells them to a middleman who takes them to Lima.

Gladis and Herlinda need loans of 900 and 300 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in their businesses by buying more tara and cochinilla.

One of the most important featured of the community bank is the interest-earning savings account each associate has. Gladis and Herlinda plan to use their savings in the case of an emergency and to make more capital available to their business. Their dreams are to continue developing their businesses.

loans.use: Gladis and Herlinda need loans of 900 and 300 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in their businesses by buying more tara and cochinilla.

loans.name: Sébastienne

texts.fr:
Born in COTONOU around 1975, Mrs O. Sébastienne is married and mother of 5 children. Operating for the last few years in the market DEGAKON in AKPAKPA, she quickly established herself in a competative environment. Right now, she is in a period where business is not good for her because of a lack of capital to restock her supplies with different products. She is also a distributor of water in bags, affectionately called PURE WATER because of the hygenic conditions underwhich it is bagged. She is asking for this loan in order to relaunch her business and meet the demands of her clientele and position herself well in a business environment that is more and more competitive.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Née à COTONOU dans les années 1975, dame O. Sébastienne est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Implantée depuis quelques années dans le marché DEGAKON à AKPAKPA, elle s’est vite imposée dans son environnement concurrentiel. Actuellement, elle est dans une période où les activites ne tournent pas bien pour elle faute de moyens financiers pour s’approvisionner en divers produits. Elle est aussi distributrice de l’eau mise en sachet affectueusement appelée PURE WATER du fait des conditions hygiéniques qui entourent la mise en sachet. Elle sollicite pour ces raisons ce crédit afin de relancer son activité, de faire face aux demandes de sa clientèle et de bien se positionner dans l’environnement de plus en plus concurrentiel dans lequel elle exerce.

loans.use: purchase of 30 cases of spaghetti, 5 cases of tomatoes and milk and a ton of cooking oil

loans.name: Lamaranah

texts.en: Lamaranah has been a member of the Aldi Forty group for a while now and has been participating only in the savings group.  She is now ready to access a loan to both grow her business and satisfy her clients' demands.  She owns a small food items kiosk in the Dogolia market in Sierra Leone.  She needs business capital to purchase sufficient amounts of food items to sell.  She is therefore requesting a loan of Le 800,000 for this purpose.

loans.use: to purchase materials and supplies for her food stall

loans.name: Rose Nakimera's Group

texts.en:
Rose is leader of a group with four members. She is single, 25 years old, and without children. The community she resides and works in is an urban area that includes a large slum.

She purchases bales of old clothes, which she sells at retail and wholesale very early in the morning. There is a market for her goods, but her main challenges are the unstable prices and high rental fees.

She is able to look after herself without having to depend on someone. She would like to increase her stock and build herself a house with the anticipated increased income.

Rose has successfully paid back more than three loans.

loans.use: She would like to increase her stock and build herself a house

loans.name: Musabbe

texts.en: Y. Musabbe is 48 years old. She is married and has three children. Musabbe’s husband is currently unemployed; accordingly, she is the main bread-winner in the family. Musabbe has been running her own business for eleven years, keeping a grocery store in the central market. She sells foodstuffs, such as macaroni, sugar, sweets, as well as detergents, soap, washing powder, tooth-paste and other items. She works from 8:00 a.m. till 5:00 p.m. Her daughter helps her in the store registering the stock and serving the clients. The business is stable and allows her to improve the living conditions of her family. This year, Musabbe’s daughter is finishing school and hoping to enter a university. In order to make her daughter’s dream come true, Musabbe needs to develop her business and earn more income. She is therefore asking for a loan of US$1,000 which she plans to spend for purchasing more goods for sale. She promises to repay the loan within 6 months and thanks everybody who decides to support her.

loans.use: Purchase of goods for sale

loans.name: Victoria Ursula

texts.en:
Victoria is a 35-year-old mother of two children. She has a store located in the Santa Elena neighborhood where she sells household supplies, vegetables, meat, fruit, etc., with the help of her niece and children during their free time. Every day Victoria goes to the market at five in the morning to buy products that are out of stock.

Victoria is a member of the Imasumacc Village Bank, meaning “How Beautiful” in Quechua, the native language of Peru. She needs a loan of 3,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles to invest in sugar, rice, cooking oil, noodles, and various soups.

Victoria’s dream is to construct a second floor for her house, to stock more products for her business, and to support her children until they become professionals.

loans.use: to invest in sugar, rice, cooking oil, noodles, and various soups

loans.name: Jesus Rigoberto

texts.es:
Hello friends! My name is Jesús Rigoberto G. V.. I am a twenty-four-year-old bachelor and live with my mother, Mrs. Rita V. Romero. I am requesting this loan since we need to install concrete flagstone for our house because we have a roof made of plates. As a result, when the weather is cold, our house is very cold. I work as an operator in a factory and my mother helps me in any way she can.

Jesús Rigoberto G. V. is in the process of applying for home improvement assistance through a Mexican government program called Conavi. Conavi assists very low-income families by providing a small housing improvement subsidy that supplements a housing loan. This Kiva loan can thus have a big impact, since it is supplemented by additional funds that this low-income family will use to improve their housing circumstances.

Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva Volunteer.

“Hola amigos de kiva, mi nombre es Jesús Rigoberto G. V. tengo 24 años soy soltero y vivo con mi mama la Sra. Rita V. Romero estoy solicitando este préstamo, ya que necesitamos poner una losa de concreto para nuestra casa porque tenemos techo de lamina, y en tiempo de frío nuestra casa es muy helada; trabajo como operador de una fabrica y mi mama me ayuda en lo que puede.”

loans.use: The installation of concrete flagstone

loans.name: Joshua Timber Sales Group

texts.en:
This is Martin T. and Mustapha T.. They named their group Joshua. 

Martin T. is the leader of this group. Martin owes a chain saw and trades timber at Pamlap, a village around the outskirt of Makeni. He has been in his current business for 6 years now. Martin was born in Pamlap. He is 40, married with 4 children. Two of his children are in secondary schools and the other two are not attending school. The boy dropped out of school and the girl had a teenage pregnancy. Martin now has the great task of caring for the pregnant girl and encouraging the remaining two to be steadfast in their schooling. 

His previous loans with SMT have helped him a great deal. Out of the proceeds of his business, he could solve his numerous problems. He could send his children to school, attend to them when they are sick, feed and clothe them. Martin faces some few challenges in his business, like the lack of transportation for the timbers to the main roads, and enough capital to employ a larger labor force. Nevertheless, with the numerous loans he got from SMT, Martin has been able to buy himself a plot of land for the future construction of a house.

The other members of this group are now receiving loans from SMT as individual clients, while these two still remain together as a group. They have been with SMT for over 5 years now. These SMT loans are a great help to these entrepreneurs. These people's businesses have been growing as a result of the continuous access to loans they have been getting from SMT. But they still need new loans as it is the continuous access to financial services that can eradicate or reduce poverty.

loans.use: Improve their businesses

loans.name: Rahimjon

texts.ru: Лутфиев Рахимджон проживает в городе Курган-тюбе. Возраст 22 года, женат и имеет двоих детей. Занимается торговлей. Имеет торговую точку , которую арендует у своих родственников. Занимается бизнесом уже три года. Привозит товар из города Душанбе, покупая в оптовых  магазинах . Планирует получить кредит для покупки товара. Этим она увеличит товарооборот . Погасить кредит планирует в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Rahimjon L. lives in the city of Kurgan-Tube. He is 22 years old, married and has two children. For the last three years Rahimjon has been managing a shop which he rents from his relatives. He drives in goods from Dushanbe where he can purchase them cheaply from wholesale stores. In order to expand the store's inventory Rahimjon needs to purchase another large batch of goods and he plans to finance the purchase by taking out this loan. He wants to pay back the loan in the next 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of goods

loans.name: Fikrat

texts.en: Fikrat was born in 1975. This man is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Kalbadjar region, and he settled in the Khirdalan settlement. Six years ago he started this business. He transports goods with his truck. Now he needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy the spare parts for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen Adrew sells sugar, beans, soap, and beer and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Hellen is 25 years old, married, and has four children. Her husband is a soldier. Her children all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services. These programs and services are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mrs. Mao C. is a villager in Kraing Tachor village in Kampong Speu province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Phan Phang, is a bed maker. They have a child who is a laborer. Although Mrs. Mao C.’s family members have different businesses, they still earn little income to support the family, and they also live in an old house. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Mao C. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to build a new house for her family to live in comfortably. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To help build a new house for her family to live in comfortably.

loans.name: Jannat Abdul Nishar Group

texts.en:
Jannat baji is a 24-year-old married woman who has lived in Borewala, Pakistan all of her life. She couldn't get an education because her parents couldn’t pay for her educational expenses. Her husband, A. N., has been selling wood for the past 2 years. 

Jannat baji is the mother of two children: one son and one daughter. Her son is 4 years old and her daughter is just 1 year old. Jannat baji stays at home and share her husband’s financial burden by embroidering dresses. She collects orders from the neighbors and charges $3 for each embroidered dress. She is applying for a loan to buy more wood to expand her husband’s wood business. 

She is the leader of a group of women in her neighborhood. Jamila baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. Shagufta Parveen baji wants a loan to buy clothes for her clothing business. Another woman, also named Jamila baji wants a loan to buy wood to resell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy wood to resell

loans.name: Socorro

texts.es:
Desde hace ocho meses Socorro se dedica a la venta de limones al por mayor, distribuyéndolos en diferentes mercados de su localidad  También desde hace un buen tiempo vende comida por pensión. Ella prepara determinados números de platos y los reparte a sus clientes que, por lo general, trabajan como obreros en alguna empresa.
Antes de estos dos trabajos ella se dedicaba a la venta de pescado en un puesto ambulante. Este negocio lo tuvo por el tiempo de dos años, hasta que se animó a vender limones, ya que el precio de los mariscos aumentó. 
En estos días está pensado vender ropa según los pedidos que le hagan amigos, familiares y conocidos de estos. Más delante quisiera abrir un negocio más estable en su casa, tal vez una bodega.
Socorro tiene cinco hijos, pero ya cuatro de ellos son independientes y la ayudan con los gasto de la casa, pues Socorro es viuda desde hace unos años.
texts.en:
For eight months, Socorro has been selling wholesale lemons, distributing them at various markets throughout her area. She has also been selling meals for quite some time. She prepares a certain number of meals and gives them to her customers, who generally work for some company.

Before getting involved in these activities, she used to sell fish as a street vendor. She was in business for two years, until she decided to sell lemons because seafood prices increased.

She is now thinking about selling custom order apparel to her family, friends and acquaintances. In the future, she would also like to start a more stable business from home, or perhaps in a store.

Socorro has five children who are all independent and help her with the household expenses because she has been a widow for a few years.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase lemons and apparel

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more drinks in bulk for her business

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
Maxima A. is a 50-year-old widow.  She lives in the simple village of Barangay Minanga Proper in Angadanan, Isabela.  She has two children: Judith, 31, and Raffy, 28. Her children are both married.  She lives with her youngest child.

Maxima has been a snack and vegetable vendor for almost 25 years. She strives to work hard to help her son in supporting their daily basic needs.  She is applying for a loan amounting to PHP 8,000.00, which she will use as capital for her vending business. Maxima hopes that through the financial support of the lenders, her business will improve to support her family.

loans.use: Business capital to improve her vending business

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn V. is 37 years old . She's married and happily raising her 6 children. Her husband went into farming to sustain the needs of the family. Arlyn think that farming will not always serve their needs so she decided to put up a mini grocery business. From this, she earns extra money that will somehow replenish their everyday needs.

Arlyn's mini grocery store sells staple goods. This helps a lot of people around them for they can directly access their needs. Arlyn needs to have more stock in her mini grocery for her to accommodate all the demands of her customers.

Arlyn is a current member of HSPFI (a Kiva Partner). She wants to express her gratitude to the organization that supported her business. Without hesitation, Arlyn now is applying for loan amounting to PHP 11,000. This is intended for buying goods and other items needed for the mini grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her mini grocery store

location.town: Tuburan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Koeun

texts.en: Koeun P., 29, pictured with her husband and two of her children, lives with four of her children in the Takeo province. She and her husband are vegetables sellers who typically make about US $50 in revenue each day. Koeun P. is asking for a loan of US $800 to purchase vegetables to sell at the market. She is confident that this loan will allow her to increase her daily income and better support her family.

loans.use: To buy vegetables for resale

loans.name: Bushra Muhammad Afzal Group

texts.en:
Bushra baji is the leader of a loan group that includes eight other women from her locality. Bushra baji is a very hardworking lady who sells kites. She has chosen this business because it’s profitable and people retain interest in flying kites. Bushra baji works to help ease the financial burden of her husband, who buys leather and sells it to factories. Bushra baji is applying for a loan to buy leather to help increase her husband's profits.

The other members of the group also have goals for this loan.

Saima baji and Zareena baji each want a loan to buy leather to resell.
Sakina baji wants a loan to buy timber to sell. 
Sugran baji wants a loan to buy another motorbike for her bike rental business.
Salma baji wants a loan to buy another video game for her video game shop.
Parveen Fatima baji wants a loan to buy kites for her kite sales business. 
Kareema baji wants a loan to buy mobile phones for her mobile phone sales business. 
Shahida Parveen baji wants a loan to buy goats to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy leather to sell

loans.name: Zarah Mae

texts.en:
Zarah Mae C. is from the town of Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 23 years old. Zarah Mae is married and has two infant children. To make a living, Zarah Mae runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Zarah Mae is just starting this business.

In 2009, Zarah Mae joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Zarah Mae is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Zarah Mae from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria  A. , 36, is a mother of 4 girls  ages 13, 11, 10,5 and a wife to a sewer. She runs a small sewing business and a sari-sari store.  They live in a small indigent community at Panganiban St., Concepcion 2, Marikina City.
Gloria and Walter were both skilled sewers making shirts, pants and bags in a big sewing company when they met. This has been their source of income  until Gloria gave birth to their youngest daughter. They decided  to resign from their work and accept sewing jobs at home instead so they could still earn a living while attending to the needs of their growing children.  For two years now, they are working as  sub- contractors to Natasha, a big name local manufacturer.
The need to have an everyday income drives  Gloria to put up a small sari-sari store where she used her previous loan in CCT.  Utilizing her new loan, Gloria plans to add more goods to her fast growing store.  
In the future, Gloria plans to acquire 3 more sewing machines and hire a few seamstresses to help  them with the business because with only 2 sewing machines at the present, their capability to accept bigger job orders is limited

loans.use: more goods for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia  es socia del Bancomunal Melcochita.
Eugenia es casada tiene 8 hijos el menor tiene 15 años y esta estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Eugenia  vendía golosinas en el tiempo de verano en  las calle,  en el invierno estaba en su casa y una vecina le animo para que entrara al negocio de reciclado, ella sale todas las noches  de 7 a 11 p.m. a recoger cosas y al día siguiente lo lleva a vender a un deposito  de reciclaje, también  ella  compra  reciclaje a otras personas.
Desde que Eugenia esta en Finca  aprendió administrar su negocio y trabajar la plata.
Eugenia  necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para  la compra de reciclaje, todo lo que le lleven a vender.    
El sueño de Eugenia es tener su bodega, ya esta comprando un aparador.
texts.en:
Eugenia is a member of the Melcochita Community Bank. Eugenia is married and has 8 children. The youngest is 15 years old and is in a state school. Eugenia sold sweets in the street during the summer, and in the winter, she was in her house and a neighbor encouraged her to start a recycling business. Every night, from 7pm to 11pm, she goes to collect things and the next day, she takes them to sell at a recycling center. She also buys recyclable items from other people. Since Eugenia has been in Finca, she has learned to manage her business and work with money. Eugenia needs a loan of 1200 soles so that she can buy recyclable items, which she will then sell. Eugenia’s dream is to have a small store, as she has already bought a dresser.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy recyclable items, which she will then sell

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: Don José R. M. tiene 38 años de edad, habitante de la comarca Samaria de la comunidad de Villa del Carmen, municipio de Managua, casado, su esposa ama de casa, tiene cuatros hijos, viven en casa propia y dentro de sus planes es ofrecerle mayor protección y comodidad a su familia. Don José se desempeña como Conductor en la Alcaldía de Villa del Carmen desde hace seis meses, anteriormente trabajaba como conductor en una empresa privada. Ha encontrado como principal dificulta la falta de financiamiento para construir su vivienda. Gracias al préstamo en Afodenic comprara materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, piedrines. Logrando la construcción de un anexo y poder tener comodidad y seguridad con su familia.
texts.en:
Don José R. M. is 38 years old. He is an inhabitant of the Samaria region of the community Villa del Carmen, municipality of Managua. He is married. His wife is a housewife. They have four children and live in their own home. His plan is to provide greater protection and comfort to his family. José has worked as a driver in the city Hall of Villa del Carmen for six months. Previously he worked as a driver in a private enterprise. His greatest problem is the lack of financing to build his dwelling. Thanks to the loan from Afodenic he bought building materials such as: cement, iron, and stone. He hopes to complete the construction of an annex to his home to be able to have comfort and security with his family.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials to complete an annex to his home.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma L. is from the town of Katipunan. She is 48 years old. Vilma is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Vilma owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Vilma has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Vilma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vilma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Vilma is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Vilma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to the borrower's house. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Ntowor Group

texts.en:
Ntowor is a group of five borrowers, led by J. S., who live and work in Westpoint, a very poor neighborhood near downtown Monrovia, Liberia. J. is 42 years old, and married with five children aged 15-30. He also cares for his siblings. He is a 7th grade drop-out.  

J.’ business is his dry goods shop. He buys building materials such as locks, nails, glue, wood planks, etc. wholesale and then sells them to the residents of Westpoint in a small shop. He has been running his business for 19 years. His dream is to expand his business and become a big businessman. J. is requesting a loan to buy more building materials to serve his customers in Westpoint. With the profits from his business, he dreams of sending his children to school so that they have a better future.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials at wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase supplies for painting his taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat de taxi-moto

loans.name: Ana Marixa

texts.es: Ana Marixa G. es una mujer separada de su pareja sentimental, tiene 37 años edad, vive con su madre quien es una persona de edad avanzada  la cual necesita de los cuidos y atenciones de Ana, ella maneja su propio negocio en un mercado de San Salvador, donde vende ropa para damas y caballeros, con los ingresos que Ana genera logra absorber los pagos fijos del hogar, pero en estos últimos meses Ana se ha visto en la necesidad de generar más ingresos ya que sus madre con frecuencia necesita de medicinas y pago de transporte para movilizarla a sus consultas, es por ello que Ana solicita un crédito que le dé la oportunidad de seguir ampliando su negocio para incrementar sus ingresos
texts.en:
Ana Marixa G. is separated from her domestic partner, is 37 years old, and lives with her mother, an older person in need of Ana's care and attention. She runs her own business in the San Salvador market, selling women's and men's clothing. With what she earns, Ana takes care of her home's fixed expenses, but lately, she has had greater income need, as her mother frequently needs to get medicine and to pay for the transportation to go to doctors' appointments. Ana is requesting a loan that would allow her to continue expanding her business and increasing her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stocking her business

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora Maria es socia del Banco Comunal “Juchuy Niño” ubicado en el  distrito de Capachica, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; tiene 34 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene 6 hijos, vive la comunidad de Capana, estudió educación primaria (incompleta).

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde la fundación del Banco Comunal, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de la pesca artesanal.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar mallas y cambiar las que ya están deterioradas, ella  realiza la pesca  en le lago Titicaca, y luego vende su producto en las plazas de Juliaca y Capachica.

Su mayor deseo es poder comprarse una casita en Juliaca y dar educación a  sus hijos.

A ella le  gustan  las charlas y las reuniones.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of Juchuy Niño community bank in the Capachica district of Puno province, department of Puno. She is 34 years old, married, and has 6 children. She lives in the community of Capana and did not complete primary school education. Maria has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos since the group was established; her first loan of 300 PEN allowed her to increase working capital for her work in traditional small-scale fishing. Currently, she needs a loan of 500 PEN that will allow her to buy to nets to replace the ones she has that are in poor condition. Maria fishes in Lake Titicaca and sells her catch in the town plazas of Juliaca and Capachica. Her greatest wish is to buy able to buy a house in Juliaca and provide her children with an education. Maria enjoys her group's meetings and workshops.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fishing nets.

loans.name: Adyasuren

texts.en:
Adyasuren is 38 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in a house in the Uvurkhangai province of Mongolia. His oldest daughter, 12, attends a local secondary school and his younger daughter, 3, is in kindergarten. Adyasuren operates a welding business in his town where he repairs and builds metal products for his customers. He began his business in 2006 after working as a welder in a factory for several years. With his business profits, he was able to not only pay the tuition fees for his daughters’ education, but he was also able to build a house where his family could live comfortably. Adyasuren is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~1400 USD) loan in order to expand his working space and overall business so that he can serve his customers better.

About XacBank XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia

loans.use: To expand his working space and overall business

loans.name: Folro

texts.en:
Folro L.'s main source of income comes from providing transport services with his habal-habal (a motorcycle with an extended seat that carries 2-6 passengers) in his community. He is 41 years old, widowed and has two school-age children. They are from the village of Yumbing, Mambajao, in the province of Camiguin. Folro has been in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Folro joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Folro is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be his first loan from HSPFI. He plans to use additional revenue to improve and expand his business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Shyryl

texts.en: 24-year-old Shyryl farms for a living. She is married and has a four-year-old child. She wants to save up for her child’s future so she works hard to do that. She cultivates her land for rice crops. She shares that her harvest went well and she hopes to double it up this time. She is now preparing the land for planting and is in need of farm supplies. She requested a loan of 12,000 PHP from CEVI. She will use this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies needed at her farm. This loan will help Shyryl have an abundant harvest.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Bendoline

texts.en:
Bendoline M. is from the village of Pantad Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 28 years old. Bendoline is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Bendoline operates a service-based business, providing transportation services ("habal-habal') in the local community. Bendoline has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $225 a month from this activity.

In 2010, Bendoline joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Bendoline is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in her business. This will be her 2nd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To procure increased stock of electrical and electronic parts.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys es una persona emprendedora con muchos sueños por delante, tiene 48 años, es madre de 4 jóvenes, pero vive sólo con uno de ellos, Raúl de 20 años.
Alcanzar sus objetivos, siempre fue el motor para emprender un negocio, ella se considera una mujer “mil oficios”. Desde hace 12 años es coordinadora y vendedora de los eventos organizados por una empresa de bebidas; también comercializa productos de belleza de diferentes marcas y los fines de semana alquila su casa como recreo turístico, donde ofrece comidas típicas. A su vez, como estudió técnica en enfermería trabaja en las campañas de salud con el centro médico de su zona. Ella se siente muy orgullosa de sí misma y está satisfecha con sus logros, porque sus ventas y su capital se incrementan. Por tal motivo, para el futuro piensa construir la parte delantera de su vivienda e instalar una botica para vender fármacos especialmente a las personas de bajos recursos económicos o a quienes más lo necesitan, pues asegura que “en la vida no todo es ganar, también tenemos que servir para los demás”.

Este es el quinto préstamo que tiene con MFP, siendo ella la presidenta de su banco comunal y quien motiva a sus socias a seguir ahorrando y realizando actividades para hacer crecer sus utilidades grupales. Ahora Gladys quiere emprender un nuevo negocio, por eso con los mil quinientos soles que ahora solicita comprará sandalias y polos para comercializarlos en las ferias semanales que se desarrollan en su ciudad.
texts.en:
Gladys is an enterprising person with lots of dreams to fulfill. She is 48 and has four children. But, she only lives with one of them, 20 year old Raúl. Reaching her objectives has always been the driving force to undertake a business. She considers herself to be a woman of “1,000 jobs”. For 12 years she has been the coordinator and salesperson for organized events for a drink company. She also sells different brands of beauty products. On the week ends she rents her house as a tourist attraction, and she sells typical foods. She studied to be a nurse technician, and she works on the health campaigns with the medical center in her area. She is very proud of herself, and she is happy with her achievements because her sales and her capital have increased. That is why, in the future, she plans to build in front of her house and set up a pharmacy to sell medicine. She will sell especially to people with low economic resources or those who need it the most. She says, “In life everything is not about getting, we also have to help others”. This is her fifth loan with MFP. She is the president of her communal bank, and she motivates its members to keep saving and working to make their group’s profits grow. Now Gladys wants to undertake a new business. To do so, she will use the requested 1,500 PEN to buy watermelons and polo shirts. She will sell them at the weekly fairs that take place in her city.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in a new business

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Tiessiri sont majoritairement mariées, ont en moyenne 42 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Kantela relevant  de Massigui, préfecture de Dioila, deuxième  région administrative de la république du Mali.
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et font  essentiellement l’achat vente de condiments alimentaires et  des céréales.
Après avoir correctement remboursé leur premier prêt, les femmes du groupe Tiessiri  sont à leur  2  prêt solidaire.
Elles comptent utiliser ce  prêt pour acheter, 3 tonnes de céréales (haricot mil, maïs, fonio, riz) et  une grande quantité  de condiments alimentaires. 
Elles s’approvisionnent essentiellement sur place auprès des producteurs de céréales et grossistes de condiments au marché hebdomadaire de Massigui et effectuent leurs ventes  sur place au marché de Massigui et à Kantela à domicile, au comptant en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15.000FCFA qui servira à étoffer leur fonds de commerce et subvenir aux dépenses ayant trait à la nourriture, à la scolarité des enfants et à la santé.
texts.en:
The women of the group Tiessiri are mostly married, they have an average age of 42, with 5 children each on average and they all live in traditional extended families in the town of Kantela, close to Massigui, in the county of Dioila, the second administrative region of the republic of Mali. These woman know each other through neighborhood conenctions and family ties. Their business is essentially the sale of condiments and grains/ cereals. Having properly repaid their first loan, the women of the group Tiessiri are on their second group loan. They will use this loan to purchase 3 tons of cereals (beans, millet, corn, fonio (a millet-like grain) and rice), and a large quantity of condiments. They mostly supply themselves locally with the cereal farmers and condiment wholesalers in Massigui's weekly market. They sell their goods in the marketplace of Massigui and in Kantela from their homes, for cash and credit to a clientele composed of men and women. They envision each earning a monthly income of 15,000 FCFA, which they will use to reinforce their business' funds and provide for their food expenses, their children's tuition and for their healthcare costs.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase general food products

loans.name: Yakubkhan

texts.en:
T. Yakubkhan is dedicated to agriculture and the sale of cultivated vegetables. This means that he can be around his family, helping to improve their quality of life and educate his three children.
Yakubkhan has been characterized as hardworking, and he has been working in agriculture since he was very young. This kind of work requires effort, dedication and above all, strength, as it can include heavy work, meaning that people get tired quickly. In spite of this, Yakubkhan is determined to raise his family's standard of living and improve the quality of the seeds he cultivates. For this reason, he is asking for help in order to receive more credit from Kiva partner, IMON International.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.
However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Teresa Gómez

texts.es: Teresa Gómez L. C. de 54 años de edad, reside municipio de El Calvario, ubicado en Sensuntepeque. Vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como profesor, así mismo junto a su hijo de 18 años de edad, el cual se dedica a estudiar en la universidad. Teresa se dedica a la confección de vestidos de fiestas y ocasiones especiales como bodas, graduaciones y 15 años, la calidad de sus costuras es muy buena por lo que posee una amplia clientela. Así mismo posee un pequeño bazar en el cual comercializa accesorios para hace recuerdos, álbunes para fotografías, centros de mesas y todo lo relacionado con eventos especiales. Teresa solicita un préstamo a Integral con el deseo de pode mejorar su negocio para obtener mayores ganancias las cuales son de mucha ayuda para su hogar, ella desea poder comprar más tela, flores artificiales para hacer los arreglos entre otras cosas más las cuales son muy útiles para realizar su trabajo. Ella es una mujer muy responsable, por lo que cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos, ya que siempre realiza su trabajo de la mejor manera.
texts.en:
Teresa Gómez L. C. is 54 years old. She lives in the town of El Calvario, located in Sensuntepeque. She lives with her husband, who works as a teacher, and her 18 year old son, who is studying at the university. Teresa makes dresses for parties and special occasions such as weddings, graduations, and for 15 year olds. Her sewing is of very good quality and she has a lot of customers. She also has a small store where she sells accesories to make favors, photo albums, centerpieces and everything related to special events. Teresa is asking Integral for a loan with the wish to improve her business and have more income. This would be a big help for her home. She wants to buy more fabric and artificial flowers to make arrangements among other things that are very useful for her job. She is a very responsible woman, and she has good references with her neighbors since she always does her work in the best way.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabric and accesories to make party favors.

loans.name: Cook Women Group

texts.en:
Annie B. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Cook Women. She is 48 years old, married, and has five children aged from 8 to 30 years old. Annie did not have the privilege of going to school.
For 18 years, Annie has been involved with a mini restaurant business on Center Street, downtown Monrovia, Liberia. She says that she started her business with 800 LRD and now has 7,650 LRD as her current operating capital. She explains that customers are attracted to her business because she prepares delicious food, which keeps them coming back. Annie plans to use her 6,000 LRD portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to buy more rice and oil, and to recondition and upgrade her shop to full restaurant status.
In the photo that accompanies this profile, Annie is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution, with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more rice and oil, and recondition and upgrade her shop to full restaurant status

loans.name: Charlita

texts.en:
Charlita M. is from the village of Barangay Poblacion, Diadi, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 54 years old and married with five adult-aged children. To make a living, Charlita operates a business of selling a variety of fruits and vegetables in her community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $100 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Charlita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Charlita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase more products. This will be her 2nd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Nhek

texts.en:
Nhek N., 46, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for clay and ceramic products. 

She is a wood seller for an income of about $10 per day. Her husband is employed in a governmental department in the province, earning an income of $2 per day to help cover the family's expenses.  

N. is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase more wood to expand her business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  

This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: Buy wood for resale

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mrs. Heng C. is a 57-year-old villager who lives in Andoung Samretth village in the Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 3 hectares of land in which to cultivate rice and she can also earn some income through selling cakes.

In order to increase her income to improve her family's living conditions and in order to support her farming, Mrs. Heng C. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. With the rest of the loan, she wants to buy fertilizer, pesticide and rice seeds for her crop. Mrs. Heng C. is a widow with two children; one is an iron welder while the second one is a farmer.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding and to buy fertilizer, pesticide and rice seeds

loans.name: Emmanuel Group

texts.es: Doña Cristina  tiene 46 años de edad, casada de oficios Domésticos, tiene 5 hijos y tres únicamente viven con ella, se dedica a Bordar Güipiles a mano, cuenta con 15 años de experiencia. Con otras once señoras entusiastas conforman el  Banco Comunal llamado EMMANUEL, el préstamo recibido lo invertirá como capital de trabajo adquiriendo  materia prima, ya que con este tipo de negocio se necesita de una buena inversión para poder surtir colores en cada Güipil. El mismo ayudara a poder incrementar la demanda y su mayor anhelo es tener empleados y expandir su producto en el mercado guatemalteco.
texts.en:
Cristina is 46 years old, married, and a stay-at-home mother. She has five children, three of whom live with her. She works hand-embroidering güipiles (a type of poncho), and has 15 years experience of doing this. She formed the community bank called "Emmanuel" along with 11 other enthusiastic women. The received loan will be used for business capital to acquire raw materials as, in this type of business, you need good investment to be able to stock all the colors used in each güipil (poncho). This will also help to increase demand and her greatest desire is to have employees and expand her sales in the Guatemalan market.

Translated from Spanish by AliS. Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity G. sells dresses, bedsheets, trousers and so on at the market, and is requesting a loan to stock coats and suits to sell.  

She is 41 years old, married to a secretary in the ministry of mining and industry, and has five children who all go to school.  

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to start up a dry cleaning shop.

loans.use: Stock coats and suits to sell

loans.name: Kindé Yvette

texts.fr: A. Kindé Yvette est née en 1967 à Ouidah, ville historique du Bénin. Yvette est veuve et mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Il y a près de dix sept ans que Yvette habite le quartier Akpakpa à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, avec ses enfants. Yvette a un autre enfant à sa charge, en plus de ses enfants. Yvette vit seule avec ses enfants et assure seule ses différentes charges. Pour y arriver, Yvette prépare et vend de la nourriture (pâte de maïs et riz accompagné de sauce) à Cotonou. Yvette s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Yvette exerce cette activité depuis une dizaine d'année et a déjà bénéficié de quatre crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Face à l'accroissement de sa clientèle, Yvette désire rehausser le niveau de son activité et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Kindé Yvette A. was born in 1967 in Ouidah, an historic town in Benin. Yvette is a widow with three school-aged children. She has lived in the Akpakpa quarter of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, with her children for almost 17 years. She has another child in her care as well as her own, and sees to their needs by herself. To do so, she prepares and sells food (corn and rice with sauce) in Cotonou. Yvette sources her goods from Dantokpa, Benin's international market, and has been in this line of work for around ten years. She has already received four loans which have all been successfully repaid. In light of rapid growth in her customer base, Yvette wishes to boost her business proposition and better satisfy those customers.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn, rice, and condiments and sauce

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.en: Gulnara K. is a resident of Balykchi, a nice town in Isykul region. Gulnara is 48 years old and she is divorced. She has a 15-year-old daughter and a 12-year-old son, both in school. Ten years ago, with the initial investment of 3000 soms ,Gulnara started a business purchasing milk in villages (about 30 liters per day) and selling it at the market for a profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase kitchen furniture which will improve her family's living conditions. ====================================== --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase kitchen furniture

loans.name: Mariata

texts.en: Mariata T. is currently in the business of selling dried fish, tomatoes, onions and beans at the market and is requesting a loan to stock bags of rice and jerrycans to sell.  Mariata is 45 years old and is married to a husband who is a soldier. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her children to live in.

loans.use: Stock bags of rice and jerrycans to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth Wachuka

texts.en:
ELizabeth has been selling clothes in Naivasha town for the last three years.  She is 42 years old, married to Samson N., and they have three children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her second loan.  She repaid her first loan of Kshs 15,000 well and on time.  She plans to add shoes as part of her stock for resale, and that is  why she has requested for this loan.

Elizabeth hopes her business will grow and she can move into a more permanent place  where she can rent a place to sell her clothes from.

loans.use: To buy shoes to resell

loans.name: Isabel Cristina

texts.es:
Isabel Cristina Teherán B., vive en el barrio Nelson Mandela de la ciudad de Cartagena en el departamento de Bolívar, ella y su cónyuge tiene el negocio de ofrecer el servicio de “fumigaciones Nelson González”, el cual  que inició desde hace ya cuatro años   de manera domiciliaría en su barrio y ahora   se ha extendido en toda la ciudad y gradualmente esta ganado reconocimiento.
Su cónyuge, en la fotografía con Isabel,  se encarga de las visitas puerta a puerta   y esta última  de la administración de los recursos. Este es el segundo financiamiento a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización con la que lleva un año de estar vinculada, y con la que hoy ha logrado mantener un nuevo capital de trabajo por sus financiamientos, Isabel cuenta que hoy cuenta con dos tanques de fumigación y una bomba de motor para fumigar; con su  credickiva espera reparar la bomba del motor , que últimamente no esta funcionando a un cien por ciento  y también comprará materiales e insumos que utiliza en cada oportunidad. Su principal desafío es tener un local para lograr realizar su negocio con las certificaciones que se requieren en el ejercicio de su actividad, las cuales están tramitando.
texts.en:
Isabel Cristina Teherán B. lives in the Nelson Mandela neighborhood of the city of Cartagena in the department of Bolívar. She and her husband have the service business “fumigaciones Nelson González” (Nelson González Fumigacion). They began the business out of their home in their neighborhood four years ago, and now it has extended throughout the city and is gradually gaining recognition. Her husband, seen in the photograph with Isabel, is in charge of door-to-door visits, and she is charged with administration.

This is their second loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which they have been involved for a year. They want to obtain new working capital with the financing.

Isabel states that they have two fumigation tanks and one motorized pump for fumigation. With their loan they hope to repair the pump, which lately hasn’t been working well, so that it is 100% functional. They will also buy materials that they will use on each job. Their main challenge is having a place where they can conduct their business which has the certifications required to carry out their activities, which they are processing.

loans.use: To repair a motorized pump that isn't 100% functional.  She will also buy materials that will be used on each job.

loans.name: Kalagala Development - Mpigi Group

texts.en:
N. Annet has been relentless and pertinacious in her self-willed determination to make something invaluable out of her dual farming and poultry business undertakings, which took root 10 years ago. Her business is located in Mpambire - Mpigi. She started this business after she got financial assistance from an international non-governmental organization. Before this, Annet, a mother of three kids and six dependants, was more inclined towards subsistence farming. Her unwavering resolve has seen her make many inroads in terms of attracting clients, going about her business in an organised way, and making steady profits. These inroads have also been manifesting themselves in improved standards of living for her family. 

Her business accrues 100,000 shillings a week. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice in bulk, which she will resell at length in wholesale bags, not by the kilos as for retail. She makes common cause with Kalagala Development Group - Mpigi.

loans.use: To purchase rice in bulk for resale

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen Kaipoi is a thirty eight year old industrious farmer in Magwara village, Kilgoris town. He is married to Lucy, a thirty one year old lady. They have four children, two daughters and two sons. 

Stephen does maize farming in Magwara area which has a rich soil for this type of crop.  It is planting  season in this area and Stephen has been awarded a Kshs 20,000 loan which he will use to buy maize seedlings, fertilizer and pay for labor costs. His plan is to keep a good credit record with KADET  Through making timely repayments he is assured of a subsequent loan.

His dream is to keep working hard in his agriculture business and maximize profits from his product sales in order to meet his family needs.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Kusi Killa Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal Kusi Killa inicia su ciclo 8 con 13 socias. Gregoria tiene 49 años, es casada y madre D. 4 hijos, el mayor tiene 20 años y la ultima 10 años. Gregoria se dedica al venta D. abarrotes en General como son azúcar, arroz, leche, huevo, aceite, detergente, jabón, champú, sillao, etc., este negocio se encuentra en su misma casa y lño atienD. desD. hace 6 años, la única dificultad que ella tiene es cuando bajan sus ventas. El préstamo que solicita lo empleará en la compra D.: jabón, champú, sillao azúcar, arroz, leche y huevo.
Gregoria es socia D. Finca Perú desD. hace 1 año y medio, le gustan las capacitaciones que le imparte la promotora en su Banco Comunal.
texts.en: The Kusi Killa Communal Bank is starting its 8th loan cycle, with 13 members.  Gregoria is 49 years old, married, and the mother of four children.  Her oldest son is 20 years old and her youngest daughter is 10.  Gregoria sells groceries like sugar, rice, milk, eggs, oil, detergent, soap, shampoo, soy sauce, etc.  The business is located in her house and she has run it for 6 years.  The only difficulty she faces is when her sales fall.  The loan she is requesting will be used to buy: soap, shampoo, soy sauce, sugar, rice, milk, and eggs.  Gregoria has been a member of Finca Perú for a year and a half  and she likes the the educational sessions the facilitator presents at her communal bank.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Kilima

texts.en:
J. is a 40-year-old businesswoman who is married to a public service vehicle driver. J. and her husband support a family of three. J. runs a second hand shoe shop which she started 5 years ago. From this business, she earns a profit of 5000 Kenyan shillings a month.

She is borrowing her second loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings which she intends to use to buy more shoes to sell during the Christmas season. She anticipates profits from the business which she plans to save and use in the future to buy a land lot for building rental houses.

Her hope is to become an excellent businesswoman and also to expand her business to selling new shoes as well as second hand shoes.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Sourn

texts.en:
Sourn P. is a 64-year-old widowed woman who currently lives with her children in Phnom Penh City. Sourn P. was married, but her husband died several years ago.  She has two daughters – one is married and lives away from home, and the other is single.  All of them are working in the construction field as workers. They share responsibility with her to support the family’s daily expenses. 

Sourn P. possesses some farmland that she inherited from her grandmother. She uses this land to grow different kinds of crops. She planted rice and vegetable crops two months ago, but her crops are not growing well because they need more fertilizer. To remedy the situation, she would like a loan to buy seeds and a few sacks of fertilizer for her crops to grow well.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Maria Carmela

texts.es:
María es socia del Banco Comunal Llamkasum, es casada, tiene 79 años y 6 hijos. Maria ha estado con FINCA por más D. 15 años, le encanta que su Banco Comunal le apoye cuando tiene necesidades financieras. Estuvo mal D. salud, aun está mejorando, todavía viaja mensualmente a Lima para recibir tratamiento. María no habría sido capaz D. pagar este tratamiento si no fuera por sus ahorros que tiene en FINCA Perú. 
María solicita un préstamo para abastecer D. productos su negocio y comprar productos como el azúcar, la harina y el arroz, los cuales venD. en una tienda que tiene en su casa. También se dedica a la crianza D. animales como vacas, pollos en su casa ubicada a una hora y media en las afueras D. Ayacucho. 
El sueño D. Maria es seguir ahorrando para tener dinero cuando realmente lo necesita como lo hizo cuando estaba enferma.
texts.en:
María is an associate of the Llamkasum Communal Bank.  She is married, 79 years of age and has 6 children. Maria has been with FINCA for more than 15 years.  She is pleased with her Communal Bank because they support her when she has financial needs. She has had poor health, but is improving.  She still travels to Lima monthly to receive treatments.  María would not have been able to pay for the treatments if it weren't for the savings that she has with FINCA Perú. 
María has requested a loan to supply her business with products and to buy products such as sugar, flour and rice, which she sells in a store that she has in her house.  She is also dedicated to raising animals such as cows and chickens at her home located an hour and a half from the outskirts of  Ayacucho. 
Maria's dream is to continue saving in order to have money when she really needs it, as she did when she was ill.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her general store

loans.name: Tep

texts.en:
Tep S., 46, is married with four adult children. She is married to Pheng, 38, a military policeman. Two of the children are employed in a restaurant, while the other two help her with her business. Tep S. has a small shop in her home where she sells food to her nearby neighbors. In the morning she sells porridge and in the evening she sells beef soup. 

Tep S. will use her loan to purchase a motorcycle for her kids to drive to their work place.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for driving to work

loans.name: Vitalina

texts.es: Vitaliana, de 72 años, vive en su casa que es propia, junto a su esposo Maximiliano de 74 años, vive en compañía de sus 2 hijos mayores de los 9 que tiene en total. Desde hace 20 años Vitaliana,  se dedica a la venta de gaseosa, agua mineral y cerveza fresca y helada, a un precio muy asequible. Desde entonces este negocio lo realiza en compañía de su esposo, mientras hace el mercado y las labores domésticas; solo así no pierde clientes. Le gusta mucho su negocio, por lo que atiende brindando un buen trato y a sus clientes, convirtiéndolo en el negocio más concurrido de su barrio, pese que este negocio lo desarrolla en el interior de su casa. Se siente muy contenta con su labor, y más aún cuando los fines de semana aumenta sus ventas. En adelante desea construir un local pequeño al costado de su casa, para vender variedad de productos. Es el 5to crédito con MFP, y como socia antigua se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente como hasta hoy. De obtener el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más gaseosa y cerveza al por mayor, para continuar realizando sus ventas.
texts.en:
Vitaliana is 72 years old and lives in her own home with her husband, 74 year-old Maximiliano, and their two eldest children.  She has nine children in total.

For the past 20 years, Vitaliana has been selling soda, mineral water and fresh and frozen beer at affordable prices.  She carries out her business together with her husband so that she can also do her shopping and household chores without losing customers.  Vitaliana enjoys her business a lot and  she always provides good customer service.  This has made hers the busiest business in the neighborhood, in spite of the fact that she carries out the business from her own home.

Vitaliana feels very happy in her work and she feels even happier on the weekends when her sales increase.  In the future, she would like to build a small premises next to her home so that she can sell a variety of products.

This is Vitaliana's 5th loan with MFP and, as a long-standing member, she pledges to keep making her repayments on time as she has up until now.  She will invest her loan money in buying more soda and beer wholesale, so that she can keep making her sales.

loans.use: To stock up with soda and beer

loans.name: Rodgers

texts.en: Rodgers is 25 years old and single. He owns vans which he uses for his transport business, in which he employs four people. Rodgers is an active member of Comrades group in Faulu Kenya and he pays his weekly dues faithfully. For this reason, the members of his group have guaranteed him a loan of 30,000 KES. He will use the money to repair one of his vans. Rodgers hopes to own more vans in the future.

loans.use: to repair his van

loans.name: Santos Simón

texts.es:
Santos es un padre de familia de  28 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío CP-3  del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores y aves de corral, el cría gallinas, patos, pavos y ganado ovino en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Esta actividad tiene una antigüedad de 4 años. Adicionalmente trabaja prestando servicio de transporte en su como mototaxi.

El desea adquirir alimento balanceado para sus aves  y ganado ya que la demanda está aumentando. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Santos es un padre bastante entregado a su familia y que siempre vela por su bienestar y desarrollo. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Santos is a 28 year-old father who lives with his wife and two children in his own home, in CP-3 village, in Tambogrande district, an agricultural area which is located in Piura region, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Santos raises and sells small animals and poultry.  He raises hens, ducks, turkeys and sheep in an area behind his home and when the animals have reached a good level of development he offers them for sale to the traders who visit his area.  Santos has been in this business for 4 years.  He also works providing a transport service in his 'mototaxi' (a motorbike with a cabin in back for transporting passengers).

Santos would like to buy some balanced animal feed for his poultry and sheep since demand is increasing.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

Santos is a father who is committed to his family and he is always looking out for their well-being and development.  Those who know him have a lot of respect and affection for him.

loans.use: To acquire balanced feed for his animals

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita Z., from the village of Maac, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province, is 52 years old, separated from her spouse, and has six grown children. To make a living, Merlita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, noodles, detergents, canned goods and toothpaste in the local community. Engaged in her business for over 10 years, she earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Merlita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting her first loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods and snack foods, Merlita plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods and snack foods

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 47 and married with six children between five and 18 years old. He is a farmer in Kisii Town in South Rift, Kenya, who practices mixed farming. Charles has been a farmer for the past twenty years. He employs two farmhands who work on his farms which produce tea, milk, and bananas for the local market. His retail shop compliments his farming income.

Charles is requesting a loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He is currently focusing on rearing dairy cows and hopes to own five good quality dairy cows in the near future. His greatest business challenges are price fluctuation and disease. Charles says that more productive breeds will ensure a good milk supply for his family’s consumption and generate income to educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Pelagie

texts.en:
Pelagie is 26 years old and is married with two children, ages 1 and 6 years old. Her business is well-organized and she sells sacks of sorghum for making local soft drinks.  She employs two people to help her. Her business operates from 6am until 7pm every day except on the weekend. She has two year`s experience in this business.

Pelagie has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more sacks of sorghum to sell. With any profits, she will expand her business and she will be able to save for the future.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of sorghum to sell

loans.name: Yopi

texts.en:
Yopi is a 52-year-old tractor driver. He and his family live in Babau Village, about 15 km from the city of Kupang. He is married to Feby, a 48-year-old woman and they have been blessed with 4 children namely: 
1.\tDesta, 20 years old, working in rice mills 
2.\tDesti, 17 years old, who is in the 3rd year of vocational school
3.\tDoni, 14 years old, in the 3rd year of junior high school
4.\tDani, 9 years old in the 3rd grade of elementary school 
Yopi has been working as a tractor driver for 2 years. At that time he bought a tractor with his own money. Incidentally Yopi’s house is situated close to the area of rice fields, which is why Yopi bought a tractor in order to look for a better income.
However, the tractor cannot be used every day because farmers who commonly use his tractor service are seasonal farmers.
