Within one year the farmers could only grow rice two times, so there are many days where Yopi is not able to use his tractor. This situation makes Yopi unable rely on the income from his tractor.
Yopi realizes that in his village there is only a rice milling machine, so that many farmers need to stand in a line to grind the rice. Yopi plans take this opportunity as a new effort to increase his income.
Yopi is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 10,000,000 from TLM. He is sure that buying the rice milling machine will greatly help farmers in his village so they do not have to queue for too long and spend money for transport as he plans to set the location for the rice milling machine near to their rice fields.

loans.use: To purchase a rice milling machine for rent

loans.name: Constancio Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Constancio tiene 36 años de edad, es divorciado, vive con su hijita de 6 años en la zona de el Palmar,  Hace 12 años que se vino de Cochabamba buscando mejores días y se compro su micro; desde entonces trabaja en el rubro de transporte, el crédito que se le otorgo es para mantenimiento de su micro (compra de repuestos nuevos, compra de llantas. etc.). El cliente quedo agradecido por la confianza que deposito en el la institución y por la rapidez del crédito, es una persona joven que desea darle un futuro mejor a su hijita.
texts.en:
Constancio, 36, is divorced.  He lives with his 6-year-old daughter in El Palmar.  He came to Cochabamba 12 years ago seeking better days and bought a microbus.  Since then he’s been working in transportation.

The loan he was granted was to service his microbus (to buy new replacement parts, tires, etc.)  He was grateful for the trust that the institution placed in him and for the speed with which the loan was granted.  He is a young person who wants to give his daughter a better future.

loans.use: to service his microbus and buy replacement parts for it.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es:
Adelaida es vecina  de Golfo Dulce de Puntarenas. Ella es una líder  con .  Gran deseo de superación.  
Su familia se dedico a la agricultura por muchos años. Y ahora  ella tiene el deseo de iniciar con su propio proyecto con cerdos. Es por eso que ella desea un préstamo de 300 000 (trescientos mil colones) para la compra de lechones  y material de construcción para empezar a desarrollar  su proyecto Familiar.
Ella desea involucrar a toda su familia en el negocio, y espera que sea todo un éxito.
Ella es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Golfo Dulce, una de las 110 empresas socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Adelaida lives in Golfo Dulce, Puntarenas.  She is a leader with a great desire for self improvement.

Her family was in farming for many years.  She now wants to start her own project with pigs.  Because of this she wants a 300,000 colones loan to buy piglets and building materials to start carrying out her family project.  She wants to involve her entire family in the business and hopes that it will be a complete success.

She is a member of the Golfo Dulce Communal Bank, one of EDESA’s 110 social enterprises in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy pigs and building materials.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria is a single woman, of 70 years old. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Candelaria has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.
Candelaria has been in this business for 50 years.  In the future, Candelaria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Tumalel

texts.en:
Tumalel is 30 years old, single, and supports his parents. His monthly income is KES.10,000. He has been a farmer for the past five years. Maize farming is doing well is his area due to favorable climatic conditions in the area.

He learned about KADET LTD through an advertisement done by KADET. He has been a good client, He repaid the previous loan well, and he's applied for a second loan with KADET LTD which he plans to use to buy farm supplies (wheat seeds & fertilizers).

He plans to plow the proceeds from the loan back into the farm. He has never taken another loan from an MFI. He is a genuine man who will struggle to achieve if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Angela Agustina

texts.es: Ángela Agustina tiene su actividad que es la venta de comida, desde hace más de 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad, esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos, pues tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar en Fundación. A pesar de sus problemas de salud, ha sabido sobrellevar su negocio sus clientes siempre llegan a buscar los deliciosos platillos que ofrece. Con el crédito comprara frijoles, queso, maduro, carnes, verduras y otros productos.
texts.en: Angela Agustina has had a food sales business and she has dedicated herself to this activity for more than 4 years. This is not the first time that she has a loan. She has been with Fundacion (Kiva Field Partner) for a long time. Despite her health problems she has been able to maintain her business. Her clients always come looking for the delicious meals which she offers. With the loan she will purchase beans, cheese, plantains, meats, vegetables and other products.

loans.use: to purchase beans, cheese, plantains, meats, vegetables and other products.

loans.name: La

texts.en: La, 45 years-old, is making baskets to sell. Her husband is a car driver and their income is $9 per day. She has four children.  Two are studying and the other two are working in a restaurant earning $2 a day each. Every month, she has to spend $70 on food, $15 on electricity, $40 on school fees, and $30 on transportation. She would like to request a loan of $200 to buy material for making baskets. She like her career and wants to sell more baskets if she can have enough money to buy from other makers.

loans.use: to buy material for making baskets.

loans.name: Loise

texts.en:
Loice is a 41-year-old widow from Kisumu who has three children. She has a produce business that she has been running for the past fourteen years.

Loice is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy onions, tomatoes and garlic to add to her stock. She will use her profits to enable her to pay the school fees for her children.

Loice hopes to buy a piece of land and build her own house in the future.

loans.use: To buy onions, tomatoes and garlic to add to her stock.

loans.name: Alamdar

texts.ru: Alamdar jenat no ne imeyet detey. On rodilsya v 1975 qodu. Alamdar yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey jenoy i mamoy. Alamdar skotovodstvu nauchilsya u svoyego dyadi kotoriy toje razvodil korov. Alamdar uje 7 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i rozvodit korov. SEychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya uvelicheniya kolichestvo skota dla razvitiya svoyego biznessa.
texts.en: Alamdar is married, but does not have children. He was born in 1975. Alamdar is an internally displaced person, he was relocated from the town of Fuzili and now lives in the Fuzili region together with his wife and mother. Alamdar learned about animal husbandry from his uncle who also bred cows. Alamdar has been doing animal husbandry and breeding cows for seven years already. At this time he needs 2000 AZN to buy cows to increase the headcount of cattle and to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: April

texts.en:
April is 29 years old and married with two children. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 9,500 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from farming rice. April works hard to provide for her family. 

April has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Sagynbu's Group

texts.en:
Sagynbu is the leader of this group. She is 60 and a widow. She has raised two daughters. The first daughter is married and lives separately with her family and the second daughter studies at university. 

In order to earn money Sagynbu breeds livestock and then resells it at a higher price after being fattened. In this way, she earns about 1,200 KGS per month. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase more livestock for breeding, fattening and further reselling. 

In the future Sagynbu wishes to purchase a vehicle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Sharshenbek

texts.ru: Шаршенбеку 49 лет, женат, имеет 3 детей.  Шаршенбек занимается животноводством и полеводством с 2001 года, начав бизнес всего лишь с 1,000 сом.  Для развития своего хозяйства, в 2008 года Шаршенбек два раза обращался в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитами, которые были отработаны и погашены без просрочек.   Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Шаршенбек обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» в третий раз  за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для откорма.  Доходы от кредита Шаршенбек планирует отправить на дальнейшее увеличение количества скота, а также – на улучшение жилищных условий для своей семьи.
texts.en: Sharshenbek is 49 years old, married and has three children.  He has been involved in animal husbandry and farming since 2001 and started his business only with 1,000 som.  In order to develop his business, Sharshenbek obtained two loans from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company in 2008 and repaid both in a timely manner.  In order to further grow his business, Sharshenbek requested a loan in the sum of 135,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase calves for fattening up.  He plans use the profits from this loan to increase livestock quantity and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for fattening up

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
Roger is 40 years old, married and blessed with six children. He has operated a three-wheeled motorcycle for 10 years as a source of income. He earns PHP 250 daily to buy food and pay his electric bill. This income is not enough to provide for the daily needs of his family members, so he is working hard to increase his income potential every day.

Roger joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which he will use for the maintenance of his motorcycle. He wants to purchase spare parts such as wheels and new tires for his motorcycle. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts such as wheels and new tires for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 46 years old and lives in Tipan, Oroquieta City. She is married with two children. 

To earn a living, Marlyn has a business selling items such as vegetable oil, sugar, Nescafé, Milo, milk, canned goods, soft drinks, etc. She earns about 2,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. Marlyn has a requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase a variety of products for her general store.

Marlyn has been a member of PMPC for six years.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of products for her general store.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia is 42 years old and is a married woman with three children. The oldest child is 15 years old. Delia makes rice cakes, lumpia (spring rolls) and other local delicacies. She sells her products to the people in her community. Delia also buys and sells dried fish. She requested this loan to buy flour, oil, sugar, lumpia wrappers and more dried fish to sell. She hopes for her business to improve.

loans.use: to buy flour, oil, sugar, lumpia (spring roll) wrappers and more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Marina Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Marina Rosa es casada, tiene 43 años de edad, no tuvo oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 7 hijos los cuales estudian, se dedica a la tejeduría, inició este trabajo como operario y hasta el momento lleva 9 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de hilos de diferentes clases y colores, para poder producir mas, ya que espera en el futuro tener trabajadores para su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Marina Rosa is 43 years old, married, and did not have the opportunity to study. She has seven children who are in school. Marina spends her time knitting. She started in this line of work as an operator and now has nine years of experience.

She is requesting a loan to by different types of yarn in various colors so that she can produce more. In the future, she hopes to hire workers for her business.

loans.use: to buy yarn for knitting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase drugs for his business

loans.name: Epifanía

texts.es:
La señora Epifania Ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable en cuanto a sus obligaciones con la fundación y con kiva. Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por darle la oportunidad de trabajar a través de los créditos y así seguir aumentando su negocio.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de Frazadas, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en: Epifania has proven to be a very responsible person regarding her commitments with the foundation and with Kiva.  She is thankful to Fundacion Paraguaya for giving her the opportunity to work with loans to grow her business.  She requests a loan to buy blankets, to help supply her business and meet her client's demands.

loans.use: to buy blankets for sale

loans.name: Luisa Amanda

texts.es:
Doña Luisa, sigue con sus ventas de comida, una variedad de fritanga, en donde ha captado su clientela, su esposo sigue trabajando y ambos siguen mejorando la infraestructura del negocio, con el credito anterior, logro cambiar laminas de zinc del bajarete de su negocio, levanto mas el fogon de la cocina con el objetivo de estar en mejores condiciones para preparar la venta.
Para Luisa este año ha sido, estable a pesar que en estos ultimos meses se ha visto bastante mal de salud, con dolores en la espalda, el cual tuvieron que someter a cirugia, y que se ha venido mejorando sactifactoriamente.
Es por tal razon, desea seguir, haciendo sus ventas, que con este nuevo financiamiento, comprara productos en granos basicos como: arroz, frijoles, bidon de aceite, azucar, carne, pollo, platanos y frutas para hacer refresco.   logrando tener sus ingresos, y poder ayudarse con la compra de los medicamentos que sigue tomando, para mejorar su salud.
Cuenta con el apoyo de sus tres hijos, los cuales son casados. Y sobre todo con el apoyo financiero de Afodenic.
texts.en:
Luisa is continuing with her business selling a variety of fried foods, where she has attracted a customer base.  Her husband continues to work, and they are both working to improve the infrastructure of her business.  With the previous loan, she was able to put new corrugated metal roofing sheets on the covered porch of her business, and raise the kitchen stove so as to improve the conditions of the place where she prepares her food to sell. 

For Luisa, this year has been stable, in spite of the fact that in the most recent months she has had some health problems with pain in her back.  Because of this, she had to undergo surgery, but she is recovering satisfactorily.

For this reason she wants to continue making her sales.   With this new loan, she will buy staple grain products such as: rice, beans, a drum of cooking oil, sugar, meat, chicken, and bananas and fruits to make drinks.  This will allow her to generate income which will help her to pay for the medications that she continues to need in order to improve her health.

Luisa relies on the support of her three children, who are married, and most importantly the financial support of AFODENIC.

loans.use: to buy products such as meat chicken, coca cola, and fruits and vegetables for her food business

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mrs. Mao operates a retail business from her house. She is 38 years old and a responsible mother of two children who attend a local public school. She sells many items like shampoo, powders, snacks, noodles, eggs and sweet things, earning approximately $1.50 per day. Mrs. Mao is going to expand her house and build an appropriate store for her business. What she really needs are funds from HKL and Kiva to supplement her savings to repair her house. In the future, she plans to sell many kinds of merchandise, enabling her to generate extra income.

loans.use: to repair and expand her house.

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es:
La Sra. María tiene su negocio de pulpería en su casa de habitación donde su clientela son habitantes del barrio, ella trabaja de lunes a domingos de seis de la mañana hasta las siete de la noche ella trabaja sola en la administración de su negocio.
Ella acude a las oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar un préstamo para la compra de mercadería para la pulpería tales como granos básicos, botería, gaseosa, todo esto para ofrecerles variedad de productos a su clientela.
texts.en:
María has a grocery store in her house, and her customers are neighborhood residents. She works Monday through Sunday from six in the morning until seven in the evening, and she runs the business alone.

María came to the Ceprodel offices to ask for a loan so she can buy merchandise like basic grains, canned goods and soft drinks for the store. She wants all this so she can offer her customers a variety of products.

loans.use: to buy products like basic grains, canned goods and soft drinks for her grocery store.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is 32 years old and married with two children ages four and 12. She sells used shoes to earn a living, and she has been in the business for three years. She describes her business environment as favorable for business because of little competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya she has been able to expand her business. She hopes to start a boutique in the future. She has applied for a loan of 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy more shoes to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Sergio Alonso

texts.es: Ser un artista a nivel mundial. Este es el sueño que se ha trazado este joven artista que desde niño mostro gran interés y fascinación por la música y la pintura y desde entonces se ha empeñado en crear obras las cuales han tenido muy buena acogida tanto así que son exhibidas en las mejores universidades de la ciudad, en busca de perfeccionar cada vez más su arte solicita un crédito para la compra de pinturas y materiales para obras plásticas, para realizar nuevos proyectos y expresar con sus manos lo que su corazón siente
texts.en:
To be an artist on a global level. This is the dream that has been mapped out by this young artist who since he was a child has showed great interest and fascination with music and painting.  Since then he has worked hard on his creations, which have been so good that they have been exhibited in some of the best universities in the city.  

In order to perfect his artistic skills he is asking for a loan to buy paint and materials for working with plastic.  Then he will be able to do new projects and express with his hands what he feels in his heart.

loans.use: to buy paint and materials to work with plastic.

loans.name: Clorinda

texts.en:
My prinicipal activity is cooking foods and baking egg-yolk bread. My business is located in my home in the community Quebrada Larga. My earnings help me to support my children with their studies and in daily family expenses.

Loan Use: Purchase flour, beans, sugar, salt, vegetables, rice, oil and other items.

Mi actividad principal es la elaboracion de comidas y pan de yema, el negocio lo tengo ubicado en mi casa de habitacion en la Comunidad de Quebrada Larga. Los ingresos que he recibido me han ayudado apoyar a mis hijos en sus estudios y en los gastos familiares.

loans.use: Compra de harina, frijoles, azucar, sal, vegetales, arroz, aceite y otros

loans.name: Puao

texts.en: The SPBD’s outreach program has proven successful for Puao S., a business woman and one of the best known tailors in her village. Puao specializes in sewing puletasi, muumuu (dress) and men’s shirts. She also makes beautiful and unique elei prints for individuals and organizations like the Samoa Tourism Authority. Puao also receives requests from overseas clients, which acts as another stepping stone in expanding her business and providing more income for Puao and her family. She hopes to soon be able to make more money than the current 250 tala (US$80) weekly profit.

loans.use: Purchase of a new sewing machine, an overlock machine and fabrics

loans.name: Seepa

texts.en: Fifty-eight year old Seepa T. weaves mats and other household items in the traditional Samoan method.  Seepa does some weaving herself but her main source of income is preparing the material used for weaving and selling this to other traditional Samoan weavers.  Seepa is pictured here in front of the laupaono plant.  This native plant has strong leaves that are cut, stripped of their thorns and dried.  These dried leaves form the basic material used for weaving Samoan mats and other goods.  She is seeking a loan so that she can acquire the knives and other tools she needs to keep preparing the leaves and supplying them to Samoan weavers.

loans.use: to buy a set of knives and other tools to prepare laupaono leaves for weaving and selling

loans.name: Juan Ruperto

texts.es:
Mr. Juan is 42 years old. He has been working since he was 12 years old, when he started to work assisting his father in construction jobs. At 18, he moved to the capital in search for a job which he got in a Glass Work Shop. He saved for several years and learned a lot about the business since he had decided to go back to his hometown and start his own business.

It was hard to him to start with his own shop since he worked alone and had no help. Furthermore, he had to bring all of his supplies from the capital which is 4 hours away. Little by little his business progressed and today he employs two other people.

Since everything is going well, and the demand for his work has increased, Juan wished to repair his shop and build a room to exhibit his works, for which he is requesting a loan for $450.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


El Sr. Juan tiene 42 años de edad. Trabajo desde la corta edad de 12 años, empezó a trabajar como ayudante de albañilería de su padre, a los 18 años fue a la capital para buscar trabajo y consiguió un puesto en una vidriería, ahorro varios años y aprendió bastante sobre el rubro, por lo que decidió volver a su ciudad y abrir su propio negocio. Le fue muy difícil empezar con su vidriería pues trabajaba solo sin ayuda, además los materiales tenía que traerlos de la capital que queda a 4 horas de la ciudad donde vive, poco a poco fue progresando y hoy ya cuenta con la ayuda de dos personales más. Como todo marcha bien, y la demanda de su trabajo ha aumentado, Juan desea refraccionar su local y hacer un salón para poder exhibir sus trabajos, para lo que necesita un crédito de $ 450.

loans.use: Shop repairs and extension / Refaccion y ampliación del local

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy a glass display case

loans.name: Juana Pastora

texts.es:
Selling shoes by catalog is the way Juana Pastora earns money to help her son grow healthy. Three years ago Juana decided to sell shoes by catalog to her neighbors and friends. Little by little her customer base started to increase thanks to the support of her husband who sells shoes where he works.

Today Juana Pastora is requesting a $200.00 dollar loan from you to be paid in 4 months. With this help she will be able to buy shoes for winter season and also for those customer in search of a gift for their families or friends. With your help a family will have money to enjoy this Christmas.

Translated from Spanish by Yvette Diaz Kiva volunteer.

Vendiendo zapatos por catálogo es la manera en que Juana Pastora, ayuda a conseguir dinero para que su hijo pueda crecer saludable. Desde hace tres años Juana se decidió a vender zapatos por catálogo a vecinas y familiares, y así poco a poco empezó a abrirse camino entre clientes, y con la ayuda de su esposo vende zapatos a compañeros de la fábrica dónde trabaja su esposo.

Juana Pastora hoy está acudiendo a ustedes para que le puedan otorgar un préstamo de US $200 ofreciendo pagar este préstamo en 4 meses, con esta ayuda ella podrá comprar zapatos para vender en la temporada de invierno y en especial para esos clientes que buscan obsequios que regalar a sus familiares y amigos. Con su ayuda una familia podrá tener dinero para festejar esta temporada navideña.

loans.use: Purchase  products for her shoe business

loans.name: María

texts.en:
Argentina sells natural juices and pica pollo (fried chicken). She is 42 years old and has four children. Her daughters are aged 15, 14 and 12; her only son is 19. Argentina’s husband is a professor in a college.

Argentina used to run the same business in the past. She had to close it because of illness. Fortunately, she was able to start her business up again recently when she took a loan from FSMA to invest in materials needed for the preparation of the food. After a period of hard work and some advertizing, she was able to get back a large part of her old clientele.

The entrepreneur explains that the probationary period of the business has been successful and she thinks she can invest more money to make it grow. She is requesting funds to rent a small locale where she can operate the business so that she can attend to her customers ‘more decently’, as she put it. She also hopes that in future her little business can turn into a big cafeteria which would be well known and considered one of the best in her community.

Argentina says as long as she lives, she will do her best for the sake of her family.

loans.use: To rent a small locale to run a fried chicken business

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.es:
Marilyn has lived in the Armando Villanueva community ever since she met her husband there thirteen years ago, and they now have four daughters. She is a pharmacy technician, and came to run her own pharmacy. She couldn’t keep up the pharmacy because it needed more investment than she could afford. Now she has her grocery/general store, which she has had for a year and a half. Her husband helped buy a refrigerator, which she uses to sell jello, soda, and ice. She would like to get financing to buy a display freezer where she could sell ice cream, and to buy plush toys for resale.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Vive en el AAHH Armando Villanueva desde que tenia 13 años ahí conoció a su esposo con el cual tiene 4 hijas, ella es técnica en Farmacia y llegó a tener su propia botica, No pudo continuar con su botica porque necesitaba más inversión la cual no pudo financiar, ahora tiene su bodega la cual tiene un año y medio. Su esposo le ayudó a comprar una refrigeradora con la cual vende gelatina, gaseosas y hielo. Desearía obtener financiamiento para comprar una congeladora –exhibidor donde vender helados de crema y comprar peluches para vender.

loans.use: Run and stock her grocery / general store.

loans.name: Horacio Juliao

texts.pt:
Horacio Juliao L. lives with his partner and two children in the city of Xai-Xai, Mozambique. His wife takes care of their small piece of land, growing greens and vegetables to help feed the family, while he is in the business of manufacturing and selling leather shoes at a street stand. His business is doing well, particularly since profits associated with his first loan cycle allowed him to build a "wood and mud" two-bedroom house with a veranda. Horacio is now requesting a loan of $775 to open a store in the semi-commercial neighborhood of Chiquelene, where more people will be able to appreciate and buy the shoes he makes. Part of the money will also go toward hiring one employee to help him run the business. According to Horacio, joining the credit program has brought many positive changes to his and his family's lives.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva volunteer.

Horacio nao casou oficialmente, mas vive com uma mulher com quem tem 2 filhos. A mulher de Horacio toma conta da casa e trabalha na machamba familiar para a subsistencia de sua familia. Horacio esta muito satisfeito porque o seu negocio esta a crescer.Ele tomou um emprestimo em Outubro do ano passado. Ele conseguiu pagar pontualmente e sem problemas. Com os rendimentos do emprestimo anterior conseguiu construir uma casa embora seja de pau a pique , ela tem 2 quartos e uma varanda.Por isso agora quer tomar um outro emprestimo. Com os rendimentos do novo emprestimo, pensa em abrir uma sapataria em Chiquelene, que e uma zona semi-comercial, pois que ai muta gente podera apreciar os sapatos que ele fabrica e quica o numero de clientes aumente. Ele pensa expandir o seu negocio para uma outra zona no intuito de angariar mais clientes. para tal tera necessidade de contratar mais um empregado para o ajudar. Portanto a sua vida registou melhorias muito positivas.

loans.use: To buy more material to make shoes

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia B. is married and has two children. She works as a trader, selling canned food and vegetables such as tomatoes and eggplant. Demand for her goods has increased recently, and she believes this is a good time to increase sales. She has applied for a loan of $525 to buy more vegetables, cooking oil and canned food to meet the needs of her customers.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables, cooking oil and canned food.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa has been married for 5 years to Nelso Caceres and have one child whose name is Rodrigo David (he's 1-year old).

Teresa has been decorating birthday parties for 8 years. At this time she was an employee at a big decorating store in the area. Nelson was a photographer in charge of big events such as weddings, baptisms, etc. For 5 years they both have dedicated their time to rent a room and Nelson's own business is right across the street.

Due to Teresa's high demand at her job (and the fact that she makes her own decorations), Nelson has stopped his own photography job in order to help his wife with parties and decorations.

In the near future they wish to expand their business and sell all sorts of goods such as candy and a bigger variety of decorations. She wishes to get this credit in order to purchase sculpting materials, glue, paints, color paper, etc.

b>Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Teresa está casada hace 5 años con Nelson Cáceres y tienen un hijo de nombre Rodrigo David que tiene 1 año 4 meses.

Teresa desde hace aproximadamente 8 años se dedica a la decoración de cumpleaños infantiles. En ese entonces era empleada una de las grandes casas de decoración de la zona, y Nelson se dedicaba a la fotografía de acontecimientos como cumpleaños, casamientos, bautismos, etc. Hace 5 años decidieron independizarse y alquilar un salón donde Teresa y Nelson están al frente de su propio negocio.

Debido a la gran demanda del trabajo de Teresa y que además ella fabrica sus propios arreglos decorativos, Nelson ha dejado de trabar como fotógrafo para ayudar a su esposa con la atención del negocio y las decoraciones en las fiestas.

En un futuro muy próximo quiere ampliar mas su local y vender todo tipo de insumos para fiestas como golosinas y mas variedad de arreglos, por el momento ella solicita el crédito para poder comprar materiales para elaborar sus arreglos como: isopor, pinturas, papeles de colores, pegamento, globos, etc.

loans.use: Purchase of materials such as: sculpting materials, glue, paints, color paper, etc.

loans.name: Doni Doni Group

texts.en:
Foday B. K. is the leader of the Doni Doni group, which is from Sukrallah village. He is 27 years old, married, and has 3 children. The group has been informally rotating their savings to raise small amounts of cash to assist each member in cultivating their individual farm.  All of the group members are engaged in farming rice and cassava and would like to expand their farmland.  They are therefore requesting a loan of 
Le.3,000,000, which amounts Le.500,000 each.

loans.use: to expand their farms

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos Martínez AG. is a native of the city of Bluefields. He is 61 years old. For the past 9 years, Mr. Martínez has been the owner of a stand where he sells radios, knives, agendas, padlocks and irons, among other products. His customers are men and women of all ages who prefer to buy from him because of the variety of products he offers. Currently he needs to buy 5 radios at $16.00 dollars per unit, 3 watches at $1.00 dollar per unit, 2 irons at $12.00 dollars per unit, 3 boxes of padlocks at $26.00 per box, 5 agendas at $3.00 per unit, 6 dozen knives at $25.00 per dozen and 3 dozen wallets at $25.00 dollars per dozen. With this investment he can increase his earnings, as these are the products which are most in demand.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. Carlos Martínez AG. es originario de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 61 años de edad. El Sr. Martínez hace 9 años es propietario de un tramo donde vende radios, cuchillos, agendas, candados, planchas, entre otros productos, sus clientes son hombres y mujeres de todas las edades que lo prefieren por ofrecer una variedad de productos, en estos momentos necesita comprar 5 unidades de radios a $ 16.00 dólares la unidad, 3 unidades de reloj a $1.00 dólar la unidad, 2 unidades de planchas a $ 12.00 dólares la unidad, 3 cajas de candados a $ 26.00 dólares la caja, 5 unidades de agenda a $ 3.00 dólares la unidad, 6 docenas de cuchillos a $ 25.00 dólares la docena y 3 docenas de carteras a $ 25.00 dólares la docena, con esta inversión podrá aumentar sus ganancia ya que estos productos tienen mayor demanda.

loans.use: Buy radios, watches, irons, padlocks, agendas, knives and wallets.

loans.name: Thị Thủy's Group

texts.vi:
• Mrs. Dao Thi Thuy (ID number: 010006), 37 years old, wants to borrow 260 USD to breed cows and plant vegetables. She is living with her husband and 2 children who are going to school. She and her husband both have stable income. Her husband is a truck driver, earning 100 USD/month. She stays at home. Her family average income is 175 USD/ month.
  • Mrs. Nguyen Thi Huyen (ID number: 010053), 43 years old, needs 260 USD to make tofu and sell vegetables.
  • Mrs. Nguyen Thi Linh (ID number: 010157), 27 years old, needs 100 USD to sell vegetable and breed animals.
  • Mrs. Nguyen Thi May (ID number: 010008), needs 145 USD to expand her vegetable shop.
  • Mrs. Nguyen Thi Nhu Thanh (ID number: 010013), 48 years old, needs 260 USD to breed pigs.

    Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

loans.use: breed animals, sell vegetables

loans.name: Generación 2006 Group

texts.es:
In the Villa Exaltación neighborhood of the city of El Alto, there is a center located there with the same name and to it belongs the “Generación 2006” Association. It is a very friendly group who, along with their credit advisor, works with Pro-Mujer with a lot of enthusiasm and desire to improve their businesses. The majority of the women is married and has children of different ages. They tell us that their daily household expenses are increasing all the time and the income they have is not sufficient enough to cover minimum necessities.

This group works principally making handcrafted chocolates. They sell chocolate bars for breakfast, bon bons and chocolates that are cream-filled among others. The group is requesting additional credit to acquire raw materials to increase production and to purchase better quality packaging that their clients will like.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

En la zona de villa Exaltación de la ciudad de El Alto se encuentra ubicado el centro focal del mismo nombre, a este pertenece la asociación “Generación 2006 por socias. Un grupo muy simpático que junto a su asesora de créditos, trabajan con Pro-Mujer con mucho entusiasmo de mejorar en sus negocios. La mayoría de ellas son casadas y niños de distintas edades nos cuentan que los gastos diarios que tienen en sus hogares crecen cada vez mas y los ingresos que tienen ya no son suficientes para cubrir necesidades mínimas Este grupo se dedica principalmente a la fabricación de chocolates artesanales ofrecen chocolates en barra para el desayuno, bombones, chocolates rellenos y otros, desean mayor crédito para la adquisición de materia prima para ampliar su producción, además de comprar empaques de mejor calidad para el gusto del cliente.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials and packaging

loans.name: Saima's Group

texts.en:
Saima baji is married to A. G. and lives in the small city of Arifwala, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the last eight years. She is the mother of four children: two daughters and two sons. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Saima baji is a housewife and sews clothes for her neighbors. Her husband is a wholesaler and sells crockery. He has been in this profession for five years. Saima baji successfully completed two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan), which she used to buy more crockery. Now she is applying for another loan for the same business. Presently her husband sells crockery by going door to door, but in the future he hopes to buy a shop.

She is joined in her loan group by four others. Mussarat baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business. Jamila baji wants a loan to buy shoes for her shoe-selling business. Irshad baji wants a loan to buy ingredients such as yogurt and potatoes for her Punjabi food named "Dahi Bhala". Haleema baji wants a loan to buy vegetables to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more crockery inventory

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Doña Lucia A. P. residente en la Aldea La Ceiba, municipio de 			
Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan, departamento de Sololá, actualmente cuenta con 			
26 años de edad, en tiempos anteriores Doña lucia se dedicaba a la agricultura			
en limpia de cultivos que es un trabajo muy arriesgado para ella como mujer,			
pero gracias a sus esfuerzos logro salir de esa actividad e instalo su pequeño 			
negocio en ventas de granizadas, después con su actitud al servicio de las 			
personas logro establecer un negocio de compra y venta de ropa típica cada 			
día su clientela se incrementa y ha logrado mejorar tal vez no un cien por ciento 			
sus condiciones de vida pero siempre tiene un objetivo cada día de ser mejor 			
y responsable con las personas solo así su negocio mejorara  y sus 			
ingresos también, por tal razón doña lucia se vio en la necesidad de acudir en 			
las oficinas de la asociación Asdir, para solicitar un préstamo, para lograr 			
con sus objetivos y dar una mejor condición de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Doña Lucia A. P. lives in the village of La Ceiba, a municipality of Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan in the department of Sololá. She is 26 years old. Doña Lucia used to work in agriculture, preparing fields with slash and burn methods, which was a very risky job for her as a women. Thanks to her efforts she was able to leave that and begin a small business selling snow cones. With her service attitude, later on she was able to set up a business buying and selling traditional regional clothing. Her clientele increases every day and she has made improvements to her standard of living, perhaps not by 100 percent, but every day her goal is to become better and be responsible so that both her business and her income improves. For this reason, Doña Lucia has come to the offices of ASDIR to ask for a loan, to reach her goal and to improve her family´s standard of living.


Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For her business buying and selling traditional regional clothing

loans.name: Mrs. So Teur Group

texts.en:
Mr. So T. is the group leader of four who all live in Cheach Cheung Village in the Kampong Cham Province. The group members will use the loan for different purposes. Mr. So T. is a vegetable farmer who grows potatoes so he is requesting a loan to buy more potato tubers to increase his crop production. His wife, Mrs. Seng Thorn, helps him on the plantation. The couple has five children, all of whom are attending the local school.

This group loan has end-of-term loans so all the members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more potato tubers to increase crop production

loans.name: Simona Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Simona tiene 42 años de edad, habita en un barrio que se llama 25 febrero de esta capital de Managua, es madre soltera tiene cuatro hermoso hijos de: 22, 23, 26 y 27 años de edad, los tienen estudiando en la universidad. Pues le ha tocado trabajar mucho para ayudar a sus hijos para que tenga un nivel de vida más cómodo, inicio vendiendo ropa zapatos y mercadería variada, ambulantemente. Gracias a los prestamos ha Afodenic logro comprar un tramo en el mercado y cumplir parte de su objetivo. Los planes son aumentar sus ventas con nuevas mercadería, así mismo nuevos clientes que le generada mejorares ingresos. Que serán para el crecimiento del sus ventas y para formar un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Simona is 42 years old, lives in the 25th of February neighborhood of the capital city, Managua. She is a single mother of four beautiful children ages 22, 23, 26, and 27, all of whom have studied in the university. She has worked hard to help her children have a comfortable standard of living. She began selling clothing, shoes and a variety of merchandise as a street vendor. Thanks to the loans from Afodenic she was able to buy a stall in the market and achieve part of her goal. Her plans are to increase her sales with new merchandise and gain new clients to generate more income. She plans to grow her sales and create a better future for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing and shoes

loans.name: Delicia

texts.es: Delicia es madre soltera, tiene 40 años de edad y vive junto a sus dos hijos que estudian y la apoyan mucho. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para niños y adultos, actividad que  viene realizando desde hace dos años, le gusta su trabajo porque es muy conversadora y eso le permite dar una buena atención a sus clientes y lo que le agrada mucho es  conocer a mucha gente con quienes comparte diferentes ideas. Este negocio le resulta rentable porque sus prendas las lleva a vender por los distintos lugares de su zona o también por pedidos, como sus clientes constantemente le solicitan le va muy bien. Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP, y ha demostrado ser responsable con sus pagos. El motivo por el que solicita este monto es para comprar más ropa, posteriormente quiere alquilar un local para poner una tienda estable para su negocio.
texts.en:
Delicia is a single mother, 40 years old, and lives with her two children who study and support her very much. She sells clothing for children and adults, a profession she has done for two years. She likes her work because she is very talkative and this enables her to provide good attention to her customers. She enjoys meeting people with whom she can share different ideas. This business is profitable for her because she sells her clothing in different places throughout her neighborhood and also by order, as her customers constantly ask her for items so things are going well for her. This is her 4th loan with MFP, and she has been responsible with her payments. She will use the loan to buy more clothing, then she wants to rent a locale to open a store for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the quantity of clothing to sell

loans.name: Tinuke

texts.en:
Tinuke sells bottled water, juice and baking materials. She has been in this business since 2005.

Tinuke loves her business because it is highly profitable to her. She opens her shop daily from 8am to 6pm.

She now needs a loan of N99,000 so she can purchase more juice, bottled water and baking materials to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more juice, bottled water and baking materials to sell

loans.name: Shazia M. Hassan Group

texts.en:
Shazia baji is a 33 year old married lady who has lived in Pakpattan, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Pakpattan city is famous for its shrine places, and people visit the shrine places to make wishes. She completed her education up to 5th standard but couldn’t study further because of her family’s lack of financial resources. She married a man whose name is M. H., and he is a driver by profession. He drives a 32 seat local bus and charges fares to people. Shazia baji has three kids: two daughters and one son. All of her children are receiving their education from a school located near their house. Shazia baji has a dream of giving her children a good education, because in her childhood she was fond of education but couldn’t get it. She prepares embroidered dresses to pay the school fees for her kids. She is applying for a loan to repair her husband’s vehicle named “Coaster”. 

She is a group leader of some more women of her locale. Nazia baji wants a loan to buy biscuits to sell. Sakina baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Maryam baji wants a loan to buy rice to sell. Zahida parveen baji wants a loan to buy clothes for her clothes selling business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To repair a vehicle named "Coaster"

loans.name: Ursulina

texts.es:
Ursulina  tiene 43 años de edad, esta casada con el Sr. Emigdio S.  tienen 3 hijos  dos mayores de edad y una que esta cursando la secundaria, vive en la compañía Beni Loma de la ciudad de Carapegua.

	Desde temprana edad empezó a ayudar a su madre a confeccionar las colchas artesanales , de quién aprendió el oficio, hoy en día ella misma lleva a  vender sus productos en la zona de la capital del país con la ayuda de su marido, gracias a este trabajo logró construir una modesta casa y brindar buena atención a sus hijos.  	

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías (hamacas, frazadas, fajas y sábanas)
texts.en:
Ursulina is 43 years old. She is married to Emigdio S. and they have 3 grown up children, and one child who is still in secondary school. They live in Beni Loma in the city of Carapegua. From a young age, Ursulina helped her mother make speciality bed covers, learning the trade along the way. Now she sells her own products in the capital with help from her husband. Thanks to this work, they've been able to build a modest house and take good care of their children. With the loan, they will purchase needed merchandise such as blankets, sashes, sheets and hammocks.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise needed for their speciality bedspread business, such as blankets, sashes, sheets and hammocks.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa A. is currently in the business of selling electronics like radios, tvs, etc. and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Hawa is 30 years old and is married with a husband who is a teacher. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for the children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: pay school fees for the children

loans.name: Foloi

texts.en: Foloi M., 44, is married with 4 children.  She has 6 years of experience in the retail business. She sells to the general public and villagers, 7 days per week.  She has  no previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 229 Tala (~ $75 US).  SPBD loans are Foloi’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase boxes of mutton flaps, sausages, chicken, boxes of chicken noodles, sacks of sugar, rice, flour, salt, beverages, Vailima beer, herrings, laundry soap, toilet paper, Mortein bug spray, candles, spaghetti, and snacks such as bongos, lollies, twisties, cookies, Chinese lollies, and chocolates, etc.

loans.name: Jiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  femmes du groupe Jiguisseme (sont toutes mariées) avec une moyenne d’âge de 31ans, ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent majoritairement dans des  familles monogames à Ouayerma I un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de tasses, de fruits, d’articles de boutique et de boubous.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur troisième  prêt solidaire, tous les  prêts passés ont été bien remboursés...
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 2douzaines de tasses, 10 paniers de fruits (oranges, mandarines) et 10 régimes de bananes, 4 colis d’articles de boutique et  5 dizaine de boubous. Elles s’approvisionnent au marché de Médine à Sikasso ville et  dans   les  localités avoisinantes. 
Les marchandises sont vendues la plupart au comptant au marché de Ouayerma, dans des boutiques et souvent dans des familles à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes..
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 18.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The four women of this Jiguisseme group (all married) have an average age of 31 and on average 3 children. They mostly live in monogamous families in Ouayerma I, one of the districts of the town of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali.

They have various businesses, among others selling dishes, fruit, boutique items, and boubous (flowing robes worn by men and women). They collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to satisfy the needs of their clientele and are on their third solidarity loan, all the preceding loans having been correctly reimbursed.

With this new loan they expect to buy 2 dozen dishes, 10 baskets of fruit (oranges, mandarines), and 10 stalks of bananas, 4 packages of boutique articles, and 5 dozen boubous. They stock up on merchandise at the Médine market in the town of Sikasso and in the surrounding areas.

The merchandise is sold mostly for cash in the market of Ouayerma, in the shops and often in families, to a clientele composed of men and women.

They each expect to make a monthly average profit of 18,500 F CFA of which part will be used for family needs and the rest will be invested back into their businesses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles for re-sale

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr: Cette dame est mariée à un maçon carreleur et a 02 enfants pour aider son mari dans les charges quotidiennes du foyer elle a commencé le commerce de charbons de bois, elle fait cette activité depuis 2003, son stock de charbons de bois est épuisé, pour se réapprovisionner elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit qui lui permettrait de rehausser son stock.
texts.en:
This is a lady who is married to a tile mason. She has two children. To help her husband with day-to-day household expenses, she began doing commerce in charcoal, a business has been in since 2003. Her stock of charcoal is exhausted. To resupply herself, she's requesting her first loan from WAGES that would enable her to replenish her stock.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama G., a 47-year-old woman, is divorced and mother of six children. Three of her children are in school currently. She operates a footwear shop at Dorma, in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Ama has been selling brand new shoes, ladies' wear, slippers and dressing bags to support her family for the past three years now. However, she operates on a small scale due to lack of funds.

With the loan, she wants to inject more working capital into her business to achieve progress. She believes the loan would support her to be more resourced to purchase good quality stock to upgrade her inventory. She wants to use the loan to purchase more clothing materials, ladies' wear, shoes, and slippers. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To purchase brand new shoes, ladies' wear and slippers

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena A. sells printed textiles and infants’ layettes. She sells under a shed in the market square and treks to other towns to sell as well. She has been in business for 12 years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She desires to expand her business. 
Abena is the mother of five children: three sons and two daughters. She is 45 years old and divorced. Some of her children have completed school and are working. Others are still in school. She lives with some of her children in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana.

loans.use: To buy printed textiles

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa R. makes a living primarily from selling peanuts in the local community. She is 53 years old, married and has three school-age children. They are from the city of Dapitan. Felisa has been in this business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Felisa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living condition and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell. Felisa is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to invest in a new business selling gasoline in bottles. This will be her fifth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in a business selling gasoline

loans.name: The Ownership Is God Group

texts.en:
Lawrence is 40 years old. He is married and the father of three children, two boys and one girl, who are in school. He is a salt trader. He supplies salt to food vendors and others. He travels to Accra to buy his salt, but he buys only a few bags of salt on each trip, because he does not have enough money to buy more. He must travel to Accra frequently to get enough salt to sell. He asked some family members for financial assistance, but to no avail. Lawrence is requesting a loan to buy a bulk supply of salt. He believes this will reduce the risk of frequent travel. He dreams of saving more to pay for his children's education.

Lawrence is the leader of a trust bank group called "The Ownership is God." He appears in the middle in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are small-scale traders, food vendors, and farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and provide peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy salt in bulk to resell

loans.name: Molimau

texts.en:
Molimaufou F., age 49, lives in the town of Nonoa. She is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Molimaufou owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting bananas for sale. Molimaufou has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 500 WST a month from these activities.

In 2007, Molimaufou joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and to increase her ability to engage in business activities. Molimaufou has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,250 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

Molimaufou is now requesting a new loan of 2,000 WST, which will be used to purchase harvesting equipment. This will be her third loan from SPBD. Molimaufou plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive, and self-esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase harvesting equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy items necessary to ready his land for cultivation

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth F. Hernández tiene la edad de 38 años, su estado civil es casada. Esta Joven tiene 3 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio. Elizabeth es una joven luchadora y trabajadora y es por eso que sus motivos son de mantener su negocio activo. Elizabeth ha  trabajo para proporciónales a sus hijos lo necesario. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para comprar productos como pantalones, camisas, faldas, calzado y cosméticos.  Su deseo  es que sus hijos puedan continuar con este negocio  y además logren finalizar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Elizabeth F. H. is 38 years old and is married. This young woman has 3 children and all of them are in school. Her business is the selling of general merchandise. She has had this business for 6 years. Elizabeth is a young fighter and worker and so she is motivated to maintain an active business. Elizabeth has worked to provide necessities for her children. She is asking for a loan for working capital to buy pants, shirts, skirts, footwear, and cosmetics. Her desire is that her children be able to continue with the business and successfully complete their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Diechell

texts.en:
Diechell M. is from the village of Usocan. She is 24 years old. Diechell is married and has 1 infant-aged children. To make a living, Diechell owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Diechell has been engaged in her business for over 1 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Diechell joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Diechell has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Diechell is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Diechell from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra K. is from the village of Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old. Alejandra is single. To make a living, Alejandra owns & operates a general store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Alejandra has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Alejandra joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alejandra is requesting a new loan of 2,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Alejandra from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Delma Rosa

texts.es:
la joven Delma Rosa S. se dedica a la confeccion de vestidos, blusas, camisas de vestir, pantalones, sacos, toda la ropa que ella elabora es para dama.
este tipo de actividad le gusto desde pequeña, ya que siempre miraba programas de moda y revistas de moda cuando estaba niña, esto le creo una inclinacion para que sacara cursos de confeccion y se dedicara a este tipo de actividad.
ahora muchas personas la buscan para que les elabore ropa, todos sus clientes estan satisfechos con el trabajo que ella hace, dicen que la ropa les queda a la medida y que sus diseños son muy bonitos.
ahora Delma esta solicitando el credito para poder comprar mas telas ya que viene la temporada navideña y tiene muchos encargos. se siente muy feliz de poder haber montado su propio negocio.
texts.en:
The young Delma Rose S. is dedicated to making dresses, blouses, dress shirts, pants, and bags. All the clothes that she makes are for ladies. She has enjoyed this type of activity since she was small, since she always watched fashion programs and read fashion magazines when she was a girl. This gave her the inclinacion to take dressmaking courses and she dedicated herself to this type of activity. Now many people seek her out to make clothes for them. All her clients are satisfied with the work that she does. They say that the clothes are custom-made styles and that her designs are very pretty. Now Delma is requesting a loan to be able to buy more fabrics, since the Christmas season approaches and she has many assignments. She feels very happy to be able to have developed her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics of all types, threads of various colors, buttons, laces, decorative edging, etc.

loans.name: Liz Karen

texts.es:
Liz Karen es una mujer trabajadora y dinámica, vive en la comunidad nativa Vista Alegre en la ciudad de Iparia, región de Ucayali, tiene 21 años, es madre de un hijo. Liz se dedica a la confección de trajes típicos, pues tiene un pequeño taller de costura en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien es agricultor. Forma parte  del  Banco  Comunal “yabi II” desde hace un año.
El primer crédito que recibió fue 300 soles que lo utilizó en la compra de telas y abarrotes para llevar a su caserío.  Paralelamente se dedica a la venta de abarrotes.
Ahora requiere un crédito de 1000 soles que será utilizado en la compra de abarrotes en general. La meta de Liz es tener una bodega bien surtida.
texts.en:
Liz Karen is a hard working and dynamic woman, who lives in her native community of Vista Alegre in the city of Iparia, located in the Ucayali region. She is 21 years old and the mother of one son. Liz dedicates herself to making traditional outfits, as she has a small sewing workshop in her house. She counts on the support of her husband, who is a farmer. She has belonged to the “Yabi II” cooperative bank for one year. The first loan she received was for 300 Peruvian soles, which she used to buy fabrics and groceries to take to her locale. Concurrently, she dedicates herself to selling groceries. She now needs a loan of 1,000 soles to buy a variety of supplies. Liz’s goal is to have a well-stocked grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries/supplies to offer for sale.

loans.name: Rafoat

texts.en:
A. Rafoat is 40 years old. She is a widow with three children. Rafoat owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items such as eggs, sugar, macaroni, vegetable oil, juices, soft drinks, etc. She deems it an opportunity to expand her business and wants to use the loan to buy more foodstuffs to increase her stock of goods available for sale. Rafoat has run this business for 11 years. This business is the main source of her family’s income and she hopes that with the help of you she can improve her living by expanding her business. Thank you!

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Foodstuff for selling for increasing of the stock

loans.name: Baltazar's Group

texts.en:
Baltazar P. runs a general store selling a variety of different products in his community. He is 44 years old, married and has two school-age children. They are from the village of Matusalem. Baltazar has been in his business for over eight years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2006, Baltazar joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Baltazar has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to to purchase products to sell. Baltazar is requesting a new loan of 23,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand his product offering. This will be his ninth loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue to pay the tuition fees of his children.

Baltazar is the leader of a 5 member group accessing a loan from ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Marcos".

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 21 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El señor Juan M. está agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual le pudo ayudar a si suegra, que ya esta mucho mejor.  
Nuevamente está solicitando un préstamo ya que desea mejorar su vivienda y le está haciendo falta el vitropiso, pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para llevar a cabo la mejora. 
Planea pagar el crédito con su ingreso que obtiene como guardia de seguridad, ya que los gastos familiares se encargara su esposa la señora Manuela Reyna quien también trabaja de guardia de seguridad. 
La persona que aparece en la foto es la Doña Manuel Reyna esposa del señor Juan, ya que el se encontraba en su trabaja el día de la visita a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan M. is grateful for your support with his previous loan with which he was able to help his mother-in-law, who is now much better. Today he is seeking a loan as he wishes to improve his home and he is in need of ceramic flooring, but at this moment he doesn’t have the money needed to finish with this improvement. He plans to pay back the loan with the income he receives as a security guard, as his family expenses are paid for by his wife, Mrs. Manuela Reyna, who also works as a security guard. The person appearing in the photo is Mrs. Manuela Reyna, wife of Juan, who was working the day we visited his home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install ceramic flooring

loans.name: Nilma

texts.en:
Nilma A. is from the village of Gabunon, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 27 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Nilma owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products, such as bread, eggs, soap and toothpaste, in the local community. Nilma has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,360 PHP a month from these activities.
In 2009, Nilma joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Nilma is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her chidlren's tuition fees.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy mobile phones and accessories in bulk

loans.name: Shen

texts.en: Mr. Shen L. is a villager in Preak Doung village in Kandal province and he is 43 years old. He is a farmer who owns 1-hectare of land to cultivate rice on to support his family, and his wife, Mrs. Doeurng Yen, owns a general store in the local village. In the rice field, they have some problems because it is infertile soil and it has a lot of insects. Thus, in order to improve rice production, Mr. Shen L. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide for supporting his rice field. He is the father of two children, one of whom helps the mother to sell groceries, while the other is attending local public school. His wife is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and  pesticide

loans.name: Jo-Ane

texts.en:
Jo-Ane S., 38, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Marzan, a painter, they are blessed with one child. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been operating three businesses at once, direct selling of cosmetics, selling ready-to-wear clothing and selling frozen cuts of meat and cured hams.

Jo-Ane has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her businesses.

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a 27,000 PHP loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding businesses by buying more quantities of products to be incorporated into her inventories.

She dreams that her businesses will continue to grow so that she can provide for her family’s everyday needs. She also wishes that her whole family will have good health.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more products to be incorporated into her inventories.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La  Señora  Carmen A., tiene 60 años de edad, está casado con el Evelino Noe, tienen 2 hijos, todos mayores de edad.
La actividad realizada por la Señora Carmen es la venta ambulante de prendas de vestir, por las zonas de Ybycuí y alrededores. 
Para poder comenzar con esta actividad  ella nos cuenta que su hija se fue a trabajar  a la Argentina y le enviaba las ropas y calzados.
    Esta actividad ya lo realiza hace 10 años, ya tiene bastantes clientes por los bajos precios y la calidad de las prendas de vestir.
El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de vitrinas de vidrio para exhibición.
 El deseo de la Señora Carmen es la de montar en su casa un pequeño local para la venta de sus productos.
texts.en:
La Señora Carmen A. is 60 years old, is married to Evelino Noe, and has two adult children. She sells clothing in the Ybycuí and surrounding areas. She told us that her daughter went to work in Argentina and sent her clothing and shoes, and these items enabled her to begin work as a traveling saleswoman. She has been doing this work for 10 years; she now has many customers because of her low prices and the quality of her clothing. The requested loan will be used to purchase a glass showcase. La Señora Carmen's wish is to set up in her house a small area for the sale of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a glass showcase for her clothing

loans.name: Suranje Geethika

texts.en:
Suranje Geethika is a 34-year-old married woman who lives with her husband. She has two sons, 10 years and 7 years old. Her husband has a three-wheeler taxi that he drives for income. As a result, he is able to assist with her business. They are very close, and work well together.

Suranje used to have a coconut business, but then started a venture making and selling bricks which she sells to local customers. Two years ago she started this business. She cooperates well with others and has a lovely mood. She is very enthusiastic.
