Suranje has requested a 50,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to help her brick business. She is grateful to BRAC Sri Lanka because of the great support it provides to her.

loans.use: To use for her brick business

loans.name: Hagah

texts.en:
Hagah B. is single. She has been through junior high school.  Hagah prepares 'kenkey' (maize dough) for sale at Abura. Hagah uses the income she generates from the sale of her 'kenkey' to pay her utility bills and accommodation.  Hagah will use the loan to purchase additional bags of maize to prepare 'kenkey' for sale. With the new profits from her extended business, Hagah plans to reinvest into her business.

To prepare her 'kenkey' she buys maize from the market and soaks it in enough water to soften the maize. She washes it on the third day and sends it to the mill to be milled. She then makes a mixture of dough out of the milled wet corn and leaves it to prove on the next day.

She divides the proved dough into two, uses one for her firm half-cooked dough (mixes it with water to make a porridge, cooks it for some time to get a firm mixture or texture of the dough) and mixes the rest of the uncooked one with the half cooked. She moulds it into balls and wraps them in corn husk. She then cooks them again till they become soft enough to eat.

'Kenkey' can be eaten with various kinds of sauces such as pepper sauce with fried or roasted fish, roasted chicken, roasted turkey and any other kind of meat or fish.

loans.use: purchase additional bags of maize to prepare 'kenkey'

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
"H. Nguyễn Thị (20201070009) is a 30 year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. H. is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Trung Bạn 2 - Nhóm 08 (8).

H. is married and has 3 school-aged children. To making a living, H. owns & operates a business butchering & selling pork in the local community.  H. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,800,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2009, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,256,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. She is  requesting a new loan of 6,496,000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the H.'s 2nd loan from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nguyễn Thị H. (20201070008) is a 33 year-old female who is requesting a 4,256,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  Nghiêm Thị H. (20201070044) is a 20 year-old female who is requesting a 4,256,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.


3.  Nguyễn Thị S. (20201070045) is a 58 year-old female who is requesting a 7,392,000 VND loan to support her service-based business.


4.  Nghiêm Thị H. (20201070042) is a 26 year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.


5.  Nguyễn Thị L. (20201070043) is a 27 year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her service-based business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


H. Nguyễn Thị (20201070009) là 30 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  H. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Trung Bạn 2 - Nhóm 08 (8).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các pH. thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ giết mổ & bán T.t heo trong cộng đồng địa pH..  H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 3.800.000 VND.  Vào 2009, H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  H. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.256.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.496.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị H. (20201070008) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.256.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Nghiêm Thị H. (20201070044) là 20 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.256.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


3.  Nguyễn Thị S. (20201070045) là 58 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


4.  Nghiêm Thị H. (20201070042) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


5.  Nguyễn Thị L. (20201070043) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy food products

loans.name: Nhinh

texts.en: Mrs. Nhinh P. is 49 years old and is a villager in Tuol Kandal village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Keo Nget, are farmers who own 2.50 hectares of land to cultivate rice. In order to support their crop, Mrs. Nhinh P. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and to pay to rent a water machine. Aside from farming, Mr. Keo Nget also owns a truck for soil digging, which can earn a small income to support his family's living conditions. This couple has a child, who works as a soil digging truck driver.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and to pay to rent a water machine.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
La señora María Cristina es oriunda de la ciudad de  Ybycuí, actualmente reside en la compañía la Cñía Zanjita de Acahay, es una madre soltera con una hija, la hija tiene 16 años, está siguiendo sus estudios en la ciudad de Ybycui.

         Desde temprana edad la señora Cristina viajó hacia la capital en busca de mejoras, encontró trabajo y se quedo allí , con todo lo que ha ahorrado regresó a su ciudad natal con el fin de montar una despensa.
       Lo hizo y tuvo un excelente resultado, pero ahí surgió un problema, la cual era que la cantidad de mercadería que poseía no le abastecía completamente a sus clientes. 
 
         En busca de ampliar su negocio y en consecuencia sus ganancias se acercó a nuestras oficinas con el fin de solicitar un crédito para poder comprar más mercaderías como fideos, arroz, aceite, carne, panificados, embutidos, lácteos, y agradece a la fundación el crédito otorgado ya que con eso pudo cargar nuevas mercaderías a su stock y a la vez lograr la satisfacción en las personas que se van a comprar allí.
texts.en:
Sra. María Cristina is a native of the city of Ybycuí, but she currently lives in the neighborhood of Cñía Zanjita de Acahay. She is a single mother of a 16 year old daughter who is continuing her studies in the city of Ybycuí.

At an early age, Sra. Cristina traveled to the capital in search of a better life. She found a job and ended up staying there. After all that, she saved enough money so that she could return to her hometown and open a food pantry. Her business experienced excellent results, but she faced one problem – she did not have enough merchandise to completely meet the demand of her customers.

In order to expand her business and increase her profits, Cristina came to the offices of Fundación Paraguaya to request a loan so that she could buy merchandise such as noodles, rice, oil, meat, baked goods, sausages, and dairy products. She is thankful for the loan that has been provided because she will be able to add new products to her inventory and satisfy everyone who comes to her business to shop.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase noodles, rice, oil, meat, baked goods, sausages, and dairy products

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is a married man with two school-aged children. He operates Gitiyo Butchery to earn a living and has two employees. He has been in this business for four years, having previously been in farming.

Since he joined Step By Step group in Faulu Kenya, Solomon has hope for his business. This is because the group members share business ideas. Most of all, he can be guaranteed a loan from Faulu Kenya with the group and, in this way, he is able to improve his business.

Solomon has requested 20,000 KES to buy cows for slaughter. For more income, he hopes to expand his business using his savings with the group. He describes himself as a hardworking man.

loans.use: To buy cows for slaughter

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret D. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and local brew out of her home  and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  Margret is 50 years old and is widowed.   She has 5 children and her children do not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a real charcoal store.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
This is Marivic O., 31, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, the Philippines. She is married to Ramil O.. They are blessed in their marriage with good health and strong physiques, enough for them to work hard and prepare for their future together.

Marivic operates a general merchandise store. She sells not only the usual groceries, toiletries and beverages, but also Liquefied Petroleum Gas for fuel. She also offers printing services in their little store. Marivic’s store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 200 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 29,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like more LPG. She also will replenish her printing supplies. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She has been a member of Center for Community Transformation for 3 years now, and regularly attends fellowship meetings.*

Marivic hopes to be successful in life through her business.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy more products, such as LPG (gas) to sell. She also will replenish her printing supplies.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena R., 48 years old,  is from the town of Sta. Josefa.  Elena is married and has 2 adult-age children. To make a living, Elena owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. Elena has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

Elena joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elena has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Elena is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Elena from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Yasmin

texts.en:
Yasmin A. J. is a student and an ambitious young woman from Gaza city in Gaza Strip. Yasmin's husband, Muhammad, pictured above, started a small grocery store in the city four years ago. It is the only source of income for the family. Yasmin is also paying her tuition fees from the store profits.

Muhammad needs the $1500 loan to purchase food and other items to be sold in the store. (Because of her religious background, Yasmin does not wish to have her photo published.)

loans.use: Purchase grocery store supplies

loans.name: Ronalet

texts.en:
Ronalet J. is a single woman who lives in Bansa, Central Tabao Zone 4, Valladolid, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: selling  E-LOAD (electronic reloading service to prepaid cellular phone users) and selling firewood. 

Ronalet joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past eight loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ronalet has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 17,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of about $138, raising the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 9th cycle loan, she is borrowing 25,000 PHP, which she intends to use to buy more prepaid cellular phone service E-load and more firewood to resell so that she can continue to save up for future home repairs. Ronalet J. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stocks to sell

loans.name: Charles Mburu

texts.en:
Charles has been operating his motorbike in Naivasha town for transport for the last two years. He is 32 years old and married to Jane Wangeci. They have one child.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to renew the insurance coverage for his motorbike.

In the future, Charles hopes to have a fleet of taxis operating in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To renew insurance for his motorbike

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 24 years old and she is married with one child who is two and half years old.  Marie is a self-employed businesswoman who is commonly known in the business of selling shoes for women.  She has been in this business for about one year and half and her business hours are from 7 am to 7 pm every day.

Marie needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, Marie will hopefully expand her business through purchasing different styles of shoes for women.  With these additional styles of shoes for sale, she will hopefully earn more profits which in turn will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability in her business.

loans.use: different styles of women's shoes

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.fr:
Cliente tres fidele , ayant fait preuve d'un remboursement constant et efficace durant le premier pret,
 elle tient a perseverer dans l'exercice de son activite .
Le premier pret a ete benefique pour cette cliente vu qu'elle a epargne beaucoup d'argent pour atteeindre son objectif, ses ventes ont accrus de de 30.000 a 65.000frs cfa
Pour le second pret elle va continuer dans le meme sens  en renforcant les produits de son etalage comme les cartons de lait , sucre, bonbons, 50kg de lait pour faire du yaourt, du sucre, de la farine et autre produits   
Elle est tres optimiste dans la realisation de ses objectifs, etre une femme d'affaire tres celebre d'ici cinq ans
texts.en:
Beatrice O. is a very loyal client who repaid her first loan consistently without difficulty.  She wants to continue operating her business. The first loan was beneficial to her given that she has saved a lot of money for reaching her goal and her sales increased from 30,000 to 65,000 CFA.
For the second loan, she will continue in the same direction, expanding the products in her stall such as cartons of milk, sugar, candy, 50 kg of milk to make yogurt, flour and other products.   She is very optimistic that she will achieve her goal to be a very successful business woman in five years

loans.use: To buy items for her business to bolster her stall

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice E. sells foodstuffs such as cassavas at Abura. She has not acquired any form of education. She is married to a fisherman and together they live with their three children. Beatrice has been selling cassavas for two years. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy additional foodstuffs to meet the demand of her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to further her children's education.

Beatrice is displaying some of the cassavas she sells.

loans.use: To buy additional foodstuffs to meet the demand of her customers.

loans.name: Keat

texts.en: The woman in the photo is Mrs. Keat K., age 43, who lives in the Province of Kompong Tom in Cambodia, where she earns a living raising pigs. She has been running this business since 2006, and it has provided her with income to attain a decent standard of living. She is married with seven children, and all of them are single. Two of Mrs. K.'s children have been working different jobs in Phnom Penh, and they always share their earnings to support the family. Her husband is a fisherman, as well as firewood seller. In order to earn extra income, Mrs. K. wants to get a cultivating machine to provide a tapping rice service for other farmers. As she lacks money to buy one, Mrs. K. has decided to request a loan from Kiva. Mrs. K. will use these funds to buy a machine to begin providing her service.

loans.use: To buy a rice cultivating machine

loans.name: Maria Otilia

texts.es: Maria se dedica es una pulpería. Esta no es la primera vez que solicita financiamiento por lo que se siente muy contenta con este medio de vida. Ella es una mujer muy independiente y necesitaba obtener un medio de ingreso para su hogar, a pesar de tener dificultades en su hogar ha sabido sacar adelante su negocio ya que los precios de ciertos productos están muy elevados. Este crédito es para la compra de materia prima como granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, pan, detergentes entre otras cosa básicas en el hogar.
texts.en: Maria dedicates herself to a general store business.  This is not the first time she’s requested financing, an opportunity she is very happy to have.  She is a very independent woman, and needed to find a means of generating income for her family.  Despite having faced difficulties, she has known how to get her business ahead now that prices of certain products are elevated.  This loan is for the purchase of items such as grains, snacks, refreshments, bread, and detergents, among other basic household items.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en: Abbass is a 31-year-old married man from Bint Jbeil. Since 1996, he has worked in construction with a specialization in tile. Abbass is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to buy a tile polishing machine and a power generator. Both of these tools are important to improve his business. This is Abbass's second loan from Al Majmoua; he is a client in good standing. His previous loan enabled him to improve his business. Most of his clients are neighbors, relatives, and friends. He is working hard to provide his family with the best education and tools to live healthy lives. He hopes to open a full construction services company in the future, and to maintain it as a family business for his children.

loans.use: To buy a tile polishing machine and a power generator

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty A.'s main source of income comes from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in her community. She is 43 years old, married and has five school-aged children. They are from the village of Mulos, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. Betty has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Betty joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC which was used to purchase a fishing boat. Betty is requesting a new loan of 14,500 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Rosset

texts.en: Rosett is a 21-year-old married woman with two children living in a rented house in Kamwenge, Uganda. She has a retail shop which she has operated for 2 years amidst challenges of limited capital. Her vision is to own a wholesale shop. Rosett needs the loan to purchase sugar, salt and rice to sell.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, salt and rice to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: Esther tiene 34 años, vive en compañía de sus 2 hijos en casa de un familiar. Desde su niñez se ha dedicado a las tareas de la agricultura y esto la ha ayudado en la actualidad a generarse ingresos para su familia. Hace 1 año decidió radicar en la ciudad en busca de mejores oportunidades y desde entonces no ha dejado de dedicarse a la venta de sus cosechas así como de otros productos que compra al por mayor, además vende animales durante los fines de semana, actividad que por el momento lo realiza sola, pero espera pronto a una persona para que le ayude en el negocio. Hasta el momento ha visto que su negocio ha ido mejorando además de haber aprendido  las técnicas de ventas que le generan ganancias, una de ellas el de ofrecer un aumento o hacer una pequeña rebaja, por lo desea en adelante adquirir un puesto de ventas para evitar vender de manera ambulante. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta y motivada de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero y agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del crédito que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería ya que desea aprovechar la temporada de aumento de ventas que se avecina.
texts.en:
Esther, 34, lives with her two children in a relative’s house.  Since childhood she’s been farming and this has helped her earn family income to this day.  A year ago she decided to move to the city in search of better opportunities but she continues to sell her crops as well as other products she buys at wholesale.  On weekends she sells animals, an activity she’s currently doing by herself, but hopes soon to have a person to help her with the business.  She has seen her business improve to date plus she’s learned sales techniques that generate profits for her.  One of which is to slightly increase prices or offer a small discount.  She hopes soon to acquire a sales stand to stop being a street vendor.

This is her first loan with MFP.  She is very happy and motivated knowing she has financial support and thanks all the people who will fund the loan she’s asking for because it will be very useful for her business’ progress.

She will use the requested loan to buy more merchandise to take advantage of the approaching high sales volume season.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Rabqa's Group

texts.en:
Rabqa is married to A. M. who is a farmer. He works in the fields and grows different seasonal crops.  He is very hardworking, and works 8-10 hours every day in the fields. Mostly, he grows cotton which he sells to different factories on order.

Rabqa lives with her family in Khanewal in a two-room brick house. Khanewal is a small Pakistani city known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in the area of Shanti Nagar for 20 years.   Rabqa is 47 years old and has no children. She spends her time by staying at home and taking care of household responsibilities. 

Rabqa has applied for a loan from Kiva field partner Asasah for her husband’s agriculture business. With the loan he will buy seed, and fertilizer to get better results from his crops. He has eight years of experience in his work and Rabqa hopes that this loan will help him get more from his work and increase his profits.  This is Rabqa's third loan from Asasah.  Up to now, she has maintained good credit behavior and has never missed any meetings. 

Note: In the photo that accompanies this profile, Rabqa is the woman at right who is holding an Asasah Passbook.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for farming

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is 55 years old and married with two children. Cristita works very hard to provide for them.

Cristita runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase sari-sari store items to sell.

Cristita has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, shampoo, curls, oil etc.

In the future, Cristita would like to save her profit for future use.

loans.use: to purchase sari-sari store items to sell

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita N. is from the village of Zayas, Carmen, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 45 years old. Rosita is married and has four school-age children. To make a living, Rosita owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing (or RTW), like blouses, t-shirts, and shoes, in the local community. Rosita has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2000, Rosita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 22,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 22,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products, like blouses, t-shirts, shorts, and underwear. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Rosita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like blouses, t-shirts, shorts, and underwear

location.town: Zayas, Carmen, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Edward Turanta

texts.en:
Edward Turanta L. is 32 years old. He is married to Naitunkera who has a small business selling jewels. They have three children. Edward has been farming for the past five years, making a monthly income of 10,000 KES.
Edward was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET by an already registered customer. He has been a good client who repays his loans well. This is his third loan, with which he plans to buy farm inputs and some animals (for fattening, to be sold at a profit) and hire machinery for preparing the land. Wheat has proved to be doing well in his area due to good climatic conditions. With the profits Edward hopes to make from this loan, he plans to reinvest in the farm and plant more acres of wheat. His future dream is that he will be able to buy a bigger piece of land where he can plant more wheat for commercial purposes, buy his own farm machinery and educate his children. He is a hardworking man who is focused on his set goals.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and some animals, plus hire machinery for preparing the land.

loans.name: Vanik

texts.en:
Vanik G. was born in 1951 and he lives in Dovegh village, in the area of Ijevan. Vanik is married and has three children: two sons and a daughter. For a long time, Vanik worked as a tractor driver and he is now engaged in farming. With his family's help, Vanik breeds two cows, two calves and three pigs. He also has a kitchen garden where he grows potatoes, tomatoes and cucumbers for his family and onions for sale.

Vanik has received four loans from Nor Horizon and he is now asking for a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy a sow, 2 or 3 calves and fodder for his farm animals. Vanik says his will use the farm’s future income for his younger son’s wedding.

loans.use: To buy a sow, calves and fodder.

loans.name: Belene Ndendy Group

texts.fr:
ce groupe de solidarité est créé le 31/05/2007.Il est composé de 18 femmes issues du même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Aminata debout à l'extrême droite ,est veuve et vit avec 07 enfants dont 02 sont ses enfants.Elle est âgée de 40 ans.

Elle est vendeuse de céréales et d'arachides.Elle s'approvisionne dans les différents marchés hebdomadaires pour revendre dans le marché central de sa ville. Elle a une expérience de 03 ans environs dans ce domaine d'activité.

Ce prêt lui permettra d'acheter des céréales et des arachides.

Son objectif est d'assurer la prise en charge de sa progéniture tout en augmentant son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en: This solidarity group has been created on May 31, 2007. It is composed of 18 women living in the same neighborhood. Their main business activity is vending. Mrs. Aminata, standing to the far right [in the photo], is a widow, and lives with seven children, of whom two are her own. She is 40 years old. She sells cereals and peanuts [ground nuts]. She stocks up at different weekly markets in order to resell her goods at the central market of her town. She has three years of experience in this area. This loan will allow her to buy cereals and peanuts. Her goal is to be able to provide for her children while continuing to grow her savings.

loans.use: to buy cereals (millet and corn) and peanuts [ground nuts]

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.en: Marcelino is married with two adult-aged children. He is a farmer working in the Philippines and has been doing this work for twenty-four years. Marcelino is asking for a loan to purchase fertilizers like manure, pesticides and rice seed to be planted on his farm. He hopes this loan will be helpful in his operations. Currently, he earns approximately $594 each cropping. Marcelino hopes to get high yields from his farm and to save some of his income for unexpected emergencies.

loans.use: to obtain fertilizers, seeds and pesticides.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a young man from Palestine. He started working in his grocery store one year ago selling basic household needs such as salt, sugar, tomato paste as well as chips, ice cream, etc.

Muhammad wants to expand his business and purchase a larger variety of grocery items to attract more clients and have better income. Muhammad, who appears in the picture, received the loan from FATEN for this purpose.

loans.use: to purchase various grocery items and a display fridge.

loans.name: Agustina Alexandra

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Las Américas se reúne cada quince días en  la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde tiempos coloniales  como la Ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, por la inmensa cantidad de arboles de esta fruta de ahí este nombre, con el que se lo conoce hasta la actualidad.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Agustina, ella tiene 37 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 15, 11 y 8 años, la mayor esta en colegio y los menores en escuela. Su marido es mecánico automotriz.

Ella para tener sus propios ingresos y con esto ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo.  También tiene un restaurante en la casa de su mamá, en el cual prepara deliciosos platos y el preferido de sus clientes es el viche de mariscos. Trabaja de lunes a sábado en su restaurante y allí mismo aprovecha para vender la ropa ya que la mayoría de sus clientes llegan hasta su restaurante, nos cuenta que deja a crédito y el dia domingo se encarga de cobrar. Su mercadería la compra en Guayaquil. Nos cuenta que lleva más de 10 años dedicada a esta actividad.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas, ropa de niños y algunos víveres para preparar los alimentos. Es fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son muy bajos.
 
Su sueño es tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Las Américas” meets every 15 days in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí. This city has been known since colonial times as the city of “Reales Tamarindos” because of the large number of tamarind trees that continue to exist today.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Agustina. She is 37 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has three children (ages 15, 11, and 8). Her oldest child is in high school and the younger ones are in elementary school. Her husband is an automobile mechanic.

In order to have her own income and help her husband with the household expenses, Agustina works in retail by selling all types of clothing. She also manages a restaurant at her mother’s house where she prepares delicious dishes. The preferred dish of her customers is the seafood ceviche. Agustina works Monday through Saturday at the restaurant. She also takes advantage of selling clothes to a majority of her customers who come to her restaurant. Agustina says she extends credit and collects payment on Sundays. Her merchandise is purchased in Guayaquil. She says that she has been in business for more than 10 years.

This loan will be used to buy trousers, shirts, blouses, children’s clothing, and a few ingredients for preparing her dishes. She is a founding member of the Communal Bank and likes the very low interest rates. Her dream is to have a larger restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase trousers, shirts, blouses, children’s clothing, and a few ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Norberta

texts.en:
This is Norberta, 49, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother.  At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Norberta operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Norberta earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also earns through Electronic Cellular Phone Loading Station. What she basically does is to buy electronic cellular phone loads in huge amounts and then retail it for however much the customer is paying. Profit is generated depending on the networks policy of dealership. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,086 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 14,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Norberta hopes to be able to expand soon.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for groceries and other products to sell

loans.name: Mame Aly

texts.fr: Mosieur Aly, marié et pére de 5 enfants, fait le commerce depuis l'âge tout jeune. Il aidait son père grand commerçant d'alors. Actuellement il gére son propre business et vend du mil, de l'arachide et des pesticides. Il est à sa troisième demande de prêt et souhaitait avoir pour cette fois ci 400 000 FCFA.Les prêts antérieurs lui ont permis d'augmenter ses revenus considérablements ce qui lui a permis d'acquérir selon lui des biens mobiliers et ménagers .
texts.en: Mr. Aly is a married man and the father of five children. He has been working in commerce from a very young age. He used to help his father, who was a major merchant at the time. Currently, Aly manages his own business and sells millet, peanuts, and pesticides. He is on his third request for a loan and wished to have 400,000 francs CFA for this instance. The previous loans enabled him to increase his revenues considerably, and he says this allowed him to acquire furnishings and household items.

loans.use: to stock up on merchandise

loans.name: Kobenkoun Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes du groupe KOBENKOUN IV sont toutes mariées, ont  une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent dans es familles polygames à Kafla, l’un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, FANTA, la deuxième personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues sur place au marché du village, au niveau du marché de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 65.000 CFA en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The ten women of the group KOBENKOUN IV are all married, and they average 31 years of age and five children each. The women live in polygamous families in Kafla, a village of the Rural Commune of Banco, Prefecture of Dioïla, Region of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their work at the start of the off-season. The crops grown include rice and peanuts. The group members are on their first collaboration with the institution.

With this loan, FANTA, who is the second person sitting from the left in the photo, intends to buy farm inputs and assorted supplies and equipment and to pay for plowing to maintain about 0.5 hectare of rice and peanuts.

After the harvests, the produce is sold locally at the village market and at the markets of Banco and N’Golobougou. The customer base is composed of women and men. FANTA plans on making an average profit of 65,000 francs CFA at the end of the planting season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, and assorted supplies and equipment

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 25-year-old married woman with two young children. She has been a farmer for five years. Her husband, who is also a farmer, mainly manages their rice farm. Ruth does her best to keep their rice crops healthy and the farm free of weeds. Ruth also makes sure her children are healthy.

Ruth is requesting a loan to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and herbicides. She hopes to be able to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and herbicides

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last nine years. She is 42 years old, married to Simon and they have five school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her fifth loan. She paid all her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, Margaret hopes to become one of the leading farmers in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Florabel

texts.en:
Florabel is 39 years of age and is married. Her husband is an operator of a van providing transportation services to passengers. Florabel and her husband are blessed with three children who are currently attending school. One is in college while the other two are both at the high school level of education.

Florabel has always desired to help her husband move their family out of poverty, and the couple does their best to attain that goal. She engages herself in a retail business in which she sells bananas, vegetables, pears and other fruits.

She dreams of hog raising and having a sari-sari (variety) store business but she doesn’t have enough capital to make it happen. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of P12,000 to buy additional vegetables and fruits to sell in their village. She hopes to expand her business after receiving the loan.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables and fruits to sell in the village.

loans.name: Mamasoli

texts.ru: Мамасоли проживает в районе Кубодиен. Он женат. Ему 37 лет. У него пятеро детей. Он уже восемь лет как занимается торговлей на рынке. В основном он продает овощи. В торговле ей помогает его жена. Он берет кредит для покупки несколько мешков лука, картошки и моркови.
texts.en: Mamasoli lives in the Qubadiyon district.  He is 37 years old, married and has five children.  He has been involved in sales at the market for eight years.  Mamasoli primarily sells vegetables.  His wife helps him in this business.  He is requesting this loan to buy several sacks of onions, potatoes and carrots.

loans.use: to buy several sacks of onions, potatoes and carrots.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena, 48, is a hardworking woman who started her business 18 years ago. She is married and has four children. With the small capital generated from her business, she was able to make her business grow. Her husband helps her in operating their store. She acquires her merchandise from a delivery truck that brings merchandise to her store, but sometimes she goes to the market.

Magdalena would like to increase her groceries because of customer demand, but her funds are not enough so she is asking for a loan amounting to 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to invest in the business and increase the products that she sells. With the loan she requested, she will be able to improve their living conditions and support her children in their studies.

loans.use: to invest in the business and increase the products she sells in her retail store.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Salamatu.  She is a widow and has 2 children aged 8 and 5. She has 2 additional dependents who live with her because they help her with her business.  

In 1999, Salamatu established her used clothing and plastic products business. She began her business by assisting her late husband.  The business attracts a lot of customers.   Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, Salamatu earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000.  

Salamatu has already received and successfully repaid 1 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more bales of used clothing and plastic slippers. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. 

In the future, Salamatu plans to own a shop rather than a stall, to improve on the lives of her family, and to save for her children.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy used clothes and plastic slippers

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
La señorita es soltera, tiene 22 años de edad, cursó los estudios de educación básica, se dedica al comercio de chamarra de diferentes diseños, inicio este negocio como operaria y hasta el momento lleva 3 años de experiencia.

Decide solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para ampliar el capital de trabajo ya que va a comprar mas mercadería consistente en chamarras, en el futuro espera contar con más capital.
texts.en:
This young lady is 22 years of age, single, and finished her basic education. She has a business of selling jackets of various designs. She started out working as an operator and now has three years of experience.

She decided to request a loan to increase her operating capital. She plans to buy more merchandise, consisting of jackets. In the future, she hopes to have more capital.

loans.use: to buy jackets.

loans.name: Bogdana

texts.ru:
Богдана живет в Ивано-Франковске вместе со своим мужем. Она торгует женской одеждой, кофтами, платьями, свитерами, бриджами, юбками, а также мужской одеждой, халатами и т.п. на центральном промышленном рынке «Траян». Богдана всегда предлагает доступные цены и большой ассортимент продукции. На нее работает один наемный рабочий. Торговлей Богдана занимается 5 лет. Более того, 1.5 года назад она открыла торговое агентство «Сани Тур» в центральной части города и стала предоставлять туруслуги местному населению (визовая содействие, отдых и т.д.)

Богдане необходим кредит в размере 14 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить ассортимент мужских и женских халатов и свитеров и удачно их реализовать в этом сезоне, получив дополнительную прибыль. Полученную прибыль она планирует вложить в свой туристический бизнес, к которому всегда лежала душа, ведь Богдана в свое время окончила институт туризма.  
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en: Bogdana lives in Ivano-Frankivsk together with her husband.  She sells women's clothing, blouses, dresses, sweaters, breeches, skirts and also men's clothing, robes and the like at the central industrial market, called "Trayan".  Bogdana always offers affordable prices and a wide selection of merchandise.  She employs one person.  Bogdana has been involved in sales for five years.  Besides, she opened a travel agency, called "Sani Tur," in the central part of town one and a half year ago and started to offer travel services to local residents (Visa assistance, vacation, etc.).  Bogdana needs a loan in the sum of 14,000 hryvnia to buy a selection of men's and women's robes and sweaters in order to successfully sell them this season and make an additional profit.  She plans to invest the received profit into her travel business, which she always had a calling for, because after all, she previously graduated from a tourism institute.

loans.use: to buy a selection of men's and women's robes and sweaters in order to successfully sell them this season and make an additional profit

loans.name: Duo Flor De Cafe Group

texts.es:
DUO  FLOR DE CAFÉ
Doña Simona, es una persona trabajadora que día a día se dedica al comercio porque es el único medio que tiene para poder salir adelante,siendo ella la lider del grupo, vende en el mercado municipal de la localidad verduras, frutas y otros productos para apoyar a su esposo en los gastos de su familia tienen bajo su responsabilidad a dos niños menores de edad que necesitan el cuidad de sus padres, ella solo quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos y para que  puedan tener una vida mejor por eso esta solicitando este credito para la compra de frutas y verduras, para poder  surtir mas su negocio y tener mas ganancias. Jesus,  ella se dedica a la venta  de verduras, frutas y artículos de consumo diario  en el mercado municipal desde hace unos años, también en las tardes vende en la plaza municipal  pollos y papas  fritos  ha podido salir adelante ella y su familia gracias a su negocio, ella necesita un capital para poder engrandar mas su negocio porque todavía no cuenta con todo lo necesario, y para poder obtener un poco mas de ganancia
texts.en:
DUO  FLOR DE CAFÉ

Simona is a hardworking person who works as a merchant day to day because it is the only way she has to get ahead. She is the leader of the group, and she sells vegetables, fruit and other products in the local market. She does this to help her husband with the family expenses. She is raising two young children who need their parents' care. She only wants to get her children ahead so that they can have a better life. That is why she is asking for this loan  to buy fruit and vegetables to stock her business more and make more income. She has sold fruit and vegetables and items of daily consumption in the city market for several years. She also sells chicken and french fries in the city plaza to get her and her family ahead, thanks to her business. She needs the capital to grow her business more because she still doesn't have everything she needs to make a little more income.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Milagro Del Socorro

texts.es:
Milagro, necesita un nuevo préstamo para comprar productos para el negocio como quesillo, chicharrón, maíz y frijoles, para realizar la venta de pupusas, ella se animo por el nuevo tramite, porque le pareció la atención y además por la oportunidad para crecer con el negocio.
Para Milagro y su negocio, estos préstamos han representado un avance, ya que su capacidad ha aumentado, ella cuenta con salud y con un negocio que cada día crece.
texts.en:
Milagro needs a new loan to purchase supplies for her business such as cheese, shredded pork, corn and beans so she can sell pupusas. She decided to ask for a loan because of the new (field partner’s) procedure, because she liked the customer service she received and also because of the growth opportunity for her business. 
To Milagro and her business, these loans have brought about progress because her capacity has increased. She is healthy and her business grows everyday.

loans.use: to purchase cheese, shredded pork, corn and beans

loans.name: Mnarani Group

texts.en:
Kambona, who is in his late 40s, is married with two children who go to school. He has been running a grocery store for three years working from 4:00 pm to 11:00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Kambona's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania which he wants to use to increase his grocery inventory. His dream is to one day be able to send his children to good schools.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Mnarani" which has a total of 25 members, each of whom hold one another accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase his grocery inventory

loans.name: Trigal Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Trigal” está conformado por 21 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran repostería, chocolatería, joyería, venta de ropa y juguetes, entre otros negocios. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Puerto Montt.
Irma integrante del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en la segunda fila, ocupando el cuarto lugar de izquierda a derecha, su cabello es corto color castaño oscuro, usa un sweater color negro, jeans color celeste y zapatos negros. Para una mayor referencia se encuentra detrás de una señora de cabello cano y una señora quien viste una chaqueta bordo metálico o brillante.
Se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva para varón, dama y niños. Específicamente lencería y ropa interior, también vende ropa para la casa. Trabaja en éste negocio desde hace 2 años. Ofrece su mercadería puerta a puerta y también desde su casa, por lo que su horario es relativo y los fines de semana los destina para su familia y su hogar.
Próximamente arrendará un local establecido, lo que le permitirá abastecer su negocio con una mayor cantidad de mercadería.
Su mercadería la compra en dos grandes distribuidoras y las realiza por encomienda.
Con el crédito comprará ropa de casa.
Sus metas en su negocio son independizarse y que éste le brinde la posibilidad de obtener mayores utilidades.
Irma vive junto a su marido y sus dos hijos de 18 y 2 años de edad, su hijo mayor estudia la carrera de Administración de empresas. Uno de sus sueños a nivel personal es viajar con su familia y disfrutar de unas buenas vacaciones.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza para invertir en su negocio. Comenta que ha sido una ayuda inmensa.
Respecto a las capacitaciones, éstas le han permitido conocer nuevas estrategias de inversión y contabilidad. Además se siente muy cómoda con el grupo del Banco comunal del cual forma parte, ya que han compartido experiencias similares. 
Puerto Montt es una ciudad del sur de Chile, ubicada en la región de Los Lagos. Una de las atracciones de Puerto Montt son sus bellos paisajes verdes; sus playas poco frecuentadas; su gastronomía y especialmente la reputación de sus pescados y mariscos y sus artesanías. Es también la puerta de entrada a la Isla Grande de Chiloé, rica en tradiciones y leyendas.
texts.en:
The community bank, called "Trigal", is comprised of 21 entrepreneurs who run different businesses including a confectioners, a chocolate store, a jewelry store, clothes and toy sales, and others. They are all from the city of Puerto Montt. 
Irma, a member of the community bank, is in the second row of the photo in the fourth place from left to right. She has short, chestnut-colored hair and is wearing a black sweater and light blue jeans and black shoes. For further reference, she is between a woman with gray hair and a woman who is wearing a shiny metallic jacket.
She works selling new clothes for men, women, and children. She specializes in lingerie and underwear and also sells household linens. She has been doing this work for 2 years. She sells her goods door to door and also from her home, and so her timetable is flexible and she can keep the weekends for her family and home.
She will soon lease a store and this will enable her to stock her business with a greater quantity of merchandise. 
She buys her goods by the parcel from 2 large distributors. 
She will use the loan to buy household linens. 
Her goals for her business are to become independent which will give her the opportunity for higher profits.
Irma lives with her husband and 2 children who are 18 and 2 years old. Her oldest son is studying business. One of her personal goals is to travel with her family and enjoy some good vacations. 
She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza has offered her to invest in her business. She says that it has been a huge help. 
The trainings have taught her new strategies for investment and accounting. What's more, she feels very comfortable with the community bank that she is a part of as they have shared similar experiences. 
Puerto Montt is a city in the south of Chile, located in the region of Los Lagos. Puerto Montt's attractions include beautiful green countryside, quiet beaches, great food (particularly the fish and seafood), and its crafts. It is also the port of entrance for Isla Grande de Chiloé, which is rich in traditional and legends.

loans.use: to buy household linens.

loans.name: Wara

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Wara.  She is married and has five children aged 5, 11 (in class six) 14 (in junior secondary school form 3), 15 (in senior secondary school form 2) and 17.  Wara has no additional dependents living with her.  

 In 1995, Wara established her Maggi and other types of seasoning business.  She began her business at an early age. Everything about her is business. Working 7 days a week and 6 to 7 hours a day, she earns about Le 900,000 in profit every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. 

Wara requires a loan in order to improve her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits to approximately Le 1,300,000. In the future, Wara plans to educate her children to university level and she intends to be a great business woman. She is thanking you for your support.

loans.use: To buy cartons of Maggi for her business.

loans.name: Jembie

texts.en:
Jembie is 34 years old and lives in Southwestern Poblacion, Calamba. She is married with three children. 

Jembie has a grocery store business and earns approximately PHP 5,200 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP  to purchase equipment for repairs on the location of her Videoke business.

Jembie has been a member of PMPC for six years.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for repairs on the location of her Videoke business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy hens

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en: Hadjah is a single mother of two children; one of her children goes to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of selling green bananas and has been in this business for seven years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. She works from home seven days out of every week and sells to all categories of people on retail. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulting. She is aspiring to go to the villages of Masaka for green bananas and also to educate her children up to university level. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and paying for electricity bills.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Abed Alsalam

texts.en: Abed Alsalam is 49 years old; he lives in Gaza with his wife and four children. He sells various household items at good prices; he has been involved in his retail business since 2004. He is requesting a loan to purchase an electronic generator and to install a glass door and shelves for his shop. That will help him to increase his stock and lead to good living conditions; he needs the electronic generator because the electricity is constantly interrupted in Gaza. He hops his business will continue to improve so he can increase his income and give his children a good life and meets their needs. Abed Alsalam is very grateful to everyone who helps him achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase an electronic generator, install a glass door and shelves for his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Shakir

texts.en:
Shakir likes animals. All in Khaladj village know him and buy sheep from him.
He needs a loan of $1000 to buy pedigree ewes.
He is 48, married, has 2 children. This man is 
very optimistic about the future of his business.

loans.use: To buy pedigree ewes

loans.name: Aifili

texts.en: Supporting the family is Aifili's job.  She is twenty-three years old and has three small children.  But her husband is unable to find employment, and so Aifili took it upon herself to find a way to provide for her young family.  She joined the SPBD program to gain access to capital that she could use to launch her small village store.  Having a strong history of repayment in full and on time, Aifili has continued to qualify for subsequent loans that she uses to finance inventory purchases.  She wants to keep expanding her product supply until she has a full-scale grocery store. Being the sole breadwinner is a lot of responsibility for a twenty-three-year-old woman, but she is determined and hardworking and confident in her success.

loans.use: Buy merchandise to re-stock her shop

loans.name: Zulma Emilia

texts.en:
Zulma Emilia M. of B. is a widow and has a son. She sells furniture in her own house. Her business provides a steady monthly income to maintain her house.  Her son is a college student studying Electronic Engineering, which has a very  demanding schedule that makes it impossible for him to work at the same time. On weekends, he helps with the practical work of first year students in order to earn some income to help his mom with expenses. In order to finance his last year of college and fees for practical practice in his field, Zulma is using the money saved for expanding her stock of merchandise to pay for his study. 
Presently, she needs to buy furniture in large quantities to meet the increased demand for her merchandise. 
Zulma needs a loan of US$750 to buy tables, chairs, and beds that are currently in the most demand. Zulma dreams that her son will be a professional in the future, which will permit them to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy chairs, tables, and beds

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es:
Business Description

Mrs. Jesús María has 2 years of experience in business. 8 months ago, her son-in-law lent her some money and she decided to start her business, where she sells diapers, juices, sodas, cookies, notebooks, etc. She works Monday through Friday from 6:00 am until 5:00 pm, and on weekends from 9:00 am until 6:00 pm. Her business is located in her home.

Loan Use

Mrs. Jesús wants this loan to buy more merchandise, such as diapers, school supplies, and juices. She also wants to start selling gift items, since her business is located across from a school and she has a lot of demand for her products.

Personal Information

Mrs. Jesús María is 48 years old, she is married and has 5 children, all older. Her husband is a door-to-door vendor and he also contributes to the household expenses, and 2 of her children are single and live with her. Her home is made of cement, with 2 stories, and they are finishing constructing it. She is a woman who is making a great deal of effort to get ahead with her family, and she aspires to grow with her business as her loans generate greater utility and in that way to have a better way of life.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Descripción del Negocio

La Sra. Jesús María tiene 2 años de experiencia en el comercio hace 8 meses su yerno le presto un dinero y ella decidió poner su negocio donde vende pañales, jugos, colas, galletas, cuadernos etc. Ella atiende su negocio de lunes a viernes de 6:00am hasta las 17:00pm y los fines de semana de 9:00am hasta las 18:p.m. Su negocio esta ubicado en su domicilio.

Uso del Préstamo

La Sra. Jesús desea el crédito para comprar más mercadería como pañales, útiles escolares, y jugos, además que desea poner a la venta artículos de regalos, ya que su negocio esta ubicado frente a una escuela y tiene bastante demanda de sus productos.

Información Personal

Doña Jesús María tiene 48 años de edad, esta casada y tiene 5 hijos, todos mayores de edad. Su esposo es comerciante ambulante y también aporta para los gastos de la casa al igual que 2 de sus hijos que son solteros y viven con ella. Su casa es de cemento de 2 pisos y están terminando de construirla. Ella es una mujer muy esforzada por sacar adelante a su familia y aspira crecer con su negocio a medida que sus créditos le generen mayor utilidad y a si tener un mejor modo de vida.

loans.use: To invest in much more merchandise

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Albert is a 43 year old man with four sons that are currently studying in the Zona de Puesto Fernandez High School. Albert dedicates himself to raising chickens; he raises and sells them from hatching, and the sales take him all across the Puesto Fernandez zone, Minero, and the city of Montero in Santa Cruz de la Sierra. He has no competition in the region, and now that he is the only chicken breeder in the area, the price of baby chickens is up to 5 bolivianos per unit. His present request is for the construction of his home. He currently has an outstanding loan to the Bank of the Andes for $1000 with a remaining balance of $750.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer

Alberto es una persona de 43 años de edad, su familia está compuesta por cuatro hijos varones que actualmente están estudiando en el colegio de la Zona de Puesto Fernandez. Alberto se dedica a la crianza de pollos, cría y comercializa los mismos desde que son bebes, la comercialización la lleva a cabo en varios lugares tanto en la zona de Puesto Fernandez, Minero y Montero de la cuidad de Santa Cruz de la Sierra. No tiene competencia en la zona, ya que es el único que tiene un criadero de pollos, los precios del pollo bebé están a Bs. 5.- la unidad. La presente solicitud es para la contrucción de su vivienda. Actualmente tiene una deuda vigente en el Banco Los Andes de $us. 1,000.- con un saldo deudor de $us. 750.-.

loans.use: Construction of home

loans.name: Renn

texts.en:
Mrs. Renn M., 63, is a widow and lives with her three-children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To meet her family’s needs, Mrs. Renn M. works as a broker buying bananas from growers and then reselling them up for moderately for about $7.10/day in revenue. One of her children is employed as a taxi-driver, making about $5.50 each day, and the rest of her children are married.

Mrs. Renn M. has currently applied for a loan amount of $1000 to expand and reinvest in her business and the leftover of the loan is to fix her son’s car. She is appreciative of the power of the loan and is thankful for your trust and support. ( Mrs Renn M. is pictured with her son, who is a taxi-driver)

loans.use: To purchase more bananas for her business expansion.

loans.name: Jorge Francisco

texts.es:
Jorge Francisco began selling snow cones four years ago after he became unemployed. His sister suggested he purchase a small truck to become self-employed. Sales were good and he had to ask his wife and two children to help him with the 4 trucks he purchased to sell snow cones daily.

Since the trucks require maintenance, Jorge is requesting a $475 credit to be returned in six months. He needs the money to maintain the trucks for the beginning of the year and to purchase raw materials to produce his snowcones.

WIth your help, Jorge and his family can move forward and continue with their prosperous snow cone business.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance and purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Mazbut

texts.en:
Mazbut D. is 60 years old. He and his wife have raised six children.

Mazbut has a small vendor kiosk, which he has operated for 10 years. Mazbut sells a very wide range of goods, including cookies, chewing gum, candies, and household articles such as detergents, washing liquids, toothpaste, and brushes. Because of this, his kiosk is very popular in his neighborhood and brings in a stable income.

Mazbut requests 1,300 somoni (about $375.00 in US dollars) in order to increase the range of goods he sells, to include items such as foodstuffs and household goods. This is Mazbut's first loan; however, he promises to pay the loan in a timely manner, in 12 months.

loans.use: To increase the range of goods he sells

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en: Mariana M. works in a sartorial factory in the town of Smolian, Bulgaria. It is a common practice to be given extra work to do at home. Mariana has applied to do home work because it will allow her to earn extra payment and improve the financial situation of her family (Mariana’s husband is retired and she is the one that earns money for the family). Mariana needs $775 (1,000 BGN) to buy a sewing machine so she can work at home.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Carla Patricia

texts.es:
Carla Z. is 34 and lives in the 31 de Diciembre neighborhood. She is married, and her husband is considerably older than she is. He is 75 and retired, but is very healthy and full of life. They have two children. The money from her husband's pension pays for some of the minor household costs, however their main source of income is their butcher's shop, where they've both worked for the last three years. Despite their difference in age, they have been married for several years, and Carla's husband has even supported her older children from a previous marriage. He has taught her how to run the business, which he will leave to her and the children. Carla is seeking a loan to purchase meat to satisfy increased demand at her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

Carla Z., tiene 34 años de edad, vive en el Barrio 31 de Diciembre y es casada con un hombre bastante mayor que ella, el cual tiene 75 años saludables y aun llenos de vida y está jubilado, tienen 2 hijos, con esa jubilación se pagan algunos pequeños gastos de la casa ya que la principal actividad que ellos desarrollan es una Carnicería y en la cual trabajan ambos desde hace 3 años. A pesar de la diferencia de edad, tienen varios años casados y este señor la ha apoyado inclusive con sus hijos mayores que son de otro matrimonio, le ha enseñado el manejo del negocio que es la herencia que le dejará a ella y sus hijos. Ella solicita un crédito para comprar en mataderos carnes y vender ya que su demanda ha aumentado.

loans.use: Purchase of red meat for her business

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
Juan lives in Sandino Memorial district: he is aged 37 years old, is married and has three sons aged 3, 12 and 18 years old. His wife sells cosmetics and clothes and also helps with homework. Juan has a repair workshop and 15 years of experience in the business. He began repairing filing cabinets, refrigerators and cookers. Currently he has diversified his work, buying appliances in poor repair and offering them to his clients with a profit margin greater than 100%.

With the authorised loan, he is going to buy more equipment in poor states and add value to them in order to sell them on at a better price, as he has already been doing. In the future he wants to establish a prestigious workshop which will offer security and satisfaction, with good working conditions and atmosphere.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. Juan habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, su edad es 37 años casado y con tres hijos varones de 3,12, y 18 años de edad, su esposa vende cosmético y ropa y así ayudar al hogar. El Sr. Juan tiene un negocio de enderezado y pintura con 15 años de experiencia, el inicio reparando archivos y refrigeradoras y cocinas. Actualmente ha diversificado su trabajo comprando equipos en mal estado reparándolos y ofreciéndoselos a sus clientes con un margen de ganancia mayor al 100%.

Con el préstamo que se le otorgue va a comprar mas equipos en mal estado y proporcionarlo con un valor agregado y comercializarlo a un mayor precio ya que le ha resultado a futuro quiere un taller de prestigio que de segurita y sastifacer a sus clientes con condiciones laboral y ambiental.

loans.use: Purchase materials for his business

loans.name: Olga Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo belongs to the Communal Bank “Grupo Mientras Tanto San Agustín,” and she sells Avon products and makes deliveries to homes located in the Independencia district, Huaraz province of Ancash state.

With the S/.500.00 nuevos soles loan, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy various products on sale such as women’s and men’s cologne, perfume, cosmetics and deodorants.

She is 52 years old, married, and has 4 children. The three oldest children are in the university, and 1 daughter is finishing 5th year of secondary school. Her husband is a bricklayer and he has temporary work; together they cover their household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Consuelo, pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto San Agustín, ella se dedica a la venta de Productos Avon y hace entrega a domicilio ubicado en el distrito de Independencia, provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Con el préstamo de S/.500.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará varios productos en oferta como Colonias para damas y caballeros, perfumes, comesticos y desodorantes.

Ella tienen 52 años de edad, casada y tiene 4 hijos, 3 hijos mayores que estudian superior y 1 hija que esta cursando el 5to grado de secundaria, su esposo es albañil y tiene trabajos eventuales y los dos cubren los gastos del hogar.

loans.use: Purchase a variety of merchandise to resell

loans.name: Tou

texts.en: Tou L. S., 33, is married to Lu Ya, and they live in the Kampong Cham province with their three children. She sells groceries and vegetables in the market, typically making US$5 each day, while her husband works at a rubber plantation collecting rubber for US$2 each day. They are also supported by the employment of one of their sons who works with his father collecting the rubber. Tou L. S. has seen a need for electricity in her community where there is none, and she would like to purchase a generator. She has asked for a loan of US$650 to purchase a generator and the necessary wires and equipment to sell electricity to people in her community. She sees this as only the beginning, though, and would like to expand her electricity business in the future.

loans.use: Purchase of a generator

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
MuhammadU. a 24-year-old married man. He has two children and he is the resident of Ningarhar province. Due to civil wars in Afghanistan, he was not able to go to school; he had to work to support his family. He therefore began a small business.

First, Muhammad made a small retail store in Jalalabad City and with the little capital that he had, he purchased some basic goods. Initially, his business went well and he attracted plenty of regular customers in short while. However, after a few months, because of skyrocketing costs of living, the retail store no longer sufficed for the household expenses. Gradually, he was losing customers because there were not enough goods in the shop.

But now he is looking for a 50,000 Afghanis loan to stand on his feet once more. He intends to purchase various goods for his shop and increase the number of his customers once again. His shop has a good location in the market and that is definitely a plus.

MuhammadU. hopes to become a great businessman in the future. He works hard to achieve that goal. He is already thankful to the lenders.

loans.use: To purchase various goods for his shop

loans.name: Zuhura's Tupendane Group

texts.en:
Zuhura is 30 years old. She is married and has 7 children who are between the ages of 4 and 15 years old.

Zuhura has had a business selling food since 2004. Each day, she works at her business. She can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Zuhura now requests a loan so she can buy more food items like rice, maize, flour and bananas for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Mgeni.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Reidelinda

texts.es:
La señora Reidelinda, socia del B.C “Santa Rosa de Lima”, vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui. Se dedica a la venta de frutas, desarrolla su actividad en un puesto de venta en el mercado Poma Rosa de la ciudad en donde atiende a sus clientes con la amabilidad que la caracteriza. Decide iniciarse en el negocio para generar ingresos y estar en contacto con sus amigos y la gente. 

Con este préstamo de S/.2,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará frutas como plátanos de seda en racimos, naranjas, mandarinas en sacos, piñas, papayas entre otras frutas. Reidelinda manifiesta que debe surtir sus productos para asegurar las ventas.  

La señora Reidelinda tiene 61 años de edad y es viuda. Sus hijos son quienes la apoyan en sus metas, le gusta el negocio porque se distrae y no se siente sola, está en contacto con sus amigas y clientes. Desea mantener bien surtido su puesto.
texts.en:
Reidelinda, who is a member of the Santa Rosa de Lima community bank, lives in the San Martín region, Mariscal Cáceres province in the Juanjui district. She works selling fruit in a booth in the Poma Rosa market in the city, where she attends to her clients with the friendliness that characterizes her. She decided to start the business to earn income and to be in contact with her friends and other people. With this loan of 2,000 Nuevos Soles, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy fruits such as plaintains, oranges, tangerines by the sacful, pineapples, papayas, etc. Reidelinda says that she has to stock her products in order to maintain her sales. Reidelinda is 61 years old and a widower. Her children are the ones that support her in achieving her goals.
