She likes the business because it entertains her so that she doesn't feel lonely; she is always in contact with her friends and clients. She wishes keep her business well supplied.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruits such as plaintains, oranges, tangerines, etc.

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr: ASTOU D. HABITE AU QUARTIER NDAYANNE DE DIOURBEL. ELLE EVOLUE DANS LE SECTEUR DU COMMERCE DEPUIS 08 ANS. SON ACTIVIT2 CONSISTE A VENTRE DES CEREALES.
texts.en:
ASTOU D. lives in the NDAYANNE district of DIOURBEL. She has been developing in the commerce sector for eight years. Her work involves selling grain.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell grain

loans.name: Bui Thi

texts.vi: Chị T. năm nay 49 tuổi, gia đình chị có 4 người con trong đó có 3 con đã trưởng thành. Năm 1995 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Hiện tại ngoài chăn nuôi chồng và các con của chị còn đi buôn bán cá tăng thu nhập cho gia đình. Với mức thu nhập 2,5 triệu đồng/ tháng kinh tế gia đình chị T. đang ngày càng ổn định và phát triển. Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 15 triệu đồng để đầu tư mua bò về nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs T. is 49 years old. She has 4 children, 3 are grown up. In 1995 she joined TYM fund to get capital to start a pig raising business. Today, she, her husband and their children also sell fish to increase their earning. Their monthly income is 2.500.000 VND. Their financial situation is stable. For this round of loan Mrs T. is seeking 15.000.000 to buy calves to raise.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Jean

texts.fr: Né vers 1953 dans l’arrondissement de HOUEDOME de la commune de DANGBO, monsieur  A. Jean est marié et père de 5 enfants dont 4 scolarisés. Il est un cultivateur du village d’Ahovilèkomè de la vallée de l’Ouémé et est membre du groupement GH AYIDOTE MINAWANOU DE HOUEDOME. Les habitants de ce village font les travaux champêtres à la décrue du fleuve ouémé. Leurs terres sont riches et les offrent un bon rendement.  Leurs spéculations principales sont la culture du maïs, du piment, des légumes, du gombo, de la tomate et du manioc. Le problème de ces habitants riverains du fleuve est que, en période de crue, ils n’ont plus d’activité et dépensent tout le revenu issu de la campagne écoulée à la consommation. A la décrue ils n’ont plus d’argent pour payer la main d’œuvre indispensable pour emblaver la superficie à eux disponible.  La pratique dans le milieu qui consiste au bradage des récoltes ne les sécurise pas et les runes d’avantage. Cette pratique est la vente à un prix dérisoire de la récolte future a un nantis pour disposer de la somme nécessaire aux travaux champêtres. Fatigués de cette pratique ils ont sollicité un prêt de 100 000 FCFA pour l’exploitation d’environ 1hectares des spéculations susse indiquées.
texts.en:
Born around 1953 in the Houedome district of Dangbo village, Mr. Jean A. is married and has five children, four of whom attend school. He is a farmer in Ahovilèkomè village in the Ouémé valley and he is a member of the Houedome group GH AYIDOTE MINAWANOU. The inhabitants of this village farm the land after the level of the Ouémé river drops. Their lands are rich and highly productive. Their main business activities involve growing corn, peppers, vegetables, okra, tomatoes and manioc. The problem for these river valley dwellers is that, during the flood period, they no longer have anything to do and they spend all the income generated from the sale of their harvested produce. At low water they don’t have any money left to pay the workforce that is essential for sowing the land available to them. The local practice of selling off the harvested crops does not provide them with security, moreover, it bankrupts them. This practice involves selling the future harvest at a rock-bottom price to an affluent person to get hold of the money required to carry out the farming. Tired of this practice, they have asked for a loan of 100,000 FCFA ($200) to farm about one hectare of the aforementioned land

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To farm one hectare of corn and peppers

loans.name: Latif

texts.en:
Latif S. is a 43-year-old married man who lives with his daughter and owns a small farm. He lives and works in the small village of Penjikent, Tajikistan. Latif has a business raising and selling sheep. He has 5 years of experience in this field. 

Because sheep raising and selling is a profitable business, Latif has become a very successful businessman in a very short period of time. He works very hard and spends all his time with the sheep; cleaning, feeding and pasturing them. 

Now, Latif wants to expand his business and buy more sheep, so he has applied for a loan of 2000 Somoni ($600 USD). He promises to repay the loan within 12 months and thanks all lenders for their support. With your help, Latif can get ahead.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy sheep

loans.name: Nelofer Group

texts.en:
Nelofer is the group leader of Nelofer group. The members live in 15th district of Kabul, Afghanistan. The members want to take a group loan of 50,000 Afghani (USD$1075) for the term of 10 months. Each of the group members wants to take a loan to improve the progress of his or her business.

Nelofer's loan is for her brother’s fruit cart. Kemya wants to take a loan for sewing. Naqibullah wants to take a loan for his retail shop. Majeed wants to take a loan for the purpose of buying fuel for his shop.

The group members want to expand their businesses through the loan and support their families as well.

loans.use: To expand a fruit-cart business.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
Leonor Román R. desea poner techo en la parte de enfrente, con el anterior crédito ella mando que le construyeran las paredes y la esta utilizando como barda aun que le protege de la delincuencia su proyecto era una casa más grande. Ahora Leonor recurre aquí a pedir un préstamo, para poner su losa el cual tendrá que comprar material y pagar mano de obra. Su familia aun esta viviendo en un lugar muy incomodo ella piensa en el confort de y estabilidad de la misma.
El esposo es un señor que le gusta trabajar en taxi y con esto le ayuda a ella en los gastos familiares, donde trabaja Leonor es una maquiladora que no ganan mucho pero le sirve para estar pagando su casa y el préstamo.
texts.en:
Leonor Román R. wants to put a roof over the addition to her house that she is having built. With the previous loan that she received, she was able to pay for the construction of the walls. The walls act as a fence to guard her property against crime, but she wants to be able to use the additional space to live in. Now Loenor is asking for a loan to be able to lay tile in her addition and to be able to pay for labor. Her family is very uncomfortable living in a small space and she wants her family to be comfortable and stable. Her husband works as a taxi driver and his income helps her to support the family. Leonor works in a "maquiladora" (factory) where she does not make a lot, but her income helps her to pay for her house and her loan.

(Translated by Jasmine and Andrea of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Building Materials

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 35-year-old man who lives in Saida, Southern Lebanon with his wife and their child. Ahmad has owned a sweet shop since 2004. He sells Lebanese sweets. Ahmad requested a loan of $500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase raw materials and change the décor of his shop. This is the first time that Ahmad has requested a loan.

Ahmad is special in his work because he is known for his sweets. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t have a lot of networking. In the future, Ahmad plans to purchase his shop.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials and change the décor of his shop.

loans.name: Fuefue

texts.en:
Fuefue S. is a 27-year-old married woman with one child. She has 3 years of experience in the restaurant (barbecue) business. She explains that she operates her business six days per week.

She has received one previous loan from SPBD, which she successfully repaid. On average, her weekly net cash flow is approximately 145 Tala. SPBD loans are in fact Fuefue’s only access to capital because she cannot qualify for loans from traditional banks. She is now requesting a loan in order to purchase various ingredients and supplies (e.g., mutton, chicken, sausage, soy sauce, tomato sauce, onions, spoons, folks, knives, foil, and napkins). She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional raw materials and supplies

loans.name: Gulboy

texts.ru: Аламуродов Гулбой житель города Яван. Он живет вместе со своей семьей очень далеко от центра города.Он женат и имеет шестерых детей.  В его кишлаке занимаются в основном сельским хозяйством . Он имеет участок земли , засеивает его различными видами овощей. Обратился к нам за кредитом и на него планирует купить семена и удобрения. Это поможет ему своевременно засеять земли.
texts.en:
Gulboy A. is a resident of the city of Yavan. He lives with his family very far from the center of the city. He is married and has six children. In his village people mostly work in agriculture. He has a plot of land and plants different varieties of vegetables on it. He has turned to us for credit and plans to use it to purchase seeds and fertilizer. This will help him to sow his land at the right time.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia B. is forty-seven years old. She is married and has given birth to two sons and three daughters. According to her, one of her daughters is currently in junior high school, while the rest attend senior high school. Cecilia lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in the busy fishing/commercial town of Mankessim, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana. She works very hard to help her husband provide for their family. 

Cecilia is a baker. She sells most of her bread to retailers and beverage sellers, but she also hawks the bread in her community. She procures bags of flour and other ingredients from the local market. Cecilia has run this business for over fifteen years and she wants a loan to procure bags of flour in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure bags of flour

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris is 55 years old and married with 6 children. She owns a restaurant where she sells cooked foods and drinks. She hopes for the loan amount of N 50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace C. is 43 and married. She has given birth to four children, a daughter and three sons. Some are currently in senior high while others are in junior high and primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Her husband works with a local timber firm. 

Grace is a food vendor. She sells rice and stew in her neighborhood. She prepares the food in her residence and sells by the roadside. She buys bags of rice and other ingredients from Kumasi at affordable prices. Grace has been in business for more than 17 years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and sponsor her children to higher levels in school.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: Chhim's Group

texts.en:
Chhim S., 55, has been chosen to be leader by other members of this group loan. Chhim S. currently owns a bicycle, which she uses for riding to buy used goods at the cheapest price door-to-door and then sells them out to gain a profit. She is a married woman blessed with two children, one of whom is married and lives separately, whilst the other one is still living in the family home. Another source of income is from her husband who works in construction. Chhim S. is applying for a loan to purchase an old motor for her family’s traveling needs. This will help the family reduce paying tax costs. The other three borrowers who are jointly taking this loan are:
M., a farmer, who is asking for a loan to buy piglets to raise.
M. who will be using the loan to decorate her house.
L. who will take out this loan to buy a used motor to make the family's transportation easier.

loans.use: To purchase an old motor for family’s traveling needs

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es: la sra. MARIA DOLORES Z. se dedica al comercio, cuenta con un FOTO Estudio y venta de joyas de oro, actividad a la cual se dedica desde hace mas de 12 años, es madre de familia y tiene 3 hijos 2 de ellos estudian, junto a su esposo son los que administran el negocio, gracias a los ingresos que ellos tienen les ha permitido suplir los gastos familiares y otras obligaciones que tienen , es notoria la solidez y el deseo de superacion que tienen como familia ya que para lograr tener estabilidad en su negocio don Juan Varela su esposo sale ha realizar su trabajo fotografico en los diferentes eventos sociales y escolares que se desarrollan en el Municipio de Trojes y lugares vecinos. este credito lo necesitan para comprar los articulos al por mayor ya que asi es cuando se tiene mayor ganancia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Dolores Z. is dedicated to her business, a photo studio and selling gold jewelry, which she has done for the last twelve years.

She is the mother of three children, two of whom are in school. She manages the business with her husband. Thanks to the income from this business they are able to supplement family expenses and fulfill other obligations.

Their strength and the desire to overcome obstacles to make their business stable is evident. Her husband, Juan Varela has to leave in order to do his work as a photographer at different social and school events in the city of Trojes and neighboring areas.

They need this loan to buy items at wholesale price to increase profits.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing rolls of camera film, frames, and gold rings and bracelets

loans.name: Leagaioalii

texts.en:
Leagaioalii M. is a 34-year-old woman who lives in the town of Samalaeulu Leauvaa. She is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Leagaioalii plants, harvests, and sells bananas. Leagaioalii has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 400 WST a month from these activities.

In 2007, Leagaioalii joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Leagaioalii has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1250 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  Leagaioalii is now requesting a new loan of 2000 WST which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  This will be Leagaioalii's 4th loan from SPBD.  Leagaioalii plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve her family's general living conditions.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Melba

texts.en: 54-year-old Melba L. is a food vendor. She sells snack food for the neighbors just to augment her farmer husband's sporadic income. Two months ago, she decided to open a small variety store in their house. Business capital she had then came from her only child who is a laborer. This is the only child she had living with her after five other children got married and moved to their own houses nearby. Though Melba has able to maintain her small variety store, the capital she had was not enough to fill up her store with basic items and products which people in the village need. Now that she is a member of ASHI, she has applied for a loan which will complete her variety store. She hopes that with this loan she will be able to sell more necessary items in her store for the convenience of her neighbors.

loans.use: Will be used to buy soft drinks and canned foods for sale in her variety store.

loans.name: Ivan Placido

texts.es:
Ivan, tiene un taller en la zona sur de la ciudad de La Paz, donde realiza lavado de autos y engrase. 
Vive en la zona de chasquipampa de la Ciudad de La Paz, en casa de sus padres
El crédito será destinado para capital de inversión ( compra de par de rampas, compresora y engrasadora)
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, con este crédito podrá mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Ivan has a workshop in the area south of the city of La Paz, where he washes and lubricates cars. He lives in the area of Chasquipampa in the city of La Paz, in his parents’ house. The loan will be used as capital for investment to buy a pair of ramps, a compressor, and an oiler. This is the first time he has requested a loan from Impro. With this loan, he will be able to improve the conditions of his life.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for investment

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol tiene 39 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en su casa propia. DesD. hace 9 años se dedica al comercio, pero hace un año decidió incursionar en L. venta D. ganado ovino. ElL. compra estos animales en los establos más lejanos D. L. zona rural D. su localidad, pues allí los obtiene a menor precio, posteriormente los revenD., los fines D. semana, en L. feria ganadera D. su ciudad. Los demás días D. L. semana, Marisol se dedica a L. venta D. comida en L. esquina D. su casa o en L. feria D. peleas D. gallos que  hay en su zona. Durante este tiempo D. trabajo ha notado L. rentabilidad D. su negocio, por lo que va a comprar más animales.
Este es su 13avo préstamo con MFP y está muy contenta D. ser parte D. su banco comunal, pues les tiene gran estima a todos sus compañeros, por lo que asume el cargo D. presidenta D. L. junta directiva, durante este ciclo D. crédito. El dinero que ahora solicita será destinado al incremento D. los animales que venD..

loans.use: Compra de más ovejas

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia S. is from the village of Pandan, Gingoog City. She is 41 years old, is married, and has six adult children. Lucia owns and operates a bakeshop, baking and selling bread in the local community. She earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. Lucia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional cooking ingredients. Lucia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her fields

loans.name: Generation 2006 Group

texts.es: La asociación “Generación 2006” esta formada por doce integrantes, ellas  se reúnen en el centro focal Villa Exaltación,  trabajan de forma responsable en todas sus actividades de grupo. Actualmente las socias tienen negocios distintos, por ejemplo  Maria Eugenia Q., que es la presidente de grupo se  dedica a la venta de mercadería  de acuerdo  a la temporada, Jackelyn vende abarrotes, Miriam confecciona  mantas y polleras (pollera= falda tradicional para mujeres de algunas regiones) ,Verónica tiene un puesto de libros y revistas, Samuel es mecánico, Lita vende pañales desechables.Toda la asociacion  desea  obtener mayores ventas, para este objetivo necesitan comprar mercadería, tienen la certeza de  generar mayores ingresos que les permita ofrecer  bienestar a sus familias.
texts.en:
The Generation 2006 Association consists of twelve members who meet at the Villa Exaltación community center. They work responsibly in all of their group activities. The members currently have distinct business. For example, Maria Eugenia Q. is the president of the group and sells seasonal merchandise. Jackelyn sells groceries. Miriam produces blankets and “polleras” (traditional skirts worn by women from certain regions). Veronica has a newsstand where she sells books and magazines. Samuel is a mechanic. Lita sells disposable diapers. All of the members want to obtain better sales. For this reason, they need to buy merchandise. They are certain they can generate more revenue to allow them to support their families.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Iyad

texts.en: Iyad is a 33 year old man, He is married and has 3 children. Iyad owns small store where he sells all kinds of perfumes. He is interested in expanding his business, which is his main financial source, by purchasing more perfumes for his store.  He is requesting a loan of 3000USD for that purpose. Iyad thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Purchasing more perfumes

loans.name: Lhagvasuren

texts.en:
G. Lhagvasuren is 48 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Zavkhan province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Her husband is a fireman who also works in construction during the summer. Lhagvasuren operates a vegetable trading business in her town. She sells a variety of vegetables from a rented stall at the local market. Lhagvasuren started her business in 2000 and has built a successful operation over the years. Today, she has a loyal customer base that provides her with a consistent stream of business. Lhagvasuren is very hardworking and is focused on the future. She says, “I am working hard to improve my family's quality of life.” Her wish is to one day have her own grocery shop. Lhagvasuren is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase a small building where she can operate her grocery business.

About XacBank
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here:http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&queryString=Mongolia&status=fundRaising&gender=All&sectors[]=All&regions[]=All&sortBy=Expiring+Soon

loans.use: To purchase a small building where she can operate her grocery business.

loans.name: Sitoe

texts.en:
Sitoe is 50 and married with 5 children (ages 8-20).  She owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  She has 3 years of experience in this business.    Sitoe needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Sitoe joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Sitoe's 1st loan with SPBD. 

Overall Social Metric Score for Sitoe A. provided by SPBD:*               1.9 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3 

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza N., 30, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She is married to Richienel N. and they are blessed with five children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. Together they have been selling electronic gadgets for ten years.

Eliza has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than two years now. She regularly attends the weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow nine times in CCT’s cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed solely to buy assorted electronic gadgets.  Her business lets her earn a profit of PHP 17,400 per month.

Now, with your help, Eliza would like to apply for a PHP 20,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying more electronic gadgets and appliances.

Eliza dreams that her business will continue to grow so that her family will have better living conditions in the future.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more electronic gadgets for her business

loans.name: Tobías Rafael

texts.es: Tobías Rafael M. V. de 44 años de edad, reside en Cojutepeque, departamento de Cuscatlán. Vive junto a su extensa familia, la cual esta conformada por su esposa quien es ama de casa, y sus cuatro hijos todos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar,  el hijo mayor de 17 años, le ayuda a su padre con el negocio. Tobías posee un taller de enderezado y pintura, en el cual trabaja desde hace 10 años atrás, tiempo el cual le cuenta por mucha experiencia, por la que los clientes solicitan mucho su trabaja, ya que él es una persona muy responsable quien siempre entrega su trabajo a tiempo y con excelentes resultados. Debido a que uno de los mayores deseos de Tobías es poder mejorar las condiciones de su negocio, y así mismo mejorar sus servicios, él solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar materiales de trabajo como: pintura, compresores y otros artículos más, los cuales son utilizados a diario en su trabajo. Entre las razones con mayor peso para querer crecer en su negocio está su familia, esto debido a que Tobías es el único que trabaja para brindarles el sustento diario y todo lo que ellos necesitan
texts.en:
Tobías Rafael M. V. is 44 years old and lives in Cojutepeque, a zone of Cuscatlán. He lives with his large family, comprised of his wife who cares for the home, and their 4 children who all study. Their oldest son is 17 years old and helps his father with the business. Tobías has an auto body and paint shop where he has worked for 10 years, and all the time spent there has given him a lot of experience. For this reason customers ask for his work, and he is very responsible and always meets deadlines with excellent results. Due to the fact that one of Tobías' greatest desires is to be able to improve the conditions of his business, and thus improve his service, he is asking for a loan to buy materials such as paint, air compressors, and other supplies that he uses daily in his work. One of the most pressing reasons to want to grow his business is his family, because Tobías is the only one who works to provide for their daily needs and all that they need.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tools and paint for cars

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Cham

texts.en:
Cham L. sells groceries at home and works as an actor in a music band for Cambodian traditional weddings. She earns approximately US $5 per day. She has been in this business since 1998. Her husband is a cook and an actor in a Cambodian traditional band, earning US $5 per day. L. is requesting a loan of US $1000 to buy video and photo cameras to provide photo services during wedding ceremonies. 

Cham L., age 42, is married and lives with her husband in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She has three children. By working, she is able to cover her family's expenses, especially the children’s education. Their standard of living has improved with her business, so she wants to expand it. This is her second loan from CREDIT, partnered with Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a camera and a video camera

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe Benkadi  sont toutes mariées. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans, 3 enfants et vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Zanfina, un des villages de Fana, préfecture de Dioila, deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali.
Ces femmes  font essentiellement l’achat et la vente de céréales et de condiments alimentaires.
Après avoir correctement remboursé le premier prêt, les femmes du groupe  Benkadi sont à leur  deuxième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 3 tonnes de céréales sèches (fonio, petit mil, maïs) et une importante quantité de condiments alimentaires. 
Elles s’approvisionnent essentiellement sur place auprès des producteurs et effectuent leurs ventes au marché,  généralement au comptant, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15.000FCFA qui sera  utilisé pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group Benkadi are all married. On average, they are 35 years old and each have 3 children. They all live in traditional extended families in Zanfina, one of the towns in Fana, a county of Dioila, the second administrative region of Mali. These women mostly buy and sell cereals/ grains, and food condiments. Having fully repaid their first loan, the women of the group Benkadi are requesting their second group loan, which they will use to purchase 3 tons of dried cereals (fonio (a millet-like grain), small millet, corn) and a large quantity of food condiments. They mostly supply themselves locally from farmers and then the women sell their products in the market, usually for cash, to a clientele composed of men and women. They envision each earning an average monthly income of 15,000FCFA, which they will use to pay for the needs of their families and invest the remainder in their businesses.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cereals and condiments

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es:
El Sr. Nelson tiene 32 años de edad, vive en pareja con Sandra  con quien tiene 2 hijas que están en edad escolar.
 Él se dedica a la venta de pancho, hamburguesa y asadito en el cruce denominado Las Piedras, de la ciudad de Itá,  mientras que su esposa es la encargada de las ventas de frutas y verduras en un puesto también ubicado en el mismo lugar. En dicha zona son los únicos  que se dedican a tales actividades. 
Anteriormente Nelson trabajaba con su tío en la venta de frutas y verduras pero con el tiempo  fue ahorrando junto con su actual pareja, logró independizarse y creó su propia micro empresa y así fue creciendo.
En esta oportunidad solicita el crédito  para la compra de frutas, verduras y comestibles tales como: panchos, panes, bebidas, etc. para su panchería.
texts.en:
Mr. Nelson is 32 years old, lives with his partner Sandra and has 2 daughters who are in school.

He is dedicated to the sale of hot dogs, hamburgers and barbecue meat at the crossroads called Las Piedras, in the City of Ita, His wife is in charge of selling fruits and vegetables in a booth in the same location. In that area are the only ones engaged in such activities. Nelson previously worked with his uncle in the sale of fruits and vegetables but saved money along with his partner and achieved independence starting their own micro-business, which has grown.

He is asking for a loan that will be invested in the purchase of fruits, vegetables and groceries such as hot dogs, bread, drinks etc.. for his business.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Salvacion's Group

texts.en:
Salvacion M. is from the village of Estefania, Amulung, Cagayan. She is 28 years old. Salvacion is the group leader of an 18-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Salvacion is married and has two infant children. To make a living, Salvacion owns & operates a general store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Salvacion has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Salvacion joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Salvacion has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. Salvacion is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Salvacion from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offerings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase local artifacts and jewelry for sale

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine S. is from the village of Brgy.Poblacion, Diadi, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 43 years old. Josephine is married and has 6 children. To make a living, Josephine owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Josephine joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the second loan taken out by Josephine from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en: Oliver is married with eight children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. Oliver owns a stall in Ntinda Kigowa on the out skirts of Kampala, selling fruits and vegetables. She has been in this business for 15 years.  She wants to use this loan to buy more fruits and vegetables from Nakawa market, like mangoes. oranges, tomatoes and cabbages.  She works six days a week.  Her business challenge is transportation of perishable fruits from Nakawa to Ntinda. Oliver uses public transport to and from shopping. The family has access to electricity and piped water.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Eleonora

texts.en:
Eleonora J., from the village of Brgy. Sto. Domingo, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya, is 42, married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Eleonora owns and operates a general store selling a variety of products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over 15 years, she earns approximately 6500 PHP a month.

In 2007, Eleonora joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 22,000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase additional products to sell, she is now requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be Eleonora's ninth loan from ASKI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Carlos José

texts.es: En la comarca las mariitas sector el espino, municipio de somotillo, el señor Carlos José V., es uno de los muchos productores agropecuarios de la zona, este señor se dedica al desarrollo de actividades tanto agrícolas  como pecuarias dentro de las cuales destaca un sin numero de rubros los que constituyen su base económica y a su vez también parte de su seguridad alimentaria para su familia, la que se compone de 5 hijos, de los cuales solo tiene una niña de 16 años de edad y el resto son varones de 4 a 12 años de edad respectivamente, este señor junto a su esposo y estos pequeños realizan el establecimiento de sus cultivos dentro de los que se destacan Maíz, Sorgo, Ajonjolí, frijoles entre otros, también rubros pecuarios como la crianza de ganado bobino, porcino, aviar y caprino los que son la base fundamental para la mantención de su familia. Este señor solicita un crédito para comprarse una manzana más de terreno para poder proveer mejores condiciones a su hato ganadero, con el que pretende mejorar la situación alimentaria de su ganado.
texts.en:
In the neighborhood of El Espino in the town of Somotillo, Las Mariitas region, Sr. Carlos José V. is one of many agricultural producers in the area. He engages in various farming activities that form the financial base on which he can support and feed his family. Carlos has five children, which includes a 16 year old daughter and four sons between the ages of 4 and 12 respectively. With the help of his wife and children, Carlos grows crops such as corn, sorghum, sesame, beans, and other items. He also raises cows, pigs, chickens, and goats to support his family.

Carlos is requesting a loan in order to buy additional land that measures 1mz (approximately 1.74 acres) for his herd of cattle in hopes of improving feeding conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase additional land for his cattle to graze

loans.name: Rosa Victoria

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Bancomunal Amaquella, es viuda y madre D. cuatro hijos, el mayor D. 37 años y el último D. 24 años. Rosa se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos D. ORIFLAME y gaseosas D. diferentes marcas y tamaños, este negocio lo viene realizando desD. hace 16 años, sus clientas son sus amigas del lugar donD. vive.
En sueño D. Rosa es poder abrir una Farmacia y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Amaquella Communal Bank. She is a widow and the mother of four children. Her oldest child is 37 years old and the youngest one is 24 years old. Rosa sells Oriflame cosmetics and sodas of different brands and sizes. She has been in business for 16 years. Her customers are her friends who live in the same neighborhood.

Rosa dreams of opening a pharmacy and seeing her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks by the case

loans.name: Laure Rachel Estelle

texts.fr:
Femme couturière de 38 ans célibataire avec 3 enfants dont l’age varie entre 7 et 21 ans.
Quand elle finit sa formation en Coupe et Couture, sa mère lui fait  cadeau d’une machine à coudre   et elle ouvre un atelier de couture en 1996. Elle a une forte clientèle et elle a en moyenne 45000 a 50000 Frs par jour des recettes.
 Avec le prêt qu’elle compte recevoir elle  va acheter des tissus et pagnes  et faire des camisoles, des chemises, des ensembles dames qu’elle va  vendre à ses clients et en dehors de cela il y a aussi les commandes de clientes qu’elle reçoit chaque jour.
Les difficultés qu’elle rencontre se situent  dans l’accumulation des commandes et les clients qui ne respectent pas leur rendez vous.
A l’avenir elle pense ouvrir une école de couture pour la réinsertion des jeunes filles mères et les aider a la longue à se prendre en charge
Elle pense aussi continuer ses cours de designer pour être modéliste et faire des défiles de mode dans le futur.
texts.en:
This is a seamstress, aged 38, who is unmarried. She has three children, who range from 7 to 21 years of age. When she finished her training in the tailoring trade, her mother gave her a sewing machine as a gift. She opened a workshop in 1996. She has a strong customer base and has an average income of 45,000 to 50,000 francs CFA per day. With this loan that she plans on receiving, she is going to purchase some fabrics and pagnes (colorful West African cloth) to make camisoles, shirts, and women's outfits that she will sell to her customers. Beyond this, there are special orders from customers she receives each day. The difficulties she encounters involve the accumulation of orders, and the customers do not keep their appointments. In the future, she is thinking of opening a sewing school for re-integrating young mothers into the working world and for helping them to support themselves eventually. She is also thinking of continuing with her design courses in order to be a designer and to put on fashion shows in the future.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fabrics, yardage, traditional cloths, thread, lace, linings

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma M. is 56 years old and lives in Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Jerry M., an overseas Filipino worker, and and has  four children, one of whom is already working while the other three are still in school. At this time, she is working hard so that she can send her remaining children to college.  As an elementary graduate Norma believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Norma operates a rug-making business. She mainly offers rugs, such as round palm-sized ones to much larger doormats, braided quilts, bed sheets, and other crafts. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, rugs are one of the most common products that can be bought. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php200 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials, including fabric, thread, and newspapers for patterns. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Norma dreams of giving her children a high quality education through all her hard work with her business.

loans.use: Buy more quantities of raw materials such as fabric, thread, and newspapers for patterns

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es:
Maria Francisca C. tiene 50 anos. Es viuda y vive en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia Bolívar de Ecuador. Tiene 7 hijos de 27 hasta 11 anos.

Maria es una socia de la ventanilla rural Gradas Chico, que está ubicada a quince minutos en carro de la ciudad de Guaranda. Son 20 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz, trigo, papas, y la cría de animales.  Este es el tercer préstamo que sacan con la cooperativa.

A Maria se dedica a la agricultura. Tiene cultivos de maíz y papas. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en el mercado de Guaranda cada semana. 

Solicita el crédito para comprar una bacita que la permitiría mantener la familia económicamente con la leche de la baca. Su sueno es poder mantener a sus hijos. Se desafía por la falta de alimento para las 2 bacas que ya tiene.
texts.en:
Maria Francisca C. is 50 years old. She is a widow and lives in the canton of Guaranda , part of the Bolivar province in Ecuador. She has seven children ranging from 27 to 11 years old.. Maria is member of the Gradas Chico rural bank, which is located 15 minutes by car from the city of Guaranda. There are 20 members in total, who for the most part dedicate themselves to growing corn, wheat, potatoes and the breeding of animals. This is the third loan taken out with the cooperative. Maria devotes herself to farming. She grows corn and potatoes. She gets supplies and sells her products at the weekly market in Guaranda. She is requesting the loan to buy a calf which will enable her to support her family financially through selling cow milk. Her dream is to be able to support her children. She is confronted by the lack of feed for the two cows she already owns.

Translated from Spanish by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy a cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more cosmetics for her stall

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Gloria se dedica a la elaboración de mochilas, tiene mucho tiempo con este negocio desde hace 7 años, por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos pues han sido de gran ayuda con su negocio. Por lo que siempre está buscando la forma de sufragar los gastos de su hogar,  ella es una mujer muy emprendedora y que ha salido adelante con todas las dificultades que ha enfrentado. Este crédito que solicita es para la compra de zipper, hilos, tirantes, tijera entre otras cosas necesarias. Pues siempre está esforzándose para lograr mucho empeño en su actividad.
texts.en: Gloria works making backpacks and has been in the business for seven years, which is why this isn’t the first time that she has received a loan.  The loans have been of great help to her business, which is why she is always looking for a way to defray her household expenses.  She is a very enterprising woman and she has gotten ahead, even with all of the difficulties that she has faced.  The loan that she is requesting is for the purchase of zippers, thread, straps, scissors, and other necessary items.  She always puts a lot of effort into her work to do her best.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mary Atieno

texts.en:
Mary Atieno A. is 47 years old and a widow. She has eight children who she is taking care of. They live in Migori town.

Mary does a business of selling clothes fabric/materials in the open air market and has been in this business for the past ten years.  She is applying for her seventh loan of Kshs 70,000 from Kadet Ltd and has a good credit history with us through the years. Mary wants to use the money to buy several materials to add to her stock to be able to meet the demands of her clients.

Her hopes and dream is to expand her business and establish a store where she will be able to sell directly to people instead of hawking.

loans.use: To buy more materials for making clothes

loans.name: Serious Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Serious” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Waterloo, a small town near Freetown. They are seeking a loan of SLL 500,000 for each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Aminata K.. Aminata is age twenty-eight and was born in the village of Lumpa. She is married with one child. Her husband is a driver and her child is a pupil.  Aminata sells slippers, bags for ladies, clothes, etc. She has been a businesswoman for five years now. She will use her share of this loan to buy the above-mentioned items in large quantity to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: Buy slippers, bags for ladies, clothes, etc. in large quantity

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama A. is married to a trader and they live together with their six dependants. She is into the sale of foodstuffs such as cassava and plantain in Elmina, which she has been doing for the past ten years. Ama uses her income to assist her husband in providing for the basic needs of the family. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy extra foodstuffs for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to build a house.

loans.use: To buy extra foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Marasua Ole

texts.en:
Marasua Ole K. is 37-years-old. He is married to Naisuaku Ene Kasoe and he is a father of four school going children. Marasua is a businessman involved in buying and selling of sheep which he has been doing this for the last 10 years. 

Marasua learnt about KADET from a colleague who is already a registered client. This will be his first loan which he is planning to spend the Kshs 50,000 to buy young bulls for fattening and later sell at a profit. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to use to meet for the basic needs of his family. 

His future dream is that he will be able to do well in business whereby he can become a commercial businessman. He is a hardworking man who is focused to his set goals.

loans.use: to buy young bulls to fattening and sell

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en: A. Andrew is an individual client from Rukungiri. He is 22 years old and married with 4 children and his business is dealing in agricultural products selling 'matooke' (green bananas) in the town. Andrew works closely with his wife and together, they are able to make 100,000/= as weekly profits. Andrew says that his customers are good and friendly and he needs a loan to be able to improve his banana plantation. Andrew says that this is a better business compared to the one he used to have, roasting meat by the roadside.

loans.use: Improving his banana plantation with fertilizers

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Huancheñas”  del distrito Huancané,  provincia D. Huancané y departamento D. Puno, tiene 56 años, D. estado civil casada, tiene 07 hijos (06 independientes), estudió educación primaria.

La señora es una socia nueva, recientemente se incorporó como al Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos, el préstamo que solicita es D. S/. 500.00, dinero que invertirá en su negocio D. venta D. animales caseros, comprará dos unidades D. ovejas.
También realiza tejidos como frazadas, su esposo le ayuda y  trabaja como secretario en los juzgados.

Su sueño es tener más capital para mejorar sus ganados.

Lo que le gusta es conversar con las socias y estar alegres.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is a member of the "Las Huancheñas" community bank which is located in Huancané district, in Huancané province, in Puno department.

Alejandrina is 56 years old, married and has 7 children (6 of whom live independently).  She studied to elementary school level.  Alejandrina is a new member who recently joined Movimiento Manuela Ramos.  She is requesting a loan for 500 Peruvian soles which she will invest in her business selling livestock.  She will buy two sheep.

Alejandrina also makes knitted products such as blankets.  Her husband helps her and works as a court secretary.  Alejandrina's dream is to have more capital to improve her livestock.  What she enjoys is chatting with the other members of her community bank and being happy together.

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Abubakari

texts.en:
Abubakari K. G. is a 34 year old man. He is married to Esther and together they have been blessed with two children. He has been a retail shop trader for the last two years.

This marks his second loan from KADET, and he plans to purchase cereals, vegetables and sodas (soft drinks) for his business. The anticipated profits have been directed to the expansion of his business. 

His future dream is to expand his business into a wholesale shop.

loans.use: purchase cereals, vegetables and soda for his business

loans.name: Shova

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Shova Thapa.  She is married and has two children, age 20 and 16.  In 2010, she established her tea shop business.  Working seven days a week and seven hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy food supplies for her shop.  In the future, Shova plans to raise the economic conditions of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

Whether on the streets of Kathmandu or in the villages outside of the capital, tea shops are places of business and meeting in Nepal.  Called a chiya pasal, these tea shops make a sweet, milky tea that can be purchased for a few cents a cup.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to keep their store shelves stocked while increasing their profit margins by buying in greater volume. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering micro-credit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  

For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:  BPW Partner Page     

Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team

loans.use: to buy food supplies

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is a young man from Jabalia refugee camp.  Abdallah has a musical band that performs at weddings, graduation parties, and formal and informal events. Abdallah, who appears in the picture here, is the father of one daughter and one son.

Abdallah took a loan from FATEN to purchase musical instruments and costumes for his band. The band is quite well known In Jabalia refuge camp and the Gaza Strip.

Abdallah is a National Palestinian Authority employee.

loans.use: Purchase musical instruments and costumes for his band

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: Lourdes tiene 35  años, vive con sus 2 hijos en casa de sus familiares. Hace más de 2 años se dedica a la confección de mandiles y también bordados, desde entonces y teniendo como una herramienta su maquina de coser ella dispone de su tiempo para realizar esta actividad, además que le permite estar en su casa cuidando de sus hijos. Trabaja todos los días para luego los fines de semana vender al por mayor y de esta manera logra tener los ingresos  que le permite solventar los gastos de su hogar, le agrada realizar su trabajo porque le permite desarrollar su creatividad y lo considera un pasatiempo, esto la motiva para que cada día siga adelante es por eso que piensa tener una maquina de coser industrial. Es su  primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero y agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de telas e hilos al por mayor.
texts.en:
Lourdes, 35, lives with her two children in family members’ house.  For over two years she has been making aprons and embroidery.  Since then she’s had a sewing machine that’s her work tool.  She is able to manage her own time for work that she’s able to do at home while caring for her children.  She works every day in order to sell her wares at wholesale on weekends. This is how she earns income to meet household expenses.

She enjoys the work because it allows her to develop her creativity and she considers it like a hobby.  This motivates her to continue forward every day and this is why she’s thinking about getting an industrial sewing machine.

This is her first loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support and is grateful to all those who will fund the loan she’s asking for that will be so useful for the progress of her business.

She will use the requested funds to buy fabric and thread at wholesale.

loans.use: To buy fabric and thread at wholesale.

loans.name: Mrs. Thul Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The 16 people  who make up this village bank loan have selected Mrs. Thul to be the village bank president. They will use their portion of the loan for different purposes by which they can improve their families' standard of living. 

Mrs. Thul owns a general store in the local village where she sells groceries to earn some profit to support her family. Since her business is getting on well, she wants to expand. Thus, in order to improve her daily income, Mrs. Thul is seeking a loan to buy more groceries for resale.

 Her husband, Mr. Sophat, is a farmer and a vice village chief. They support four children; one is a laborer, and the others are students.

loans.use: to buy more groceries for resale

loans.name: Bernagen

texts.en:
Bernagen works hard to support her family. Bernagen is single and has a guitar business in the Philippines.

Bernagen requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy more materials.

Bernagen has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Bernagen would like to expand her business and make house repairs.

loans.use: to purchase wood strings, glue and copper

loans.name: Lucas

texts.en:
Lucas C. F. is 32 years old and single. For the past two years, Lucas has been in the motorcycle transport business in Mtwapa, Mombasa. He earns a good income.

Lucas is applying for his second loan from KADET to purchase spare parts to repair his motorbike. He has never borrowed from a microfinance institution other than KADET. Lucas will use the profits from his loan to improve his business. His dream is to have a Matatu (minibus) business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for motorcycle repair

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is currently in business selling maize. She is 40 years old, married, with seven children and all of them go to school. Rose borrowed a loan to stock more maize to sell. She hopes to expand in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more maize kernels to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase stylish clothes to sell

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La Sra. Margarita pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen de las Mercedes” del Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Está casada, tiene 43 años  y  es madre de 04 hijos, de ,os cuales una cuenta con familia propia.
 
Se  inicia con  la crianza de peces, mariscos (churos, conchas) para su consumo familiar.  Con un pequeño capital de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, y debido a la gran demanda en el mercado local decide incrementar la crianza con fines comerciales es así que actualmente distribuye sus productos a los distintos puestos del mercado contando con una buena clientela.  

Con este préstamo de S/. 1200.00 comprará redes para pescar, alimento balanceado para poder alimentar a los peces y mariscos, alvinos (crías pequeñas de peces y mariscos) para que se desarrollen y así  proveer de estos productos, de forma diaria, a su numerosa  clientela, quienes se encuentran satisfechos con la buena atención que ella les brinda. 

Margarita tiene como sueño ampliar su piscigranja y está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por darle la oportunidad de ayudar a su familia a salir adelante.
texts.en: Margarita is a member of the communal bank “Virgen de las Mercedes” in Juanjui, Mariscal Cáceres, San Martín. She is 43, married and the mother of four children, one of whom has her own family.   Margarita raises fish and seafood for household consumption.  With a small base capital of S/ 300.00 soles she was able to grow her business and now has an established clientele.  She now seeks a credit of S/ 1200.00 to buy fishing nets, fish feed, fish and mollusk stock, in order to increase production and satisfy client demand.  Her clients are very pleased with her service.  Margarita dreams of having an expanded fish farm, and is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for the support she has been given.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, fish feed, fish and mollusk stock
